column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Anita, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Went to my GP with anxiety and muscle clenching that resulted from "body memory" triggered by an incident that happened when I was a young child and came up in hypnotherapy 40 years later. My body reacted very badly and it got to a stage it could not function and was in fight or flight state ALL the time though I was not  depressed. She put me on 10mg of lexapro for the PTSD, initial side effects were jaw clenching (subsided after maybe 2 months) and yawning excessively.  I did get some headaches and occassional nausea.  I have not gained weight.  Take it morning time. My body has relaxed and I've been calmer then ever I can remember.  Just completed 6 months on it and have decided today to come off it (cold turkey as no more pills and will see what happens). If bad withdrawal will go back to GP for new perscription for same 10 mg dosage.  I have been very fatigued last couple of weeks and I'm not sure this is any way related to the lexapro.  Been under a lot of financially related stress and I put my exhaustion and brainfog down to that.

column3: Hopeful1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Started on 10mg for depression and anxiety. Had the most horrible nausea, headaches, dizziness, increased anxiety, heart palpitations, shortness of breath. Week two, decreased to 7.5 mg. No improvement in side effects. Since I am very sensitive to medications my doctor instructed me to cut to 5 mg. Did so and no improvement. Can barely lift my head without excruciating pain! needless to say it has been almost a month of pure torture and suffering. Everyone reacts differently to meds, so this is just my personal experience. Works for some, obviously not all. Read these posts with caution and see what works for you, but if you experience the side effects like I did, don't wait. Contact your health care provider and find an alternative. It will get better. Lexapro just didn't work for me.

column3: livgood71, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I don't live with the constant "edgey" feeling of anxiety but have been under lots of stress the last few months which has culminated into symptoms that hit me like a ton of bricks at random moments. Anxiety while driving, can't catch my breath, palpitations. My doctor prescribed lexapro 10mg once a day and xanax 0.25 when needed to get through the transition. I have been on Zoloft for several years but have beeen off since 2003. So I knew what to expect as far as starting and possible side effects. I took one dose of Lexapro and had a pretty much sleepless night, hot flashing, anxious. Felt like crap the next day and slept on and off for most of it. Needless to say, since I am not totally debilitated by the anxiety at this point, I decided to not continue with the lexapro and only take the xanax if the heart palpitations get out of control. I think I'll stick to the accupuncture I started, regular excercise and eating healthier and see if that works :)This is just my experience and maybe I didn't give it a fair shot but its hard to deaal with side effects of starting a med when you have a fulltime job and you're the bread and butter of the household.

column10: My husband started getting very depressed about 7 months ago, he stopped doing things that he had previously enjoyed, barley left the house and was sleeping exessivly.  He became extremely irratable, mean, aggressive and miserable towards everyone.  This drug was like a miracle drug at first within 2 weeks he seemed happy again. One of my big concerns is that 3 times he forgot to get the lexapro at the pharmacy for 1 day and his mood swings were so severe! He was so annoyed, aggrevated, miserable, nasty and mean all 3 times that he missed his dose for  1 night each.  3 nights ago he missed his dose and i actually stayed at a hotel yesterday thats how bad he was.  I cant believe that missing one dose can change his personality, mood and attitude so quickly but it did! Also he still dosnt want to leave the house, still sleeps excessivly but although his personality (when he takes it every day) is so much better along with his general mood he still has alot of symptoms of depression.  We are going to ask the Dr. to wein him off this, I cant be staying at a hotel everytime he forgets or misses 1 dose for 1 day...thats rediculous I dont think any medication should have that kind of severe effect if you miss it just one time.

Snowman85, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: i have Severe panic attack disorder with Agoraphobia, basically meaning i do not leave my home, and am riddled with panic.After trying other medications, even if they helped somewhat it was never enough.i got on Lexapro 5 mg then 10 mgit was a rocky start because i got alot of side effects, such as panic attacks / insomnia / anxiety / etc.....but i used Klonopin during the side effect symptoms and after about a week or two the side effects went away and i loved it, it was almost like a cure, i found myself not bringing my Klonopin bottle with me everywhere i went, i was able to leave my home, and the panic attacks i did get were less frequent and less intense then ever.if you are able to Tough out the initial scary side effects, i highly recommend you at least give this drug a try.(the brand name Lexapro, i did NOT try the generic form)This medication if it is not covered by your health insurance is very expensive for the brand name. The generic is cheaper but i heard alot of reports that people didnt like the generic and went back to brand name.

column3: susanne, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro when a combination of life situations seemed to overwhelm and depress me - high stress job, unhappy marriage, very little personal time.  My Dr. put me on Lexapro - 10mg daily, and it really evened me out.  The problems were still there, but I could think rationally about them.  I've tried several times to leave Lexapro behind as my life is much better now, but when I decrease it to less than .5 mg, my family notices a change in my moods and energy within about a week.  Long story short, I'll probably be on it to a minimal extent forever.  Take care.

davepaul777, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Since 1994 I've used nearly every anti-depressant out there even the old ones. I'm diagnosed with Schizoaffective disorder/depressive type and psychotic depression. I was going to have ECT but decided to give the meds one more chance. Lexapro seems to work the best. However, being male, I'm have severe erectile dysfunction and no libido. The doctor said this was most likely caused by the med. So it simply was a decision I had to make. I'm single and I'm more concerned with my illness and its treatment than being sexually active. My depression if not treated often caused severe delusions that would place me in a dangerous situation. However, after all this time including a commitment to a state hospital for over two years, I was always taught by my treatment providers that depression doesn't have to be treated by a only a drug. Finding a type of therapy such as CBT, DBT, or finding a support group is very beneficial. After years of seeing only my failures and problems my therapist made look back and remember good things and write them down. Self affirmations are nice also, and a little ice cream is good too.

column3: Bonbon5, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I am writing this after being on the pills for 11 days. I will write more later, my ratings might change. I have had Generalized panic and anxiety for a long time, off and on. But somethings have happened to our family and financial problems had put me in a tailspin since Nov. Even tho, I have found some relief with Xanax (half tab of low dosage as needed) anxiety was still coming back. Shaking feeling, sick to stomach, aches and pains, headaches, heart beating fast. I did find out I have a gall bladder that is not working,so that was part of stomach problem. Anyway, I started on 5 mg. of generic to work way up to 10, which I will take tonight. I started taking pill in am. First day hour later, dizzy and thumb twitching (it did stop) and felt sick all day. Next couple of days, burst of engery then a let down feeling. Sick to stomach. Went to work, I cut hair, but felt off. Lots of leg and arm, shoulder pain. I walked a couple of days, felt ok. Then Sunday and Monday, sick, sick, stomach, pain in joints. Called Dr. We think I take Crestor for Chelstrol, that might be causing some joint pain that is making me worry and anxious, too. She said to stop Crestor, and pain is less. I took 5 mg. last night, slept ok, then this am, little light headed and sick, sick to stomach barely could eat. I take Zantac for stomach. Went to work, by afternoon, felt better. Some reason, on this pill I am sick in am, but better in pm. Tonight I am going to take the 10 mg. Wish me luck! I switch from Day to night, bc last few days, felt so tired and yawning. If the 10 mg. makes me jittery at first, will switch to am again. I am also trying to do relax techniques, reading postive things, trying to stay busy and rest also. No sleep problems on this pill. Mostly stomach acid and pain is biggest complaint. Also at times feeling more anxious. I am going to try and give this a months try to see if it helps. I do have slight muscle jerk in knees and finger. Just now and then. I pray it helps me

de, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: does not work still cry alot east set off about things

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I went on Lexapro for depression and severe anxiety.  Effexor did not help the anxiety symptoms which I have had all my life.  It is a miracle for me to feel normal in the mornings, not anxious for the first three hours after waking, and my depression is great as well.  I literally wanted to kill myself as well as all the other symptoms of depression.I would suggest giving this the full 6 weeks before deciding.  My symptoms got worse for the first 2-3 weeks and I had to increase the dose from 10mg to 15 to 20 and 20 is working so be willing to increase if necessary, as well as waiting the 6 weeks before making a judgment call.  And don't throw in the towel if symptoms appear worse before better because your brain has a lot of adjusting to do.I cannot say enough about this.  It has literally saved my life and given me my life and myself back.  I love it so much.  I feel normal, not happier or high or anything, just normal and balanced.  Still feel happy and sad when I should which I'm glad about.  Having the serotonin and norepinephrine (sp?) balanced makes such a difference in my life and I hope it will in yours too.  Don't give up!!  And if this doesn't work for you there are plenty of others that may be the one you need, but this has more than worked for me!

column3: LLL, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I began taking Lexapro after my second child was born because I seemed to be having postpartum depression. The drug was prescribed by my family doctor.I started at 10mg once per day for two months and increased to 20 mg per day for the remainder of the time.I stayed on the medication for 6 months and decided to come off of it because of the side effects. The side effects included low sex drive and an increase in appetite (weight gain of about 13 pounds). I did consult my doctor about ending the medication. I had to gradually decrease the dose and then stop all together. The withdrawal from the medication was really bad, I actually felt worse then before I took the medication. The withdrawal lasted about 2 weeks for me. I believe Lexipro worked well for me but the side effects were too much. I did switch to Wellbutrin XL and it seemed to work great and i had no side effects that i could identify. Just a little info for nursing mothers alway use caution while nursing and using medication. I had one doctor tell me Wellbutrin XL was ok and another told me not to use it. I did choose to come off of it altogether just recently. Also, be aware of what your doctor prescribes for you. I had a pharmacy give me the wrong dosage of medication, I did not know it was wrong because i never seen the actual prescription, it was called in for me. Hope this helps someone out there. Just remember medications will effect everyone in differant ways, so what happens to one person may not happen to another:)

column3: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column10: I've had two major depressive episodes and decided to take Lexapro for the last one. I have also tried Zoloft and Prozac in the past and generally do not take medication between episodes. Lexapro worked quickly and well--I felt improvements within a week and completely recovered after about two months. It's clearly effective. I do have some complaints, however: 1. First and foremost, Lexapro has a nasty withdrawal. I have never had a problem coming off SSRIs in the past but had significant trouble with this one. Tons of "brain zaps," irritability, mood swings, etc. It's a real pain to taper off. Make sure to do it very carefully, slowly, and under supervision. If you taper off too quickly, you could end up depressed all over again. 2. Sexual side effects were the worst of any SSRI I've taken. In my case, much lower libido and difficulty reaching orgasm. Most SSRIs have these extremely unfortunate side effects, but this one gave me the most trouble. 3. Dosing is a bit awkward. 10mg didn't work quite well enough for me and 20mg worked but made me feel like a spaced-out zombie. I was too frustrated by the end to try 15, admittedly, but there isn't much room for finding an ideal dosage. 4. Extremely expensive if insurance doesn't cover it. It's set to go generic this year, although I don't have the latest news on this. Every medication works different for everybody, and this was only my experience. I would first and foremost say that if you feel depressed or anxious, make sure you see a therapist and make appropriate lifestyle changes. If you need an antidepressant, I would recommend Prozac--very cheap, works for me at the minimal dose (20mg) and no withdrawal. Maybe this will work for you, but I won't be taking it again.

column3: Gentleman415, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have General Anxiety Disorder and was prescribed Lexapro 10mg after I suffered a panic attack trading stocks during the market meltdown of 08. I have never been depressed in my life but was prescribed primarily an antidepressant.  SSRIs like Lexapro are like old phone cameras. Yes they can take pictures (treat anxiety), but their primary use is making phone calls (treating depression). Benzodiazepines on the other hand are your true high quality 5, 10, 15 megapixels dedicated digital cameras (only for anxiety).  For nearly 4 years I have taken Lexapro with little to no benefit.  I have gained 25lbs despite being healthy and active and my sex drive has diminished substantially.  About 3 weeks ago I decided to quit Lexapro and my doctor put me on .5mg of Clonazipam 2x per day.  WOW I have regained my sanity and nerves.  It really calms me down in just about 20-35 min and relaxes me for about 8hrs.  Oh yeah the sex is much better already too. I am still working on the extra weight. Bottom line is if your problem is anxiety, take the dedicated medication for it. Benzos will work in minutes, not like SSRIs that work in weeks if at all. This with therapy and counseling should do the trick. Hope this helps and good luck to all!

column3: Anonymous, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: Hi, I am 18 years old and have been on Lexapro for a total of 7 years, almost half of my life. I am at 40 mg a day, the highest possible dose, and I'm just here to warn you all, the effects WEAR OFF. I was put on this antidepressant at age 11, due to my issue of dwelling on every little thing I heard (i.e. scary story told at summer camp) and a tendency to repeat phrases in my head. However, I was only 11 years old, and I have been dependent on the drug since. I got off of it for a year and was put back on it after trying several other antidepressants. This drug has helped my personality and thoughts remain stable and it is a nightmare when I forget to take it because I become very irritable and angry with everything, two symptoms I did not suffer from before taking this med. It has been a blessing but I know I would've been better off never taking it in the first place. I have mixed feelings for it because now it is my sanity pill. I am writing this as a warning to worried mothers looking to "help" their children, do not resort to prescription drugs. It has set me up for a life of dependency and seems to have caused more problems than not, as I am taking it for more reasons than I started with. If your child is suffering from weird thoughts or depression take him to a therapist, as putting him/her on meds may help temporarily but will undoubtedly interfere with their quality of life and the ability to live a fulfilled one without depending on a drug/drugs. Please take my advice. The only benefits I notice from this drug are when I haven't taken it for awhile and then resume to take it, because it helps with the side effects of withdrawal, i.e. anger, mood swings, etc.

column3: Wabe, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I love lexapro.  Although it supposedly takes time to build in your system, I felt that I was more relaxed almost immediately.  I had been experiencing fighT or flight nightmares that stopped once I started lexapro and it helped me cope with annoying, anxiety-provoking coworkers.   My insurance company suggested I try a different ssri that caused me to have an angry emotional outburst so I immediately switched back with doctor's paperwork required.  We have to pay more and my insurance makes me get 20 mg pills that I have to cut in half, but all this and it is so worth it!  It's so nice being able to sleep well and have less anxiety and irritability.

column3: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I took Lexapro for my anxiety disorder Feb. 2008-July 2010. The only noticable side effect was fatigue which was mitigated by taking it after dinner. Otherwise the anxiety became manageable.Over time I noticed that my attention suffered, it became harder to feel emotions, and my sex drive was definitely lowered. All of this was a willing tradeoff to anxiety.Keep in mind, this drug does not cure anxiety. Like it or not, it's something we will always live with. I used my time on Lexapro to learn coping mechanisms and better stress management. I decided myself to stop taking Lexapro summer 2010. If a doctor told you this medication is not habit forming (like mine did) then they weren't entirely honest. If I tried to quit cold-turkey I had moderate withdrawal symptoms. I had to gradually lower the dosage over two months, but even then I would have mild dizzy spells and developed a strange nervous tick for a month. After the withdrawal period I was fine. I then moved 1000 miles, started graduate school, and entered into one of the most stressful years of my life. The coping mechanisms work like a charm and I haven't had major anxiety issues since. However, the attention problems remain, though it's another thing I just learned to live with.

column3: (Patient)
column10: The manufacturers who market this drug have gotten in trouble for unethical marketing practices. This is the most potent of the SSRIs inhibiting serotonin re-uptake far more than other SSRIs. This causes a higher incidence of serotonin syndrome with this drug. It also causes increased side effects like aggression, apathy, and sexual dysfunction. Overall this drug is not healthy. Celexa is a far better alternative to Lexapro, which is far too potent.

column3: craftmanic, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Had problems with headaches and irritability in late afternoon and evening, as well as problems sleeping, for first month I took Lexapro. My doctor increased the dosage; it's been a week now, and the side effects are descreasing. I feel better about life; I'm laughing again and friends are noticing the difference in me. My advice for those experiencing side effects is to give the drug a chance. I hate what I call the "psychotropic nightmare" of changing anti-depressants, but it's unavoidable when you have acute, incurable depression. When it's time to change meds you just have to bear with it and give the med a chance to take effect completely, make any changes as needed, and stick with it. Good luck to you all. Depression is an ugly and frustrating disease to work with, but persevere and you will win. A good psychologist is a good idea as well. When you find a good one - talk! Get it out, get over it and go on with living your life as you never have before!

column10: I started taking 10mg when I started feeling anxious and having panic attacks at work. This would include having hot flashes, blushing.. and headaches. The first two weeks of taking lexapro I was nauseated, dizzy, couldnt sleep and no appetite. I was constantly yawning.. it does something to that area of your brain.. I wasnt tired.. but still couldnt stop yawning all the time. The medication worked well for turning off the voices and the over analyzing I was doing. I decided to go off the med in December deciding it wasnt worth being on when I go to have a baby. I had a horrible experience: really nauseas, headaches.. really bad anxiety.. irritable. . then I ended up having a cronic migraine and went to the ER not beging able to talk or see. SCARY! If you plan on going off lexapro before any big event in your life.. i.e pregnancy.. give yourself a lot of time to wean off.. its AWFUL! I was at my wits end with the way I was feeling.. and contimplated going back on just to make it stop.. Im so glad I'm not off the drug and feeling back to normal.. anxiety free!  If you plan on taking this medication for a long period of time thats fine...but for the short-term.. think twice.. I would suggest seeking therapy instead!

column3: Emily, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: This medicine started working for me in the first week.  I felt that I was able to let go of the negative voice in my head that was making me have feelings of unnecessary guilt, worry and sadness.  I smile more and am able to relax and not feel so irritable all the time.  I have had Hashimoto's thyroiditis for 5 years and have noticed that having this hypothyroid condition has made my moods more unstable.  I am so happy that I started Lexapro.  I haven't gained any weight or had any side effects on this medicine (besides nausea and feeling of fullness in ears in the first week. My whole outlook on life is positive now and I plan on staying on this medicine for at least a year.

column3: sumguystillawake, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro pulled me out of a major depression episode that almost killed me. It did work for treating my depression. I often wonder if I didn't go to the doctor when I did if I would even be alive today.  Geez, looking back it was that bad. It took me 2 attempts to quit taking the lexapro both within a 6 month period. The withdrawals were unpleasant. Today- 4-5 months later, my depression has left me, I sorted out my personal problems in my head and feel stable. Unfortunately, almost tooo stable minded, as if nothing even phases me anymore. Somewhat emotionless  lately. Also, I am experiencing sexual issues as well. Difficulty maintaining ejaculating during sex and difficulty sharing emotions with partners. This was one of the side effects that brought me to quit taking Lexapro, yet I still am experiencing the same side effects. Without a doubt it makes my relationships strange. Conclusion, I do believe lexapro treated my depression, but now I have side effects that are good reason to be depressed yet I feel nothing. Ha...how bout that!?

column3: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)

column10: Lexapro is the only medication that has helped me with my episodes. I'm not as angry when I take them. And it's been about 6 yrs or so now. But going threw withdrawls while you're pregnate has been a nightmare. I'm 35 and wasn't planning on getting pregnate. The hormone impalance and withdrawl from lexapro. OMG!! Working full time and having severe rushes from the lexapro withdrawl. I still get rushes and it's been two weeks since I took my last dose. After learning the hard way DO NOT TRY TO QUIT COLD TURKEY!!!!! And for me the main side effect was diariaha.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I loved the way Lexapro made me feel. I felt like I had complete control of my emotions, and a far more extensive range than other antidepressants had allowed me, e.g. Zoloft and Paxil. However, I am five foot three and always weighed under one hundred and five pounds, and have been very active and proud of my toned stature. In the first year I started lexapro, went from less than one hundred and ten pounds to just under one hundred and sixty. Not only was the sudden, SIXTY POUND, weight gain  enormous (despite my seven day a week intensive martial arts exercise and healthy eating) a shock), but it  happened over six months, which caused serious pressure on my muscles, skin, and general energy level. I was an extremely fit, athletic person who suddenly lost all physical confidence despite feeling emotionally great. I switched to Wellbutrin XL three months ago and have already lost over thirty pounds without any exercise, so I am in no doubt that this horrible medicine ruined my confidence, relationship, and sex life. Lexapro made exercise and diet useless, and the mere switch, even eating whatever I wanted and exercising a minimal level, led to an extreme change.

column10: I was on lexapro years ago for depression. Not long after taking it, my depression got worse. I turned to being suicidal. It also changed my sex drive to non existent. I was in my early 20's and I knew this wasn't normal. After the last and final time of attempting suicide, I finally talked to my doctor about it and she quickly took me off the lexapro. Since then, I have done better. I have personally decided to deal with my disorders without medication, which has been rough but lexapro has scared me into this decision. My 13 year old suffers from manic depression and ADHD. They are also considering that he may be bipolar. His doctor is switching him from zoloft and vyvance to lexapro and adderall. I am now afraid that this medicine will have the same affect on my child as it did me. The fact that he already has suicidal thoughts prier to lexapro make it worse. If any of you have a child like mine, I'd really love your feedback on these medications. my email is misty.bertrand@gmail.com

column3: Leah Manning, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: At first I was on lithium also, and felt like hell all the time. After stoping the lithium, due to it causing kidney insufficiency, I stopped everything for a few weeks.  Upon starting the lexapro again, after only one week I felt wonderful.  Optimistic, energetic, sleeping well,it is such a strange combination of good feelings for me because I've been bipolar with anxiety disorder and OCD for most of my 55 years of my life.  I pray this isn't just a coincidence, that it is a true and accurate depiction of what my life can be like now.  My two adult sons deserve a better  mother than I have been for all of their lives.  My husband deserves a sane wife and partner that he doesn't have to tiptoe around on egg shells wondering what is going to "set me off" the next time.  Will holidays with relatives turn into nightmares from bipolar world.  I sincerely hope and pray that the kidney disease that the lithium and hypertension caused will not change for the worse to keep me from being unable to take my lexapro.  It seems like finally, at 55 years of age I have a chance to actually be happy, and my wonderful family be able to enjoy being around. Me now, instead of waiting and wondering what I'm going to do next.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I HAVE BEEN TAKING LEXAPRO FOR 4 YEARS. MY DOSE HAS BEEN REDUCED TO.05 DAILY AS MY LIFE HAS BECOME HAPPIER AND CONTENTED THE NEED FOR ME TO USE IS IS SPARINGLY.  IT WORKED VERY WELL AND CONTINUES TO BE FOR ME. TOGETHER WITH LEXAPRO I EXERCISE 2X WEEKLY READ BOOKS FROM WANITA BYUM, TDJAKES, JOYCE MEYERS AND LISTENS TO GOSPEL AND WORSHIP CD'S.  WHEN MY DAYS ARE HECTIC I FEEL THE ANXIETY COMING AND I SLOW DOWN.  NOTHING IS TOO IMPORTANT FOR ME ANYMORE AND I GIVE MYSELF LOTS OF EXTRA TIME NOT TO BE LATE FOR  ANY APPOINTMENTS.  MY ONLY WORRY NOW IS TAKING THE TRAINS OR BEING IN A CROWDED BUS AT THE BACK ONLY. WORKING ON IT.  . MY PSYCOTHERAPY IS EXTREMELY HELPFUL AND I LOVE TO MEET WITH MY PSYCHOLOGIST.  SHE IS PARTIALLY RESPONSIBLE FOR MY 80% RECOVERY.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Depression/Anxiety associated with traumatic separation/ divorce.  I found that the Lexapro helped me to cope, HOWEVER, the Lexapro SIGNIFICANTLY increased my appetite.  (Note:  I did not have a problem with loss of appetite before taking Lexapro. I was at a healthy weight.)  I gained 25 lbs. in about 6 months which increased my pre-diabetic symptoms----The dry mouth was not a pleasant side effect....used Biotene products, small amount of relief.  Then, some months after the weight gain, I developed high blood pressure.  I tried coming off the Lexapro after taking it for 2 plus years per Dr.'s recommendations.  Did not do well. Felt like I was going to 'jump out of my skin'.  I very gradually came off the drug over a 3 month period which worked fairly well, but it was a pain.  The constipation was a very unpleasant side effect which led to hemorhoids (which I never had in my 50 plus years, not even pregnancy!) in spite of increasing fiber.  Almost NO libido, which my husband did not understand and had no empathy, but that was more his self-centered character. It definately had a negative impact on reconciling our marriage.  So, I should have tried another medication(s)...I had so much chaos at the time, I did was overwhelmed &/or did not care.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
hmf, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I began going to the church in my community when I was 3 years old. I attended there for 17 years. For 5 years I taught at VBS and after graduating high school I began teaching Sunday school, Wednesday nite classes, and I directed the Christmas play. I became so passionate about my church and I loved the children I taught. They were my best friend. Them and God became my world. In September 2010, a huge fight broke out between members of the church and I decided it was in my best interest to resign from my positions. I lost my church family, a lot of my family, and my boyfriend at the time(the "one"). I became completely depressed. I turned to food to help me feel better and I became so angry and bitter about everything. I didn't feel like going to school and ended up dropping out of all my classes Spring and Summer of 2011. I gained over 60 pounds. When I went to the doctor, my orginal request was only to check my thyroid because I no longer had any energy at all. My doctor begin to break the surface on my past and prescribed me lexapro(10mg). I am no longer depressed. I am so happy and the little things that have always bugged me, upset me, no longer does. I felt like I could move on from the things that happened. Since I have been on lexapro, I have lost 6lbs and began attending another church. I am now in the process of moving my membership there. I really feel God has allowed me this lexapro to pick me back up. I really feel it's saved my life!

column3: Lifeexperience, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been dealing with anxiety (GADS) for as long as I remember.  I was on 25mg Paxil Cr for a great 10 years then all of a sudden it stopped working for me.  Instead of uping my dose of Paxil a doctor put me on Cipralex.  Started at 10mg, felt good for a week then anxiety hit me, went up to 15mg and I felt terribly sick, after another week my GP put me on 20mg,  I lasted 3 weeks at the 20mg and I just couldn't take it no more.  I was so sick.  I didn't eat for weeks, stomach upset, nausea,headaches, jitters, crying fits, more anxiety.  I was scared to be alone.  It was effecting my home life drastically. I ended up in emergency because of extreme dizzyness and throwing up.  The emerg doc said go back down to 10mg.  He thought it was to strong.  I got a couple shots in the arse.  One for nausea and other for stomach upset.  I was advised to see my regular GP.  The next day I seen my GP (Crying the whole time)  He basically said he didn't know what to do with me.  He put me back on a low dose of Paxil (12.5) and put a requisition in for me to see a psyciatrist (which will take 2 months to be able to see one)  So now I am dosing myself out with Clonozapam (1mg twice a day)..not driving...not working.  Keeping my child home from school to look after me (not fair!) and my husband gets home as soon as he can after work at each  night. I have never felt this bad/depressed and down right scared like this before.  Hoping the paxil cr will kick in quick so my family can stop worrying about me.  Never will I take Cipralex again!

column3: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
coloradogirl, 45-54 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
Harness your Mind, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have chronic pain that I was first prescribed antidepressants for 1st was effexor I would not recommend too strong and not mentally alert.  2nd was Celexa and I did fine on it with no bad side effects just seemed to not do much for extra pain releif.  Then went to Lexapro 10mg then up to 20 mgs and have done much better on this. After years of Chronic pain I have now developed some depression and I suppose it does have some effect in controlling it but I still get times of deep depression, only beacause of the state of my life and limitations put on me not being able to life like a normal person and do all the activities I used to do and have interest in.  But you have to pull your mind together and thank God that you are not in worse shape like some others have to suffer through or live and Rubuke those thoughts of feeling sorry for yourself or cheated out of life!  Your still living right?  So live life to the fullest way that YOU can is what I have learned.  Ultimately you are in control of your mind, medication can help but it is not a cure at least for me.  But I am not suffering any mental illness like really brain chemistry imbalance where you have a brain impairment.  So I'm in the middle of the road wish I felt happier but don't know if Lexapro will do that for me.

column3: Magnolia Blossom, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

Last summer I fell asleep while driving, nearly killing us both. I gained 45 lbs and am on a constant diet but can't get rid of weight. Forgetful and unmotivated. Now I seem to be losing my hearing. Weaning off it today.

column3: bdmac, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro prescribed for depression by doctor.  It was very effective and I used it for about four years.  During that four years, I gained 110 pounds and did not even care--in fact, I cared about nothi8ng at all, or even doing anything at all.  Libdo went to absolutely zero.  Zombiefied.  Stopped taking the drug and developed severe anxiety attacks requiring another medication.  Additional negative side effects were slow but continual increasing nerve pain in feet and along the side of left leg.  Pain also began in right leg after experienceing it in left for several months. These pains totally disappeared in about two weeks after stopping Lexapro.  Evaluation is the drug does counteract depression but it can have severe side effects.  Be very careful and watch for adverse effects.  I would NOT recommend it to anyone.

column3: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I am 40 year old fit male.  I've been on 10mg of Lexapro for 2 years for anxiety due to loss of a very high income Wall Street job.  It took the edge off and allowed me to make very rational career, financial, and family decisions without unnecessary anxiety.  I have never been depressed.   Over two years, the side effects were 20-30 lbs of increased weight, and annoying decreased libido. Last week I've decided to transition to Wellbutrin XL and stop taking Lexapro.  The half-life of Lexapro is 27 hours, so I decided to taper Lexapro with the following schedule: Day0 10mg, Day1 5mg, Day2 5mg, Day3 2.5 mg, Day4 2.5mg, Day5 0mg, Day6 0mg.  Today is the end of Day6.  Ive only had two withdrawal symptoms that are minor: slight dizziness and elevated tinnitus.  Tomorrow I will begin Wellbutrin XL 100mg.  I am hopeful that Wellbutrin will have the same calming effects  and completely reverse the weight gain and decreased libido.

column3: Lexia, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I am 17 years old, and have been on Lexapro for about 6 months tops. I am currently taking 20 mg, even though that seems a lot but 10 mg didn't work basically at all. It works for me, but because of my age, it's best for teenagers to be unmedicated  in my opinion because of the extreme possible side effects it can have just taking it not only initially but if you forget to take it. Since Lexapro, I don't cry as much over small things, but big issues are still no use. I haven't had as many nightmares, but I did notice (since in the past i've missed taking it a few nights) I would get terrible nightmares, and feel so jittery  the next day that I almost had to leave school, since even though I have more of depression. Anxiety hyped me up to  an uncontrollable level. Be careful, guys. I not completely happy with Lexapro, but it does help a little more than halway so my opinion is that it is "good" but indeed no miracle drug.

KaThErInE, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: For those who suffer from moderate to severe panic disorder, I truly believe that this drug will help you as it did for me. I don't know about the rest of you, but I would get anxiety just from trying a new medication.  Which is why, since 200,7 I have been taking Ativan to keep my panic at bay. I was not happy with this at all because of it's addictive properties and it only worked for a period of time. I needed something that took the edge of the anxiety. I felt the Lexapro (10mg) work after about 7 days. I had an upset stomach for maybe the first 3 days. It has now been  1 1/2 months since I started Lexapro and I went from taking 3 mg of Ativan to .5 mg! In another few weeks I am going to STOP taking it all together! The only lingering side effect is a small amount of weight gain, maybe 5 lbs. It is totally worth it though to feel "normal". I can go a whole day with out feeling anxious! It really is a tremendous drug and can change your life if you give it the chance!

Of course responsibilities and stress crept up  and the change of Life came early. Loss of a parent due to Cancer etc. By the time I reached 48 it was full blown depression. The doctor was treating me for Menopause with Lexapro 10ml once a day and as soon as that week, symptons faded and my depression started to take a back seat to life. I have been on the Lexapro for 3.5 yrs and can say I feel Happy again. Music is sweet to my ears and life means living again.

column3: homebird, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I am 26/F have adjustment disorder (with anxiety). I have been on lexapro twice now (for a few months each time) and love it.I take 10 mg every morning. Initial symptoms (increased anxiety, irritability, sleepiness and sweating) have disappeared after a week. I can feel my anxiety subsiding after 5 days, and I feel "normal" after two weeks of being on the medication. The first time I took this was after the birth of my daughter (I was breastfeeding, and the doctor determined it was safe). I weaned off after four months (from 10 to 5 to 2.5) and had no issues. I am taking it again because of some stress in my life that triggered panic attacks.The initial side effects are difficult to go through, and sometimes it feels like it's not working (or you want to give up) but I encourage you to stick it out. Once it starts to work, you will be so glad you did. I really love lexapro. It's given me my life back.

column3: 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
75 or over Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Trying to pick up the pieces, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column10: 14 yr old son has sleep disorder from age 2. Lack of sleep caused performance anxieties leading to depression. Pediatrician prescribed Lexapro. Coaches reported he seemed more relaxed but at home he seemed to no longer care about anything, or anyone. Personality change, lost all empathy,became mean, agressive, and violent. Side effects included extreme fatigue, which made anxiety and depression worse, weight gain, agitation, dizziness, light-headed, tingling. Couldn't get up for school, confrontational with teachers, GPA drop from 3.989 to 2.929. Weaned off over 1 month, immediate improvement but personality changes still remain to some degree. Devastating effects on entire family and almost destroyed our business at same time. Drs should not prescribe to youth and should be more aware of physical and mental side-affects and provide more warnings. We force our kids to keep taking when they complain because Dr says to. I'm thankful we didn't end up with violent or suicidal actions. I'd rather deal with the original problems vs just covering them up and dealing with the even worse side-affects.

In 1994, I started taking Klonopin. 2 1/2 years ago, a new Dr. reduced my Klonopin by 1/3 and started me on 10 mg of Lexapro.Benefits----1. almost no panic attacks in the past 2 1/2 years, and no worries or fears about public speaking or other causes of the panic attacks.2. No immediate side effects after initial dosages.Longer term Side Effects------------------------1. Trouble sleeping at night - wake up many times during the night and then have trouble waking in the AM.2. Gained 15 to 20 lbs and have voracious appetite.3. Initial sexual side effects but subsided after a few weeks.4. VERY VIVID and LONG dreams (they are actually quite enjoyable)5. Recently been experiencing memory loss and absent-minded-ness ( this last one is very concerning).HAS ANYONE ELSE EXPERIENCED the dreams and memory loss?

column3: Brittney, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column10: I have been on this medication for about a month and a half to two months. It has definitely helped with my depression, anxiety, and mood swings. column3: WJN76, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: OCD - obsessive anxiety - Wow, talk about making a remarkable difference. My quality of life improved one billion percent. I no longer dwell on anything, no anxiety, I am now very patient, calm, even tempered, happy, happy, happy, and my confidence is stronger than ever. FYI - I made the mistake of buying a generic from oversees and relapsed...oh my God that horrible, horrible nightmare returned until I reestablished on the brand Lexapro. I shed a tear for myself and others who know how little help we receive from our family and friends at our most critical time of need. my love is with all of you. OCD and anxiety...I rather have someone break both my arms rather than have another OCD relapse. Lexapro allows me keep on living - - a fully passionate, compassionate, and happy life!!!

It's been very scary and I have found out that all these drugs can cause breathing problems.

column3: blabber 151, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: 26 year old female diagnosed with GAD. After 2 years of talk therapy and no improvement in my constant high anxiety, I agreed to see a psychiatrist. I thought he'd give me something like Xanax. He recommended Lexapro and I was initially extremely reluctant to get on a long-term drug. I finally agreed and am SO glad that I did. After only about 2 weeks, I already began to feel so much better. It's as if the background noise in my brain stopped and I could think clearly again. I took it for 9 months and was feeling so much better I decided to stop (without consulting my doc). Bad choice. Within 5 months I was an anxious, irritable mess again and went back on. Also upped my dosage from 20 mg to 30 mg. I've been back on for 4 months and am again feeling amazing, able to cope with daily life, keep things in perspective and I feel happy! I would highly recommend Lexapro to anyone who is suffering with anxiety that interferes with your daily life.

column3: cupcakelover, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I am beginning to feel better; much calmer. The only thing that I have bad to say is the tiredness that I feel all the time, which is impacting my ability to work. Sex drive could be affected however it was already affected before I started the medication anyways. Talk to your physician, not all medications are going to work for all people. Period.

column3: bru, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: when i am not taking this i am very withdrawn and antisocial

column3: exParaeducator, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I was originally prescribed Lexapro during cancer treatment while working in a warzone called middle school. I was told it would help with symptoms of sudden menopause brought on by my cancer treatment. It didnt. To my detriment, it enabled me to remain in a dangerous work environment for longer than I could have withstood it otherwise. I experienced many of the main complaints that others report including massive weight gain, total loss of libido, suicidal ideation, screaming nightmares, hypervigilance, and rages.  I also experienced severe withdrawal on two occasions. Once I could not get my medication on time through the mail order program I was forced to use. And once I left town without my medication. I became ill within hours of missing a dose and for three days was too ill to get myself back home. My symptoms included nausea, vomiting, the shakes, cold sweats, loss of coordination, and diminished cognition. I was given Lexapro in combination with other drugs, first one and then another, but Lexapro was the main one for an extended period. At one point, I was given dosing instructions for extended release capsules on a prescription of short acting tablets of Effexor. I had severe problems while on these drugs, ending up in the ER twice with symptoms of cardiomyopathy brought on by severe anxiety. Its a wonder I lived through it. Im not sure I will ever fully recover from it. My career ended as a result as did my sex life and my enjoyment of many activities I used to love. I am living a diminished life due to depression and anxiety and a new doctor wants me to try Lexapro again. I have decided not to risk revisiting that awful experience. For me, depression and anxiety are preferable to being driven stark raving mad due to having my brain chemistry altered, perhaps irreversibly, on drugs the effects of which are poorly understood at best and have the potential to cause irreversible harm at worst.

column3: jackie Moore, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column3: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was suicidal.There was not a day that went by that i hadn't thought about killing myself.I self injured and i just wasn't happy.about a week after taking the pill,i was already feeling happier.3 weeks into taking the pill and i feel so much better.i never think about killing myself and my parents have seen a noticeable change in me.i have more energy,i go out more,i smile more,and i'm motivated to be healthier and all.i've seen so many bad reviews on this drug on this website but it has tremendously changed my life in an incredible way and i couldn't be more thankful.

column3: Kreet, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I've had bouts of anxiety most of my life. I've had good luck with prozac in the past. After months of severe anxiety (years without meds), I finally went to the doctor. I told him I wanted prozac though he recommended lexapro. I started with 10mg daily, in the evening. My anxiety level was higher than ever. 10 days later I went to 20mg with no positive results. After a month with lexapro, I have now switched to prozac. As soon as I weened myself off of lexapro (no prozac), my anxiety went away completely. I am also going through counseling, to rid myself of the anxiety for good. These drugs are like putting a band-aid on a gaping wound. Therapy is the best way to learn to deal with things, hands down. The biggest reason I wanted to go with prozac is the price and how it worked for me in the past. A 30 day supply of lexapro is $35, while a 90 day supply of prozac is $10. Still, lexapro did nothing positive for me at all, even though my dosage was too low for anxiety. I also have a supply of xanax (.5mg)and use it sparingly. Get counseling!!!

pd, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: This was given to me by my family dr. since she was getting free samples. I tried and after a few months it did help with lots of syptoms (depression, anxiety, hot flashes, etc.). I decided I  needed to get off and start feeling life again. The drug just masks a lot of problems. Getting off after almost 7 years was HELL! I have been sick with flu-like symptoms for 9 weeks. I have to force myself to eat a little several times a day. The nausea has subsided but the anxiety, sweats, diareah, lightheadedness, and depression and wanting to end it all has not gone away. Thank God for my family and His help as I continue to reach full mental and physical health. I would never recommend this to anyone! It is just too hard to get off of as I am sure the company making it knows. It is also very expensive so they want us to be addicted to it. I am trying to gain knowledge of what foods and nutrients I need to overcome this. Oh, and I did gain about 40 pounds over the 7 years. Over 20 of it has gone in two months, but I feel like a starved animal that can't eat. I wonder if this is what anorexia feels like?

column3: Mello, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: The first week of lexapro was the hardest due to the side effects of nausea and dizziness.  But the results were immediate.  I have been taking it a few years now, and I have taken dosages from 10mg to 40mg.  I am back down to 20mg a day and holding.  I have gained weight while taking it.  I have come off lexapro twice for about a month each time only to recognize that life is better with it.  My doctor switched me to prozac in the beginning, but I quickly knew that wasn't a good fit, and he put me back on lexapro with a dose increase.  Life has been great after that.  To those who say that lexapro caused personality changes, I would say keep trying other meds.  I had that reaction to prozac.  Everyone's system is slightly different and will respond to a different med.  Keep trying meds until you can look back and say, yeah, life is definitely better with ---.  For me, life is better with lexapro.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
aryal, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I suffered from anxiety disorder and panic attacks for almost 2 years before my amazing Dr. prescribed me Lexapro. I was unable to drive which changed my life completely. But after taking this drug for 4 months, I am getting back to normal. I drove for an hour for the first time in 2 years. 20mg of this magic pill has changed my life for better.

column3: (Caregiver)
column10: This drug caused my relative's personality to change. He went from a sweet, loving person, to a mean crazy ogre when he took this. Not only did this drug cause him to gain weight and completely change his appearance, but it also caused his to act like a completely different person. This really hurt his kids and family. He would constantly get angry about everything, randomly shun people. It was disturbing. His personality did a complete 180. This drug also cause him to start drinking later on to cope with the stress this drug made him feel. Overall it was a terrible experience. The kids are traumatized and so is everyone else in the family. Oh, and these were given to him as a sample from the doctor.

column10: Was placed on 10mg for anxiety attacks.After 6 months did not work so increased to 20mg.  Works great for anxiety but side effects are feeling of "skin burning" and WEIGHT GAIN.  Gained 30 lbs in 1 and half years. Emotions are better controlled though. Wondering which is worth more:losing weight or stable mind?

My father was given this after my grandmother died. It completely changed his personality. Before he took it he was a sweet, loving person. This drug made him into an aggressive, "zombie". (Along with many other terrible effects.) Please stay away from this drug! There are better, more effective, older drug alternatives that the pharmaceutical companies aren't pushing, This is because the pharmaceutical companies can no longer make money off of the old drugs so they invent or slightly modify other drugs and market them as more expensive. Lexapro is an extremely horrible drug. It makes people aggressive and changes personalities for the worse. Stay away. There are multiple lawsuits against the makers of the drug "Lexapro" (Forest Laboratories) for deceptive marketing and others for horrible, negative effects of this substance. Please find other, FDA approved, tried and true, alternatives to this terrible substance (under the care of a good quality physician). Thank you. I sincerely hope that my voice is heard! :)

I also know that there are multiple legal cases against the company that makes this drug.

column3: maggie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column3: Lionheart, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Lexapro changed my life. I use this primarily for anxiety, and secondarily for depression. As I went off to college and began my life on my own, I realized how much anxiety I have and how difficult it makes life. I dropped out of college twice due to my anxiety. I had such terrible social anxiety that if I missed a class, I would be too afraid to even ask my teacher about what I missed. This would lead to an endless cycle of missing class and being to afraid to attend again. It also would lead to a helpless depression. I never went out or made new friends. It sounds stupid to be "afraid" of social situations, but it was ruining my life. Until I tried Lexapro, I had no idea how much anxiety I really had. I discovered that my life was being controlled by my anxiety. I couldn't even make phone calls to talk to people I didn't know or approach people, even in a professional setting. I couldn't get a job because I was to anxious to even go into a facility and ask for an application, let alone have a interview. I am now working full-time and going to college full-time, and have not had anxiety since I've been taking Lexapro. This medication has really been the best thing I have ever taken. The best way I can describe this medication is if you imagine having a light switch in your brain for anxiety/fear, and this just switches it off. I haven't had any negative side-effects from this, and only have good things to say.

column3: LULU, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column10: ANXIETY AND DEPRESSION

column10: I first started taking this in college after being diagnosed with GAD. I was having a hard time concentrating on the LSAT, so the doctor prescribed Lexapro for test anxiety. I was also prescribed Adderall for concentration, which has been the only thing that really helps. Unfortunately, the anxiety was still there. It did help with my moodiness, and I even took an extra dose during my period to help with my PMDD. I don't recommend this for people with high anxiety, but it did seem to help balance out my mood levels.

column10: I have suffered from anxiety attack for years and was put on Busbar, very little help here, then was prescribed Lexapro, what a God-Send. I would like to lose the weight, but I cannot go back to the panic.  I guess I will just have to deal.  I am 66 years old and now I am fat and happy - if I die tomorrow, I will be grateful for the life that lexapro gave back to me.

column10: I have been on this for a month now. I started taking it because I am going through a divorce and it was hard for me to deal with. I have lost 15 pounds in a month, can't fall asleep, have no sex drive, difficuly orgasming, sometimes feel spacey and am nervous about going off of it eventually after reading the withdrawl symptoms. Part of me wishes i didn't need to start taking it but i think i am better off with it then without it at least at this point in my life.

I'm able to live again.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I was placed on Lexapro after the death of a family member to whom I was extremely close.  Had problems dealing with the loss.

column3: nana, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have been on for 5 days and can already tell a difference.  I don't feel like i see two people looking at me in the mirror.  One of them I know and the other I don't.  Today we stood there together.  It is the first day of the rest of my life and I have a lot of live to look forward to.  A 1 year old grandson that is the apple of my eye, his mother and my son in law that i love and adore.  A new grandson coming in June and a son and daughter and in law I adore and love them.  I told my son, this is the first day of the rest of my life and I know it.  There father and I are divorcing, which we really don't want to to.  I have 2 months to fix that.  But my top priority is to get right with my kids, kid in law and granchildren.  The are my life and together with there help we will make it.  I have a 50/50 chance with there dad - 50% we can make it work and 50% chance I won't want him back.  I feel better today after only taking it for 1 week than I have felt for a very very long time.  I am on the road to recovery and it is leading me to greener pastures.

column3: grandma68, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: My Neurologist prescribed this for me over a year ago, because I had been taking Prozac for over 15 years and obviously its effectiveness had worn off and I was depressed and crying at everything.  I have had no problems with Lexapro.  I take a lot of medications because I Multiple Sclerosis, sleep APNEA, Heat Problems, High Blood Pressure and numerous other medical problems.  My Primary Care Doctor tried taking me off of Lexapro and put me on Venlafaxine, but I had so many problems with it that I went back on Lexapro.  I am completely satisfied with it for my depression.  It is not a wonder drug and there are no wonder drugs.  Some people will have problems and some won't, but it works for me.

column3: LinC, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: It took two months for Lexapro to "kick in" fully, but once it did, I felt like I got my life back.  I was VERY reluctant to go on an antidepressant, but I got to a point where I would try just about anything.  My symptoms were:  sleeplessness, loss of weight, loss of interest in just about everything, nausea.  I was a mess.  I have been on Lexapro for eight months now and feel better than I did thirty years ago.

column3: 4x4diva, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: i have been taking lexapro for a month now and it had seemed to work great for the first three weeks, but now onto the 4th week i am feeling back to where i was before, emotional, crying, angry, aggitated, suicidal. When i was hospitalizedi was on zoloft (horribe drug) then they put me on lexapro 10 mg 1 time a day. I find that i need to take my medicine the exact same time everyday for it to be effective. I experienced nausea for the first week but it went away. Eating the medicine with food helped as well. I was taking 4 other medications and the hospital took me off of them and started lexapro a day after my admission. After being on lexapro for a month i feel that tired, i wanna sleep all day type of thing, i get upset very easily, but i have had a very tramatic 2010 so hopefully i can pull it together here and keep on truckin! I plan on asking my dr. if i should go up maybe to 15 or 20 mgs so i can get some energy. i sleep all day and stay up all night because of anxiety,and when i sleep during the day its always in and out, never a deep comfortable sleep. The medicine has kept my weight at a stand still which is beneficial because when i was on all of the other meds i was gaining between 5-7 lbs a month. Overall i plan to give the drug more time to work, and hopefully when i get some energy to get a job again and live that normal life that everyone with depression would give up their arm for. The winter blues don't help the depression situation either. Hope this was helpful to all of you.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: This is an excellent medication for treating depression.  I have experienced depression for over 20 years.  This is the only one that finally made me feel "normal".  I stopped getting angry over every little thing, I stopped worrying about minor things, I was very happy.  I have since weaned myself off of this drug, it has taken over 9 months.  It is VERY hard to get off and you need to be committed to weaning yourself very slowly.  It will make you crazy if you don't.  The reason I am weaning myself off of this medication is for two reasons.  The first being that I have gained over 10 pounds on the 5 years that I taken it.  I CANNOT lose weight no matter how I eat or exercise. It has affected my metabolism in some way.  The second reason is that it has affected my libido in a negative way.  I have very little interest in sex.  It has not affected my ability to climax, but just the "getting going" part.  I am now realizing that I still need medication, my irritability and anxieties have returned.  I need to find something that will help me without the negative side effects.

column3: SOS, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro is a very good medication. Ive been on it for over a year. The side effects are too much though. Ive gained 20 lbs and am always tired. I plan to switch, but think it is a good medication to try.

column3: sap2491, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro has given me my life back. Around this time a year ago, I was in an ambulance on my way to the hospital for an overdose and alcohol poisoning. I had to leave college, and entered a period of several weeks during which I could not even bring myself to leave my bed. I was diagnosed with Major Depressive Disorder and Anxiety Disorder, put on suicide watch, and prescribed Lexapro. Today, I am happy to report that I have found myself again. I work at a job several days a week, I go out with friends, and I am applying to transfer to a new college. I haven't felt the hopelessness that I used to feel in many months, and I consider myself a content person. This was by no means an easy or short road. Lexapro is not a magic pill that will have you waking up the next day smiling like Vanna White. It took several difficult months of adjustment, and it's not a pill that works for everyone. I still have sadness and depression occasionally, like any person will. It doesn't interfere with my ability to live a happy, successful life anymore, though. I know that I will also face difficult when weening off the medication, but I am prepared for that. The most important thing that I have learned from this is that there is never a reason to give up. Depression doesn't define you, and it isn't forever. Your life isn't blanketed in nighttime like you might think, it is actually just a cloud obscuring your sunlight, and it's ok if you need a little help moving out from behind that cloud.

column3: Brunelie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have Bipolar 2 with excessive Hypomania. Lexapro made me EXTREMELY suicidal and was the only drug that ever did. If yu take Lexapro, make sure you arent manic bipolar.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column10: I was tired all the time.  Gained about 25 pounds. I was on Lexapro for 2 years.  I stop taking it felt better and loss the weight.

column10: I was having severe panic attacks, would wake up after two or three hours of sleep in sheer panic, they would come like waves. This medication stopped all this. And I feel "normal" again.

column10: I have been on Lexapro since 2002- about 8 years. I started on 10 mg for 5 years, and although , i was relulctant to increase dose to 20 mg in 2008 I did so , due to increased anxiety, It took a while to get adjusted to the 20 mg , but once I did , its seemed to help reduce the amount of anxiety and worry.  I seem to have ADD also, but that could also be caused from the Anxiety. I hate to be on Lexparo for the rest of my life, but it seems that might be the case. As others have said, its seems to be about the best SRRI out there.  Any one gone above the 20 mg dose?

column3: sonyacoogler, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: i can honestly say this med. has saved my life!!

column3: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Lost in California, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: Have taken Lexapro for 8 1/2 yrs. Worked very well first 3 yrs.  Depression and major insomnia returned 2 to 3 yrs ago. Tried to wean myself off but could not so went back on Lexapro Nov. 2010. I have uncontrollable crying spells, sleeping only 2 to 4 hrs per night, waking up 3 times.  Hair loss last 8 years.  Now have bald spots in front of head.  Don't know what to do.  I am so exhausted and depressed. Depressed over daughter's incurable disease. If she dies, I will probably jump off the nearest bridge.

column3: midwest, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I resisted taking medication at first and the stress of adopting two older kids finally got to me. I started on 10mg and felt spacey so dropped to 5mg. I have been at this dose for 2.5 years. I have been pleasantly surprised at the result - I know I am "on" something but it does not get in the way of my daily activity. I am able to let go of hostile situations more easily. I am able to "choose my battles" easier. It gives me a bit of a pause button so I am not so quick to become overwhelmed, sad, upset, angry. I still do feel these emotions, just have more control of them. I once forgot my medication on a week long trip and the withdrawal was tolerable, but I would not recommend it! Several times throughout the day I would get some flashes behind my eyes and the world would seem to vibrate for a few seconds, then it would pass. As far as starting the drug or changing the dose, "they" say that the drug takes 2 weeks to take effect. Maybe in most patients but not this one! No kidding, I increase my dosage to 10mg and I feel it within hours. Now I increase my dose to 10mg for a few days around my cycle and it helps with the severe PMS/PMDD I experience. Maybe all in my head? I chart my cycle and there are many more PMS-induced arguments when I don't take the increased dose! The only bummer I can tell is low libido. Yeah, BUMMER. Well, the price of the drug is another bummer. As a cost savings I tried something similar - a generic called citalopram - it was AWFUL! It made me feel more than spacey - very messed up and more emotional. Good luck!

column3: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I first took Lexapro from 2004 - 2007 due to physical reactions to extreme stress.  I probably shouldn't have taken it then, but my Dr wanted to try it and see if chest tightness, panic attacks, and thumpy heartbeat went away.  I did notice very vivid dreams during the first 2 weeks on it.  The dreams weren't scary, just very very vivid.I stopped Lexapro in 2008 and experienced some withdrawl symptoms, the worst being the "brain zaps", feeling like electrical jolts were running through my brain.  That lasted about a week and then went away.I recently went on Lexapro again in 2010 for anxiety and depression and the return of physical symptoms (thought I was having a heart attack, but it was anxiety).  Upon starting Lexapro again, I didn't have any vivid dreams but my physical symptoms went away.Now I take 10 Mg/day and, while the physical symptoms are gone, my mood is rather neutral, rather than happy or sad.  Also, libido is very low.  Weight gain has occured, even though I don't really feel hungry most of the time.However, while some of the side effects annoying and bothersome, not to mention the cost of the drug, Lexapro has been very helpful in getting me out of the hole I was stuck in.

I am now on week 5 and I feel like myself again. No real side affects thank goodness - I do get aggitated and yawn more for some reason (but thats something I can put up with. column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
F'ed Up on SSRIs, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was struggling more with anxiety than depression at the time, and on that note, lexapro seemed to work pretty well for a while. However, my depression eventually relapsed, and despite continually upping the dose until it was past the range of tested clinical efficacy (40 mg), I was still depressed nearly every day for two months, characterized by low energy and motivation, as well as occasional, fleeting suicidal ideations. I was prescribed bupropion to take in conjunction with the lexapro, giving me substantial increases in energy and motivation which I felt that lexapro had sapped from me. However, bupropion did nothing to fix lexapro's sexual side effects, which had once been mild but were now approaching borderline-impotence. I decided that I'd enough of this; thus, I tapered off the lexapro over the course of a month, during which I experienced persistent "brain zaps", increased agitation, lowered energy, lowered concentration, suicidal ideations, and derealization.  However, once the influence of this horrible substance had completely left my system, I began feeling back on track with the bupropion. I still suffer from depression but I'm much more functional, focused, and motivated than before.  In conclusion, Lexapro did nothing but potentiate my depression.  I will never put another SSRI in my system again.

You get weird brain buzzes, and my hands and feet go numb, and I get dizzy. But that's if I miss 3 doses or more in a row. column10: Increased depression/anxiety upon start-up of Lexapro.  I moved from 2.5 mg to 5 mg two days ago and I was crying/angry/severely depressed within a few hours.  Nausea, too.  I'm used to this side effect because I felt the same increased anger/anxiety with both Zoloft and Wellbutrin after about 4-5 days, so I'm really going to try to stick with it to see if symptoms improve.  I'm frustrated that I don't seem to respond to these meds well.  I just need something to work.  I could barely leave the house the past few days.  I'll give it another 2 weeks (maybe) and if symptoms of anxiety and anger don't improve, I'm giving up on Lexapro, too.  I'm willing to put up with this very temporarily, but I was honestly doing better BEFORE starting Lex than I am now.  This med is still better than Zoloft, which was a nightmare for me.  The best drug I've been on so far (for me) was Pristiq.

column3: Travel RN, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I am 53 years old, 5'2"tall and weigh 98 pounds. I am an RN and it concerns me to add more medications to what I am currently taking. I have adverse side effects from many medications and with this mostly all of the antidepressive/anxiety medications that my physician has tried over the last 11 years.  I am currently taking only adderal and clonazepam for my depression and anxiety; the adderal I know is not a conventional tx, but due to my sensitivities to it has proved to be a good option. I have developed increasing episodes of anxiety and difficulty with concentration when I am anywhere but at work. I've resisted adding any further medications for quite sometime, but can no longer do that as I don't want s/s to manifest themselves when I am at work. I agreed to try Lexapro as it is 1 that I had not tried yet.  I have only been taking 5mg at bedtime for about 2 weeks now. I don't think that there has been any changes yet. I know that a true trial will require more time on the medication. So far, I have noticed no side effects. Why can a person not regain the seratonin that is reportedly lost with depression?? If your blood count is low or blood chemistry is off it can be replaced.  Why not seratonin?? I would like to not be taking any medications at some time in my life. What is on the horizon in the treatment of depression?? I want to get off medications.  I am otherwise healthy.  Technical and rock climb, back country backpack, hike, and other outdoor activities.  I do have phototherapy at times during the year.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I only subscribe to holistic medecine, but when my fiance abruptly left me after four years together, I found natural medicine wasn't enough for my anxiety and depression.  This drug made it possible for me to carry on--no more shaking or uncontrollable crying.  The doctor says I need to be on it 9 months total then try to get off it.  Side effects like being tired all the time were bad in the first few weeks but then tapered off.  Once the very stressful times were gone, I was tired again and had short term memory loss.  The doctor says I could probably decrease my dosage now but he wants to leave things alone through the holidays.  To me the benefits of this med outweigh the costs.

column3: bodawg, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was prescribed Lexapro for anxiety. I took it the first night and the next morning I had pins and needles.  I suspected I had a reaction to other medications.  However, I continued taking Lexapro for a week before stopping.  After another week, I returned to my doctor and reported the problems.  He told me there should be no problem with other medications and to start it again.  I did, but with the same results...pins and needles.  I stopped again but then started a month or so later only to have pins and needles again.  I stayed on Lexapro for about another 2-3 months.  I used Percocet to help control the pins and needles.  Those two drugs became my daily ritual.  However, I moved from Lexapro to Xanax and found a lot more relief while still using the Percocet.  Later, I also developed burning sensations.  I now have all three--pins, needles, and burning sensations (PNBS), a new acronym.  I have tried incessantly to get rid of these problems, but still have them.  I basically live on oxycodone (Percocet without the Tylenol) at least 3-5 times a week with an occasional Xanax.  I've tried every herbal known to man with little success.  I contacted the makers of Lexapro to ask for a solution, but their cop-out was that my doctor would have to treat me and that they could do nothing.  Now I see why people sue pharmaceutical companies.  Good luck on Lexapro.  But, if you experience PNBA right away, my advice is to stop it immediately and never return.  The PNBA is horrible!

column3: miagrrl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I was prescribed this a few weeks ago, after my buspar alone was no longer controlling my anxiety and I was beginning to show signs of depression. This medicine has made my moods much more stable, and I am much more calm- I still get anxious, but I feel on lexapro I am better able to cope with it. I feel happier, and I have little more energy. Also an unexpected result, I suffer from chronic neck pain, but it's been completely gone since taking lexapro! I've read studies on antidepressants treating pain, and I guess that's what happened!
