column3: Sadie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was diagnosed last winter with depression and social anxiety. I am also an alcoholic. My Dr wanted me to start with 5 mg and after a few weeks move up to 10. At first it was great but when I went up to 10 mg I had the side effects of sweating at night, vivid dreams and heavy menstrual periods. I felt zoned out too. I even had a major panic attack so I stopped taking it. Well the feelings of anxiety and despair came creeping back and I started drinking again. A few months ago I decided to quit drinking for good and I started 5 mg of Lex again. No symptoms this time! After a month I went up to 10 mg and still no side effects! I feel great.. no social anxiety! I am finally able to live, for myself and my children. And I am proud to say that I am 3 months sober and I believe the Lexapro has helped. The only downside is that I have heard the withdrawals are terrible. Someday I hope to be able to wean off of the meds but for now I am enjoying life again!

column3: J.R. , 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column10: Do not use for elderly patients especially if they cant have blood thinners or have problem with bleeding ever.  My mom is 87 yrs old and had to have blood transfusions twice with the total of 12 pts first time and 8 the second time a month later. Since being off the medicine totally she has not had one bleeding espisode not even a drop of blood in GI track/rectum. This drug is dangerous and should be given a better warning lable than is on there now.  I almost lost my mom in Nov 2009 and Jan 2010 before I took her off meds and told doctors I was 100% sure that was the problem.  I am not saying it is not going to help for some but not for seniors who have possible underlying conditions.  I would not want anyone to go through what I and my families have gone thru because of this. It also effected her brain function and now her memory and able to talk (slurring her words) and her gait is off really badly.  Pain mgmt dr presecribed it to her for pain not for depression.  It did take some of pain away but damaged her brain in the course of treatment.

column3: newlife, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Anxiety and almost purely obsessional OCD had been literally ruining my life and making it impossible for me to live a normal life. Lexapro has, for all intents and purposes, given me my life back. It isn't 100%, I still have intrusive thoughts from time to time, but they are much easier to manage and have minimal impact on my day to day activities.The side effects were minimal and didn't last more then a month or so.

column3: Happy Grammy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro for 3 yrs.  I was having major panic attacks and was prescribed Paxil.  After 2 yrs on Paxil I was dead inside.  I felt like a zombie and had sexual side effects.  I decided to stop taking it and after a few months I was feeling those old feelings creep up again.  My new Dr. started me on Lexapro 10mg.  What a difference.  I had no sexual side effects and actually lost a few pounds.  I evenutally moved up to 20 mg but have recently been taking biodentical hormones and that has enabled me to go back to 10 and hopefully to 5 soon.  I believe that middle age women should have their hormone levels checked because I never experienced these symptoms till the "change" started.

column10: I was given this medication for major depression when my life and my marriage started to fall apart as my ex did the trade in for the younger model...and I wanted to die. The Lexapro is a great help. I did sleep for nearly 3 weeks while adjusting, putting up with quick dizzy feelings shooting through my head but that did subside.I have moved on with my life and I am naturally happy and no longer wish for death so I went off the drug. I am having a serious withdrawl problem when I was told there were no side effects or dependency problems So I started the "weaning" steps. I fall over, I have shooting dizziness again and it makes me feel very ill. I hope that "it" will stop within 3 weeks. I also had to stop this medication as my ex took my insurance away from me and I am 100% uninsurable due to 2 declineable diseases and I cannot afford this drug. If there were a generic, I would stay on it only because of being so sick trying not to take it anymore. Great Pro's to this drug, but a huge price to pay coming off of the drug thus explaining the satisfaction rating.

column3: antzrus, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I've used 20mg daily since its introduction in '02. It continues working just fine w/out pooping out nor needing a dosage increase. I started at 20mg because when Forrest introduced Celexa they said 20mg was the average dose-it was later proven that 40mg was the average effective dose. Over the years Lexapro has also shown that 20mg is the average effective dose. Sex drive can be an issue if your relationship is based on same. On the other hand, the love drive on this med increases significantly. If you were severely depressed and unable to eat/losing weight-you will regain your appetite-weight. If you were moderately depressed and over eating you may slow down and lose weight or not sometimes. Aerobic exercise will help w/the depression and the weight-but you have to "Just do it!" Yeah, procrastination is a big part of being depressed... Oh yeah, don't use ANY depressants (i.e. opiates, cannabis, benzos, alcohol) at all-at all (!!!) if you expect the stuff to work.

column3: Becca, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I have been treated for panic ddisorder, depression, OCD, since I was 28. Now 53. Same Dr. for all this time. He tried everything. The ones that worked really well had side effects such aas too agressive, (Iwas very sensitive before), weight gain on another, prozac did not do much. Dr. put me on Lexepro and it has worked much faster and worked great. I only have problems when I go off of it due to thinking I am o.k. now, sometimes can't afford it, no insurance,ect. This drug has worked better than any without side effects. If I stop taking it I get weepy and anger easily. I would reccomend this to anyone who see's that it is helping them. It worked pretty much right away for me. I also have been on xanax for 25 years for panic disorder. If it works, don't try going off of it unless Dr. tells you to. I maake that mistake a lot, and it has caused problems. Cheemical imbalance runs in my family, and I will always be on meds. Before Lexepro I had 3 suicide aattempts, last one they brought me back twice. No probleems or even thoughts since Lexepro. Hope this will help someone.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I took this med for about 3 1/2 years in varying doses according to my doctor's recommendation.  I gained about 30 pounds over that time period.  I finally decided to go off of it, because of the weight gain, it was not helping at all, and it was in fact making things worse.  I weaned myself off slowly.  The withdrawal effects ARE TERRIBLE.  Weird head 'zapping', dizziness, nausea...I could go on and on.  After almost 3 weeks off of Lexapro, I am starting to feel normal again, and have lost 11 pounds.  I would NOT recommend taking this drug.  The side effects while on the drug, as well as the withdrawal symptoms, made taking Lexapro a bad experience.  I am sad I wasted over 3 years of my life on this medication.

column3: momof3, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have never taken any meds in my entire life. I rarely ever take antibiotics and cant stand people that medicate every little problem they have.  But, after a devestating divorce I found myself severely depressed and for the first time asked my doctor for help for what he called "situational depression."  Initially, it made me feel horrible, panicky and unable to sleep, but was told to at least give my body a month to get used to it.  Within a couple of weeks, I felt calmer, happier and less stress.  As my body got used to the drug, I was able to sleep better and actually lost weight on this drug!  I would absolutely recommend trying it.  AFter about 8 mos., I decided to get off of it and found it very difficult!  Severe dizziness, crying spells and sadness.  I tapered slowly and side effects are gone, however I feel depressed again and debating about going back on this med.

column10: I was working as a hospital chaplain and 1  of our young chaplains was disoriented and in the ER.  I visited him for several days before he died.  I had to have a security officer standing behind me.  Because of the stress I developed severe heart attack symtoms.  Since I was in the hospital already I went to the ER to be checked out. I have been taking 10 mg of Lexapro and 10 years later I have worked as a hospice chaplain and addiction counselor and have not had another attack. I think it helps me feel more calm.  My daughter who is a social worker in child protective services also takes Lexapro and we feel it has helped us cope with our tough jobs and not feel anxious.

I have noticed that sometimes I am more obsessed with organizing things and stressing if things aren't in there place which isn't normal. I have to wait another month and go back to the doc.  I hope it either starts working or I can switch to something that actually works. Maybe my expectations are unrealistic.  But feeling alittle better would be better than nothing.

column3: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro a few years back for both depression and anxiety during a really tough and stressful time (sick parent, job transition, dating issues). I was in a really bad place at that point and Lexapro was a last resort (never thought I'd ever need a pill). The initial symptoms of dizziness and increased anxiety were a real pain and it took almost a month before I started to feel better. To make matters worse, it hurt my libido too. But I stuck with it and it eventually did have a very positive effect on my life. The only easy part was actually when I stopped taking it cold turkey after a year and felt zero side effects. Score!Once again I've been going through some moderate depression/anxiety and am starting to take it again. My overall depression and anxiety are milder this time and I'm noticing the benefits almost immediately with only mild dizziness right after I take it. i hate the idea of taking these pills but I'm getting over it because they definitely help.

column3: Katie2650, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I took Lexapro (10mg daily) for almost 2 years.  It helped me control my depression and anxiety.  I knew that I had to ween off this medication slowly; I had taken other SSRIs in the past (Paxil, Zoloft) and it is NOT a good idea to stop all at once, you need a plan to ween off these meds.  I started to ween myself off and had terrible side affects - dizziness, a strange head zapping feeling and increased anxiety.  I decided to stay on Lexapro awhile longer as I was busy with work and travel for my job and couldn't deal with a dizzy head.  A few months ago, I slowly started to ween off again.  My doctor told me to cut the pill in half and take 5mg each day, then after 1 week take 5mg every other day, then every 2 days.  I took it even slower and took 5mg every other day for 1 month until I felt I was ready to stop completely.  I had the same side affects - dizzy head, zapping feeling in my brain, weird body aches.  I stuck with my plan and after 2 weeks, the side affects completely disappeared and I felt completely normal.  I have not had any issues since.  My advice is to ween off slowly and stick it out if you have some mild side affects from withdrawl, because they will go away.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have tried many different antidepression medications over the past seven years.  Lexapro finally give me a new view on life.  I do not worry over everything and all my suicidal thoughts have gone away.  But, I ran out of this drug for a few months and the withdrawl systoms were terrible.  My legs felt like they were running all the time, I constantly had spasms when I would go to bed, this lasted for a couple of months.

19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I was givin a two week trial of medication for MDD and Anxiety. I took the medication at 6pm after eating dinner and almost immediately felt ill. Went to bed to sleep through side effects, but woke up at 11pm to the room spinning. It was so bad I had to crawl to the bathroom to throw up. The entire next day I was sick to my stomach and unable to keep any food down, extreamly dizzy, and I had a horrible headache and could not take pain reliever due to drug interaction warning. I thought my body would get used to it by the next day, so again at 6pm I took the 10mg dose and tried to quickly go to bed. I had difficulty getting to sleep, staying asleep, and night sweats both nights. Woke up for work at 3am vomiting again, the same headache and inability to keep food down, but now I had developed shivers (teeth chattering) and excessive sweating. I feel like I have had the worst flu of my life for three days and am terrified to take another dose. That said, I was involved in several stressful situations at work that would normally have me totally anxious, and in a ball crying at home, if not at work, but i haven't broken down at all since taking it.

column10: Within days of starting on Lexapro 10mg I started having headaches pretty much daily.  When being on the medication for two weeks I suddenly became very dizzy and went to ER vomiting.  ER doctor decided it was due to the medication and said to quit taking Lexapro and the dizziness should go away in a few days.  Medication for nausea and dizziness given but did no good.  The next day the vomiting stopped, but the dizziness continued and I had to stay in bed with my eyes closed to tolerate it.  On the third day I went to my regular doctor who agreed that it was from the Lexapro and I should be back to normal in a couple more days.  So far, not the case.  The dizziness is a little better and I am no longer vomiting, but I am unable to focus on things for very long.  I am too dizzy to drive and am not sure if I can work tomorrow.  This has been a terrible experience.  I have taken quite a few different anti-depressants with no reactions at all.  This is very scary.

Reduces my anxiety as well, even when I do get anxiety while taking this drug, it is not nearly as severe as without. I have used alcohol moderately with this drug as well and seen no real problem. I only have between 2-4 drinks a few times a week though. All in all it's a useful drug in my opinion. I have seen the wieght gain but it is only moderate and can be avoided with exercise.

column3: rhinoback, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I started using this drug about 4 years ago after having a panic attack at work. Before that I was all stressed out and had high anxiety.  At first the doctor prescribed 10 mg of Lexapro.  While Lexapro didn't totally eliminate my anxeity it made it very manageable.  It allowed me to function well at work and school. I no longer had panic attacks, heart palpatations, eye twitching, insomnia or a general fear I was going to die.  After a few years I did up my dosage to 20 mg because of more stress.  The main thing was keeping my anxiety manageable, which Lexapro does for me.  This drug turned out to be a miracle for me and my family.

I have been taking 10 mg for around 4 months.  I am having trouble with bloody noses and severly dry skin and being itchy from the dryness.  In my opinion this medication has not helped as much as I was hoping.  Sometimes I feel like it may have actually increased my anxiety some.  These are just my opinions.

In my opinion I was hoping this medication would help me more.  When I first started taking it I noticed a cold/burning sensation in my nose and eyes, slight headache, and some stomach upset.  My axiety seemed to increase some, too.  After a few weeks this seemed to go away.  Now I am having very very dry and itchy skin.  I have also started having a bloody nose.  I cannot tell that it has helped much with my hand washing ocd.  I am taking 10 mg once a day and now I am not sure if I need to increase my dose or change to something else.

column3: bluesail2681, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column10: please be aware of side effects of any med u take. be proactive in your care. For three years my mother suffered from a fever of unknown origin. Tylenol,ibuprofin nothing could brak the fever. i took her to multiple doctors specialists. and talked her into several procedures including bone marrow biopsies and polyp removal in her sinuses to try and get rid of this debilitating fever,malaise, fatigue and weakness.she lost 30 punds and nearly died of dehydration.After the 20th dr said he coulnt help and she told me she was ready to pass and couldnt live like this anymore i looked lexapro up in a drug book and the symptoms she had were listed. she stopped taking lexapro and the fevers and other symptoms went away. no dr bothered to look up side effects of this med and my mother almost left us. this is not a common side effect. lexapro was the miracle drug for my own depression,i wouldnt be here now without it. just please be aware of what you are taking and possible side effects. we cant leave it all to the drs we must be our own advocates in our healthcare.  Lexapro is an effective treatment for most people. This message is out there in case anyone is suffering like my mother did and is searching for answers because the drs have let them down.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: i am 7 months pregnant. took 5 miligrams one time and had panic attacks. threw up one whole day. severe heartburn that made it so i could sleep for 3 days. i was the worst experience i have ever had. i am done with this medication. basically had 3 days of hell.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have been suffering from Anxiety/Depression all my life. It was impossible for me to feel happy even when nothing was going 'badly' in my life. Finally, I sought help and was prescribed Lexapro. The first week I would wake up with dry mouth, migraines, and felt nauseous. I stuck it out though, and the side effects subsided within a week. Now, I have been able to function and reason through my problems without all the anxiety that I previously attached to them. Instead of going through the motions of being 'normal', I actually feel good. It's not a wonder drug in that it takes away your problems, but it gives you the boost you need to rationalize and work through issues. I can honestly say this is one of the best decisions I've made for myself, and I will continue my treatment.

column3: Sunny Teacher, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I didn't know what to expect when I started taking this type of medication.  I was first perscribed Zoloft and was experiencing some side effects (headache, upset stomach) and I didn't know if it was working to help with my anxiety and depressive sypmtoms. Maybe a little I thought, but I just really wanted to stop feeling down and hard on myself.     So I switched to 20mg of Lexapro and it was something completely different.  It is amazing to understand what happens when you find the right medication that works for you.  I am feeling so much better and am thankful to be a happy person again.

column3: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
John, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was prescribed this medication by my doctor after being diagnosed with General Anxiety Disorder six months ago. Lexapro has completly changed my life for the good!I take 10mg each day. Upon starting the medication, I did vomit the first day and then felt nauseous each morning for about the first week. After that all nausea feelings went away.The 2 major side effects that I suffer most from with this medication are increased persperation and problems ejaculating. I sometimes have twitches, but usually right after I wake up. Sometimes concentrating is hard, especially when multi-tasking. Occasionally, I experience forgetfullness like walking into a room to get something and not remembering what it was when I get there.I have not experienced any issues with weiht gain, regular nausea, or night sweats. I actually feel that I get a better nights sleep since I have been using Lexapro. As mentioned, my persperation level has increased especially when I am active. (sports, exercising, etc.). Ejaculation has been prolonged and sometimes never, since I have started usage.It does not seem that alcohol consumption  intensifies the effect, but I only drink socially. My doctor said this would be the best medication for a person in my age group with the least amount of side effects and referred to it as a "chill pill". Things that use to irritate me, seem to not bother me at all now. It just rolls right down my back.Prior to taking my first dose I read the reviews here on Web Md, and was a little hesitant and even scared about taking it. After the nausea and sick feeling I wanted to stop after the first few days and stuck it out. Give it time to get into your system and start working. It only took a week for me. Everyone around me that knows I take it can see a differnce in my personality. I went for about 3 years before I spoke with my doctor about anxiety issues. I could not imagine living like I previously did. Lexapro is the best!!! Highly recommend!

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
happynow, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro has drastically changed my everyday interactions and mood.  I used to go to a "dark place" very frequently during my adult life.  Whenever I was happy, I was the life of the party.  I could always be social and entertaining if alcohol was used.  Now I can have fun without it.  My days are so much more under control. My marriage was threatened because of my unpredictable behaviors.  I would be gleeful one day, and overspend, then be withdrawn and silent for the next week.  I really believe that there is a chemical reason for the behaviors that lexapro controls.  The only negative is that since I have been taking the drug, I have been drinking beer more heavily than ever--almost daily.  Once I get started I cannot stop until bedtime.  I have a bit of a sexual dysfunction as well.  Sometimes it is difficult to maintain an erection.  I'm not sure if it is from the medication or the drinking.  I wonder if the medication enhances the addictive behavior regarding the alcohol, and if so, would another SSRI possibly work as well with less side effects?  I know I should talk to my physician about this, but I am ashamed to talk about the addiction. Even so, my days are so much better, I feel contented. Little things that used to bother me, just don't now.  It's funny, but if I forget to take the lexapro, I can really feel a difference in my mood and interactions with others.

column3: lcl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column10: Worked in about a week, ease of depressive symptoms, less anxious. Side effects were: headaches, sweating, nausea (take with food),short term memory loss (felt like scatterbrain sometimes), insomnia if taken at night, and sleepiness if taken early in the morning. So, mid day worked a little better but still with the other side effects.

column3: Katzan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Worked almost immediately.  I feel "lighter," less anxious, more relaxed and in control of my emotions, thoughts, and actions.  No unpleasant side effects for me; although I find that taking Lexapro upon rising in the morning is most effective for me.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I havent been on this med in 2 years, and i only took it for about a week (i was prescribed it at the hospital right after I had my son for post partium depression). Anyways, they started me out taking 1/2, once everyother day for 4 days, then take 1 a day (to build it up in my system). Well, two days after i started taking a whole pill, i guess it built up enough in my system because i had a MAJOR reaction to it. My husband thought that i was high or something (and i felt it), i couldn't take care of my week old son, i felt terrible and just wanted to die. We couldn't figure out what was wrong with me, but luckily my mother-in-law was also on it and had kept the paper explaining the effects of an allergic reaction. I was shaking uncontrolably, felt as though i couldn't breath, wasn't able to hold myself up, it was bad. Anyways, my hasband took me to the hospital, they left me in the waiting room for 2 hours and i just got worse. We ended up leaving to go to another hospital, and on the way drop our son of to his sister. She called the ambulance to meet us at her house, and when we pulled up, i got out of the car and ended up falling on the ground (basically blacked out). The ambulance showed up right after and put me in and gave me that epie pen shot. It helped instantly. Anyways, i'm not writing this to say that it's a bad med (it worked wonders for my mother-in-law), I'm just writing this to warn people to watch out for a reaction and to get to the hospital immediatally if you feel off like that. I hope no one has to go thru that pain, but i do know that it happens, so be careful. I hope this helps at least one person.

column3: Dee, 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column10: This medication was so effective and eased my stress level along with decreasing my anxiety.  I have social anxiety and panic attacks although I no longer use this medication because I do not need it.  If I start to feel anxiety coming on I will request to be put back on this medication.  When I am on this medication it is for a few months out of a year then I no longer need it but another reason I dont stay on it is because it is very expensive and I already take enough medication.

column3: Susan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: This medicine should ALWAYS be taken at night. I have been on it for 6 years. My doctor diagnosed me with a seratonin deficiency. She suggested that I take 1/2 a pill for the first week as it could cause nausea. That worked for me. I never have had sexual side effects either and I think it's because I take it at night. 10mg dose made me tired all the time, so I asked my doctor if I could just take 1/2 a pill. It controls my depression and I am not tired from it. The one thing I do notice is that I am not as motivated to do things as I used to be. I don't know if it's my age or the pills. All I know is I used to cry about everything and now I'm a much happier, easy-going person. It's a great medicine.

column3: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Wantagh Wife, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was on this for about 3 1/2 months. Wonderful at first!, I was way more easy-going. got along better with my husband, no longer got upset over all the little things or brooding over bullshit. The BEST part was I was no longer screaming at my 6 and 4 yr old kids(still hate myself about that), i stopped losing my temper over nothing, slowed down to enjoy them and stop demanding perfection   and precision  from my children. Then I also stopped having orgasms and no longer wanted sex at all really. Still loved the intimacy but could care less about intercourse. My husband said,"oh, come on, its a small price to pay to be happier" (he wanted me to continue)"your so much easier to get along with, its been great!" Yeah great for him, but it sucked for me to have my head in the clouds yet dead from the waist down at 40. I dont know I still wrestle with going back on to be a better mom, thats my real only goal. Yet my marriage was like living with a buddy cute, but NO interest in sex. Husband complained I was so "asexual, its sad" yet pushed me to stay on drug anyway to be "happier" Im disapointed it didnt seem a fair trade off, im too young to not want to feel sexual, but my kids are growing fast and I dont want them to only remember an uptight mean mommy. Still contemplating going back on. BTW had no bad side effects going off, I tapered well.

column10: Before I started using Lexapro I had terrible panic and anxiety feels, which in turn lead to depression. It put strain on all my relationships and life in general. The first week of taking Lexapro I had problems with being extremely tired and just sluggish but now, just a week later, I feel GREAT! Obviously these kinds of medications work differently with each person, but I would strongly recommend it. Everyone who knows I am on can tell a huge difference, and I can too. Another great thing about it is that despite common rumors, it doesn't turn you into an emotionless zombie. It just returns you to how you would feel when you're happy and full of life. I'm really please with Lexapro and hope that everyone who tries it has similar results to mine. Good luck.

column3: jazz1910, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: Is this a joke? This stuff worked great until I couldn't orgasm (are you kidding me?), had severe short-term memory problems, vicious headaches related to any protein I ate, intense homicidal thoughts, GERD, hernia, osteoporosis and soft, mushy, girly skin. So I got off of it and then my head felt like it almost exploded. Literally I had this horrible, intense pressure inside my head and I got numerous dilated blood vessels and red dots all over my body but especially on my face and left side of my neck. I also got intense chest pains and burning skin (pure torture). My left leg wouldnt stop shaking. My left eye muscles kept twitching continuously. I spoke rapidly. I couldnt concentrate on the simplest things and make any healthy decisions. I had severe insomnia, paranoia, severe inner tension, severe restlessness, severe fatigue and my depression and anxiety were now 10 times worse than before I ever took this stuff. I have never had any of these symptoms before I took this drug. I followed exactly my doctors instructions about how to take it and how to get off of it but it didnt make any difference. When I told him about all the withdrawal symptoms he gave me the usual stupid doctor CYA response, it must be something else and I have never heard of this. What a moron. I just got off this stuff and two days later my head explodes and his idiotic logic is that something else out of the blue descended on me to cause these problems. Is this the best doctors have? You cant be serious!!! I am better off taking cocaine than this stuff.

column3: rockki, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Lexapro is a permanent life long cure for any depression if you can survive the treatment.  I was prompted by a marriage counselor to go to my doctor and request drugs for my OCD symptoms (checking, intrusive sad thoughts, previous eating disorders as a teen and heavy drinking-probably perpetuated by my fathers suicide in 1981 while he was on imipramine and numerous other psych meds)  I went to my husbands pcp who never met me before.  He gave me a depression self-test and diagnosed me with depression and anxiety, and then prescribed me Lexapro and Rozerem since I had a terrible insomnia problem.  He also decided it was a good idea to start kissing me and grabbing me in his office.    The Lexapro did such a good job getting me up and doing things, lots of things, but unfortunately, I believe it also may have made me nervous because it raised my blood pressure from its usual 120/80 to 145/110.  I was really up, up, up.   I could drink twelve shots of straight liquor and still be walking around for hours.  This was the busiest year of my life.  I managed to get 2 DUIs  4 drunk in publics and an involuntary commit for suicide, attend 2 rehabs, a hypnotherapist, weekly ASAP programs, all while working full time.  During the course of my medical treatment,  I was seen by 3 psychiatrists, 4 doctors, and numerous counselors.  Most of the follow up treatment involved numerous more drugs, anti-buse, campral, and Buspar.  All of which I had to stop taking  due to side effects such as full body tremors and falling down.   Finally, after the second DUI which I was also charged with a felony for pinching a police officers butt, I decided maybe I should stop taking the Lexapro b/c I seemed to have developed some obsession with alcohol and I could see I was also becoming delusional.  So, while in jail, I requested no more medication for 1 week and was able to fully withdraw from Lexapro, although the depression side effects of the withdrawal lasted about three months.  I met

column3: Smiling Grandmother, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I've been reading all the comments and wondering if anyone else is experiencing inability to focus on important matters. And short term memory loss.  I have been taking this drug for over 3 years.  I needed it to survive severe grief.  My son and daughter-in-law decided to never let me and my husband see our grandchild again.  I was unable to perform tasks, couldn't be around happy people, and I couldn't look or go anywhere my grandchild would like. The grief was unbelievable.  I was taking care of him 24/7. My daughter-in-law is a borderline personality. And my son did anything to make her happy.Lexapro helped me function.  However, now I am experiencing inability to focus normaly and my memory scares me. I wake up in the middle of the night regularly.  Sex is history.  I can't wait to get off it now that I am coming back to life.I have gone to court and won in 2 states and have been visiting my grandson in Texas.

It did not happen over night.  I am a satisfied customer.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I was one of the people who had an adverse reaction with this treatment, make sure you talk to your doctor more about the product and possible side effects.  I had an episode where my heart was pounding and I was twitching and experiencing black outs and having to use the restroom frequently.  Before this all started I thought the drug was helping. I know these side effects are rare but for someone who is taking this for anxiety and have this happen increases anxiety issues greatly, and now makes me afraid to take any other medications.  I hope this medication helps you and you do not have a bad reaction, I just advise you to know all of the possible side effects before taking this drug.

column3: hatemeds, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I was told that Lexapro would solve my insomnia problem; I would sleep like a baby.  I was also told that it would make me a happy camper.  Instead, it reduced my nightly sleep from a solid 3 - 4 hour stretch to maybe 1 - 2 hours a night!  After a week, the total loss of appetite and inability to eat or drink ANYTHING (everything tasted like cardboard and the smell of food repulsed me), along with the hand tremor that developed, forced me to stop taking it!  My life had quickly become worse that I could have imagined.  I had NO ability to focus on ANYTHING.  I had no emotions.  The sleep deprivation was killing me.  It took over a week for my body to fully recover from the side effects.  Then I was told to try Celexa.  That produced increased insomnia, only now instead of feeling on a caffeine high, like I had with Lexapro, I felt like when you have a stomach flu.  I tossed and turned and was unable to even rest in bed.  Now the doctor wants me to try Zoloft.  I am losing patience!  These drugs are making me think that my "normal" depression is better than all the side effects of using medication!

column3: Nadine R, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have been using this drug for 2-1/2 years.  I never knew that it wasn't normal to worry so much.  I thought I was just a worry wart and that not sleeping due to worry about money and health and what-if's was normal.  Finally, when my son became very ill, I mentioned it to my doctor and he put me on Lexapro.  My life changed.  I still worry about things from time to time but the difference is I worry when it is appropriate, not for no reason.

I could not understand why it was not working until my doctor said that it was a long term side effect that impacts 25% of patients.  I wish I had known because for 4 years I have attributed my weight gain to laziness or lack of discipline (even though I maintained a healthy diet and exercised regularly).  I am looking forward to either stopping Lexapro or switching to another anti-depressant.  The weight gain has affected my self esteem significantly!! I am not comfortable in my skin.

column3: Zoloft Fan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Dr. started me on 5 mgs. daily and then was to increase to 10 mgs. after one week.  The day I was to increase to the 10 mgs. I wanted to die, not due to depression, but due to being so sick and getting physically sicker every day.  I instead went to the emergency doctor on call (it was during the 2009 holiday season) and he placed me on Zoloft.  I did not continue to get sicker each day, but a tiny better.  It took over three weeks for all of the Laxapro side effects to subside.  Seems my body is allergic to it and taking it made me feel as if I was slowly poisioning myself.  Even when someone says the name of the medicine, I get nauseated.  Doing way way way better on the Zoloft for the present.

Doctor gave me Paxil (10mg). I took it 3 days and stopped. It is now a week later and still can't climax. Is this normal? Hopefully this side effect will go away. I hope it is not permanent. column3: wingandaprayer, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have experienced depression on and off for decades after a violent rape and battery. After my hip rebroke from the original battery in my middle years I became non-functioning. I have taken Wellbutrin, which killed my sex drive and made my heart pound. Prozac made me loopy. Wellbutrin began to help within days with a 10 mg dose. I now sustain on 30, and have a GOOD life! While I ended up partially handicapped from a botched hip replacement. my attitude is very good, I am happy and cheerful, and enjoy everything. I did not gain weight. It does make me sleepy and not quite as alert, but I take that over panicking any day. I am kind and play with my children, able to deliniate issues FAR more quickly instead of being floored by them and take a plan of action. My short term memory has taken a hit, so I work on that. I am 49 and a mother of 4, including a toddler. I can remain calm when things get stressful, and as a result can move myself into a healthier place mentally or physically if need be. I can quell the panic before it begins. If someone needs IMMEDIATE results, I recommend this med highly. I could work again, and enjoy life. Sex is affected some, but again - it's way better than panic attacks, and I can rein in my thoughts and feelings so that I don't over=react.

column3: pwolf, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I have 2 main side affects, NO SEX DRIVE and really really bad sweats.  I take this at night and some nights I have sweated so badly that I have puddles of sweat dripping from around my eyes.  As a 38 yr old woman who has had a partial hysterectomy I thought it was early menopause but I now know the sweating is from this medication. My dr originally put me on anti-depressants to help with my pain as I have arthritis in my spine and fybromialgia. I have been taking Lexapro for 1 1/2 yrs. It worked well to help battle the depression, but I dont see that its doing much to break the cycle of my pain. I am also not happy with the total lack of sexual desire. I hope this helps anyone who may be suffering as I am.

column3: iamoknow, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: suffering from depression, this really helped in that aspect.  It made me feel "nothing instead of pain"  I would come right and out and say to my husband, I don't care.  It didn't matter what time he got home, I wasn't worried about where he was or whether he was with someone else, I just didn't care.  And I liked not caring instead of hurting all the time.  BUT THEN I WOKE UP:   40LBS HEAVIER!!! That I did care about.  You talk about depression.  HELLOOOOO!!  So now I am on wellburtrin sr (the generic) and it's working great.  I lost and didn't care that I lost my "sex-drive" with Lexapro also, and that is back with wellbutrin sr.  If you like not feeling and you need to gain some weight, this is the one.

column10: LET ME MAKE THIS CLEAR: LEXAPRO BROUGHT ME BACK TO THE LAND OF THE LIVING.ever since puberty, i became increasingly introverted, depressed and frustrated. because of my deep introversion and ambiguity to work friends and family i began to slip away from the world and i totally shut off. after being fed up with depression i got my parents to take me to my Dr. at first i was put on buspar which only exacerbated my depression. after 2 months of that, he put me on this miracle drug.i have never felt better in my life. i am regaining all of my friends, i am regaining all of my confidence and most importantly my family.lexapro saved my life.

column3: Happy Lady, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I started Lexapro 20mg for anxiety and panic attacks two months ago. The Doc increased my dose to 30mg because the anxiety level was increasing after one month. I absolutely LOVE this medicine. It has made me feel so much happier and laid back about everything. No more anxiety or panic attacks and I sleep very well. I feel very calm. In the beginning I yawned a lot, felt tired,and had zero ability to have an orgasim. But after the first month I no longer have these side effects. It does take more effort to have an orgasim but it's worth it to have the peace in my life. I highly recommend this medicine

column3: Danielle, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: After leaving my daughter's father... I had severe anxiety and depression. I was put on prozac for a month and hated it! I lost 25 lbs in 2 weeks, never slept and shook constantly. I feel like it hasn't taken away from my personality and has made me a lot more patient and calm. Just hang in there the first few weeks. It will work!

column3: Michelle, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro 6 years ago. It saved my sanity. I had been depressed for as long as I can remember. Suicide was part of my daily life, literaly. I saw doctor after doctor before actually being diagnosed properly. I am a firm believer in prayer and natural remedy's, but as the year's passed the depression worsened, so I contiued to seek help. I was told so many times, "There is nothing wrong with you".  I finally was diagnosed and started on Lexapro 10mg. It took 3 to 4 weeks before my depression started to subside. I have tried to go off of it on my own, and the emotional roller coaster would start again. I have my life back, and I am very greatful and thankful. I can't believe it took so long to be diagnosed and be able to be happy and enjoy life. It litarally saved my life.

column3: suzeeq, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: notS.A.D, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have suffered from SAD (seasonal affective disorder) my whole life and decided to do something about it this year. My doctor prescribed Lexapro and I'm feeling like myself again! My energy is back as well as my motivation! My anxiety is down so i've been able to rely less on my lorazepam. The only side effect I've experienced from this medication was i felt lightheaded the first week i took it, but that faded. Now i just have a muscle tightening in my jaw (similar to lock jaw but less severe) This lasts anywhere from a few minutes to an hour or so. But I'll take that any day compared to the symptoms of SAD!

column3: hust, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column3: Obamageddon2010, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro did a good job with my anxiety disorder. I am not really a depressed person, just anxious, so I can't say if it does anything for depression or not. I will say that it caused me to have depression because of the side effects. I gained 40 lbs in less than 3 months, I lost all my sex drive and ability to climax and I was always tired....all the time. Not just sleepy, but exhausted feeling. I went off the Lexapro and it took nearly a year for my sex drive to return and it has returned, but not to what it was before I took it. I still have not been able to lose the weight even though I exercise an hour a day and jog 5 miles a day. It just will not come off and I do not eat that much. My shrink says it changed the make up of my motabolism and I may not get it back again. Great! I have gotten energy back again. I am not tired anymore and I require only about 5 hours of sleep a night now and I feel fine. One really good thing for me was that Lexapro had no ill effects coming off of it. I just weened myself off by taking a pill every other day, then one every few days then one a week and then none. I could not even tell a difference at all. I am on no medication now. I had gone on the generic brand of Wellbutrin and that was a horror story. Worse drug ever. So I am winging it alone now and doing fine. I do keep Xanax on hand in case of emergencies, but so far so good.All in all, Lexapro is probably a good drug for a lot of people, just be aware that you may gain weight, you may experience loss of libido and you may feel tired all the time. But that was just what happen to me and we are all different.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
ifeelfine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Question for those who have stopped taking lexapro.Ive been taking it for 4 yrs now. Went from 10mg-30mg. Last Friday, I decided to stop. 1st couple of days weren't bad. Today, I had to come home because my body was "tingling" all over. I feel queasy for 15 mins in the morning right around the time I would take the meds. Did anyone else go through this?  How long did it last? I'm not depressed anymore & I don't want to go back on but the w/drawing has been horrible.

column3: ncinsfl, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I very quickly came out of my down mood. I feel that this product would have worked good for me. Except: While on it for less than 10 days, I had a Migraine and took Excedrine. Within 2hrs felt a sharp throbing/pulsing pain in my stomach between the Breast-Bone and Navel. The pain felt like someone was ringing out a towel (but my stomach was the towel). It would hurt for about 5-15 seconds, then it would completely stop for 10-15 minutes. Made worse by eating.I've never felt anything like this before.Since I've stopped it, it took about 3 days and now I have no pain at all.Not sure if it was the Lexapro or the Excedrine Mixed with it.

column3: Joy pika, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro is the greatest anxiety medicine. I have no negative problem with lexapro. http://www.antidepressatscomparison.com

column3: ray34iyf, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Went on 10mg of Lexapro to combat severe side effects of depression and anxiety caused by the harsh drug Accutane. Felt ok most of the time over the first few months but it's been hell ever since. Constant feeling of being on edge, severe anxiety, brain fog, tremors 24/7, mood swings, zaps, fatigue, irritability, the works. Tried to taper off this summer but went way too quickly. The month I was off was like something I've never experienced in my life. Never before contemplated suicide before this drug experience. Unbearable anxiety and depressive spells came harder than ever. Felt absolutely poisened. Went back on 10mg and am currently taking a break from weaning which I plan on doing over a long period of time. This drug has at times totally stolen everything I ever knew about myself away from me. No emotion, no sense of humor, no personality. Absolutely hell. These drugs should only be used as a last resort, and even then, it's sketchy. There are FAAAAAAAR better ways to combat anxiety and depression that are side effect free and actually cure the problems. These drugs only mask, and they are handed out like candy.Reconsider your approach to these pills guys! You're not solving anything and you're setting yourself for hell down the road. Societies "pill popping" approach to treating has to stop, because not only is it bankrupting this country, it's putting thousands and thousands of people through hell.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Was skeptical about going on an antidepressant to begin with as I am a sufferer of panic disorder and everything seems to freak me out, but once I stuck with it I was greatly benefitted. The benefits outweigh any side effects (which were almost none at all) and I am so happy that I have stuck with it! Has seriously changed my life. I'm no longer a prisoner of my own home and a lot of my anxiousness about situations has subsided. My relationship with family/friends/boyfriend has improved ten-fold as I am not constantly in a state of fear and can be more relaxed and happy around them. I recommend this drug to anyone suffering from depression, ocd, panic disorder, or any anxiety related disorders! Lexapro is truly a lifesaver.

column3: rockstar, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: Having suffered from depression since the age of 11 I was finally diagnosed at the age of 37 - since then I've tried numerous meds - Paxil (the worst muscle cramps, headaches, pain ever!), Prozac etc. etc I ended up on Lexapro. I went from 10mg to 15mg with 150mg of Wellbutrin - Lex makes me sleepy (I could sleep for 17 hrs at a time AND go back to bed an hr later & sleep for another 17hrs no problem!) so my Doc put me on the Wellbutrin which has counteracted the sleepiness. My sex drive is almost entirely gone, I have severe hoarseness but that is it - I haven't gained any weight - I also can't have even a sip of alcohol - beer, wine, vodka - nothing at all w/o throwing up. After not knowing what was wrong for almost half my life the almost total loss of my sex drive is a very small price to pay for happiness. I would recommend.

column3: Gilda, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I've tried Zoloft and Paxil before taking Lexapro.  Stopped each because of head zaps and dizzyness. I've been on Lexapro 10 mg for almost 5 months.  The only side effect is insominia.  I turn out the light at 11:00 at lay awake until 1 or 2 - which is a distraction at work.  also have night sweats but that could be due to menopause.  I would recomment Lexapro above Zoloft and Paxil but i'm really not certain that it is helping be that much.  I feel okay - but still have anxiety at the thought of traveling, vacations or doing anything out of my routine.  I'm still not thrilled over anything in life and don't have any great highs - but no great lows either.  All and all - i don't know what i think.  I know before taking Lexapro i decided that once i started, i would not stop.  The withdrawls from Paxil and Zoloft were both very debilitating and i'm afraid to go through that again.   I will stay with Lexapro - and hope i continue to do better and feel more interested and excited about life.  Good luck to you too.

column10: I started the 10mg pack. I took the first pill and threw up a few hours later.Felt really weak and loopy. Then my anxiety level shot up and I had diarrhea all day, felt so depressed and couldn't get off the couch for days. I had to take 2 Klonopins just to keep my body from trembling from anxiety. column3: MizerbleFuqtard, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Started at 5mg in AM for social anxiety & minor depression.  Within 1.5 hours I was feeling euphoric, which lasted a few days.  For about 10 weeks I felt like I had an armor and could deal with any social situation, then the armor started deteriorating.  A couple of triggers later I spiraled into a major I DONT CARE ABOUT ANYTHING depression.  I felt I would rather die than deal with the holidays and my birthday.  Doctor increased the dose to 10mg two weeks ago.  That combined with a long over-due visit with my therapist snapped me out the funk.Now I'm back on track and more in touch with my needs and desires, healthier (increased) sense of entitlement, and the anti-criticism armor is back defending me against both internal and external, real and imagined, criticism. ...and yes I do take credit for making positive changes in my life.  A little medical help doesn't hurt!Side effects - euphoria, slight intestinal discomfort (couldn't tell when I was actually hungry), facial muscle tension, hot flashes, delayed orgasm (actually a good thing), increased physical endurance (probably a result of sleeping better and eliminating self doubt)

column3: amber, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: i toook two pills and vomited twice after each pill

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
ztrooper, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have had wonderful results from this medication (10 mg).  I have been on it for 3 years due to anxiety disorder.  I didn't gain any weight from it and I went off of it with no side effects when I got pregnant.  I used to have a nervous tick in my right eye when I spoke to people I didn't know.  That was gone within a month. I don't get antsy and fidgety anymore and I can relax in a crowd. My subconscious yelling at me for what I did 10 years ago finally subsided. I was borderline anti-social.  I love this medication it has change my life for the best and I don't ever plan on going off of it unless my insurance makes me. My insurance would not cover this drug for about 6 months and I went off and changed to Zoloft and another drug that were totally ineffective. That time I had no real side effects either that I could blame on Lexapro.

column3: justjamie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: good

column3: Vicki, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro for about 8 years now. I have what has only recently been categorized as Bipolar Depression. I am bipolar but my main symptoms are depression. I have brief bouts of mania but overall am mostly depressed. This medicine works rather well for the depression; however, my mania/rage is not very well contained. I have made diet/behavoiral/lifestyle changes to compensate for this and my life is now pretty well balanced. It does take some time before you are adjusted and see satisfactory results(6 months-1 year). After so many years on it, I am noticing that I have gotten "ditzy" and forgetful, but that is still better than constant suicide attempts and crying nonstop. I was an extremely detailed and almost ocd person before and now my standards of organization and scheduling are more lax. Still, better than the alternatives...

column3: HotFlashMama, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I started taking this medication for hot flashes at the suggestion of my Family Medicine doctor.  He works with a doctor who treats women for breast cancer and she says the first thing patients do when they come into her office is to throw away their Premarin or any and all female hormones and start on Lexapro for their menopausal symptoms.  She says, "female hormomes cause breast cancer".  I tried 10 mg first and felt this was too much.  My doctor said, "half it" so I did and I am one happy camper.  I was flashing all day long before.   I mentioned this to my OB/GYN doc the other day and I could tell he thinks this is for depression but when I tried to explain, he cut me off.  So sad for those taking cancer causing female hormones because this is the greatest remedy for hot flashes that ever came down the pike!  Spread the word, save your girlfriends!

column3: Maria, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I started Lexipro at 10 mg few weeks ago. The first week  I had pretty severe headaches, trouble sleeping, dry mouth and a 'loopy' feeling. A colleague of mine, who was also on this medication, told me to hang in. I listened and am now feeling  great. Lexipro has  taken the edge off. It has not changed my basic personality but I feel better able to cope and deal with tough situations. I have a significant family history of depression. My father committed suicide and my grandfather suffered from what they called back in the day a nervous breakdown. I was resistant in the past to taking medication but when I was hit recently with depression where all I wanted to do was sleep and had to drag myself to work, I knew I couldn't just snap out of it. So far so good.

VeternarianHopeful, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: My doctor prescribed Lexapro for me to help combat my Generalized Anxiety Disorder. We had tried Celexa and Prozac before this. I had no beginning side-effects with this medication and for the last two years it had helped calm me down and it helped greatly reduce my levels of anxiety, which were through the roof before I started taking medication. The only two things I hate about this medication are these: One, it is ridiculously expensive. $90.00 for a months supply. And two, I have been severely affected by the side-affect known as Anorgasma. I have had no interest in sex while I have been on this medication. It has  helped calm me down, but it has also calmed everything else, which is not something I can live with for the rest of my life. Especially since my husband and I have only been married for 1 1/2 years.

column3: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

The depression is gone, but now its difficult to maintain my migraines. But... the depression is gone at least.

column3: angel43912, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: one hour after taking started feeling shaky, jittery, feel like Im bouncing off the walls - only took half of 10mg pill have been nervous all day took at 8a.m. twelve hours ago still feel the same wont be taking again

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I am 25 & have had bad panic attacks & anxiety my whole life. I have seen therapists and been on a couple medicines that made me sleepy when I was younger. I have also had a problem with concentration & mild depression. Recently I have had a string of really stressful situations come up and anxiety, panic,& depression combined with OCD & ADD & really bad mood swings (screaming, breaking & throwing anything I could get my hands on).  I was ready for something! I didn't feel like I needed to see a therapist, I kinda know whats wrong with me, so I saw a doctor that deals with depression & ADD/OCD. I just wanted try something! She explained that while medicine doesn't change who you are it changes how you react to things. I am on Lexapro 20 mg and the only side effect seems to be I wake up in the middle of the night dripping in sweat! I am generally happier, calmer, relaxed, donn't let the small things bother me. I have had a few bouts of depression here and there but it goes away & its nothing I'd consider abnormal. I can finally & my OCD is alot calmer. My advice to anyone just starting on it is the first week,you feel like your flying! I loved it, but some may have a stronger reaction, just give it some time and it should level out.

column3: beans, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Lexapro really was almost like a miracle pill for me. I was given a 4 week supply sample originally to help me with a sleeping problem (as the doctor had asked if i also felt anxiety or depression). In that time, my depression had diminished (and i had EXTREMELY difficult family situations that started 2 weeks after i took it...great timing...I would have been completely depressed and beside myself, but I felt great.)I was diagnosed with metabolic syndrome (high blood pressure, overweight/obesity, cholesterol issues) a few months earlier. Lexapro lowered my high blood pressure to a perfect score, acted as an appetite suppressant, and i lost weight because of it. obviously this wont be the case with everyone. the only side effects i experienced were moderate nausea and occasional headaches when first incorporating the drug into my system (first week or two).I've had varying levels of depression since i was 13. I'm now going on 22 so i still have a while to go. i was off it for 2 months and i just bought my first prescription for it. 2nd day: nausea and headache. hopefully it will just go away like it did before.

column3: AnnaCatherine, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro is the only drug that works for me. I was having deep thoughts of suicide and anxiety attacks all the time. It got to the point where I did try suicide. I was placed on this drug and after about two weeks I was back to my normal self. No thoughts of suicide, no anxiety, nothing like that. I was ablre to smile, laugh and joke again with friends and family. I have been on it for about 6 years now. if I miss a dose, I get headahces and weird dizzyness. My doctor wants to try me on Celexa, but I don't think it works as well for me. Lexapro is a drug you need to work with. You have to police yourself. It's not a miracle drug some people try to say it is.

column3: takeatnight, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Lexapro has saved my life. I was prescribed the drug for severe anxiety and mild depression. The first time I was on it, I took it for about 3 months in the morning and I had the sexual side effects, loss of libido and I could not have an orgasm to save my life!! I stopped taking it because I could not handle the sexual side effects. Then when my doctor prescribed it again he told me that it should ALWAYS be taken at night!!! It helps with the drowsiness, which was my 1st problem because I felt like a zombie in the morning when I took it. So when I started taking it at night, I noticed that I STARTED TO HAVE ORGASMS RIGHT AWAY!! Now I take it before bed every night, and I have orgasms all the time! I want everyone to know to talk to your doctor about taking Lexapro at night!! The side effects are non-existent! It saved my life, TAKE IT AT NIGHT!!

column3: newperson09, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been taking this medication for over a month now 10mg once a day and its been working great for me. I'm a person who never takes medication but found myself severely depressed after the death of my mother and needed something to bring me out of the black cloud I found myself in. I was first prescribed Wellbutrin and Effexor both increased my heart rate and blood pressure. I guess third times a charm because Lexapro worked great it was like someone turned a light switch on in my head, I noticed a change within the first week of taking this medicine. I now think more clearly, I have more energy, I don't get upset over the little things, my anger and mood has mellowed out, Co-workers have even commented that I'm friendlier now.I find that lexapro works better for me when I take it around the same time every day after I've eaten usually around 9:30am after breakfast. Lexapro will make you nauseated if you do not eat before taking. But as for not sleeping or gaining weight as mentioned in other reviews I have actually lost weight because I do more in the day, I don't go home and just sit on the couch any more after work. This is the benefit of taking this medicine early in the morning I accomplish more during the day and when I go to bed I'm naturally tired and fall asleep. I don't plan on being on this medicine for very long but it is working for me when I'm needing it the most.

column3: Mojoron, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I had post cardiac bypass depression that was effecting my work and my family.  I tried Lexapro samples for four weeks and while it was effective in the beginning, I became more depressed to the point of crying and sleeping during the day which I never did before.  I immediately got off the drug and feel pretty much OK now.  I believe that I had a Serotonin Storm which is a common problem with taking these types of drugs.  If at all possible, when suffering from clinical depression, try other non-perscription alternatives first.  Try to get more active, exercise more and seek mental support from a mental health professional. Major depression may require this and other drugs for depression

column3: kel, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column3: cb2009, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Started on Lexapro about two years ago for anxiety but has also helped with the bouts of sadness. Lexapro has worked very effectively but I've had side effects which have caused me to stop the drug twice. On Lexapro mood is very even with feelings  of just not being bothered about anything - this "lack" of emotion means sadness/anxiety is gone but I sometimes missed "feeling" things. Also found it difficult to motivate myself for work as the stress went.Worst side effect for me was weight gain (20-30lbs)- I probably started eating more but didn't really notice at the time. For me Lexapro becomes effective within a few days and the two times I've stopped sad and anxious feelings have come back within a few weeks. The drug has been most effective and if it wasn't for the weight gain I'd probably still be taking it.

After about three months of regular use, I found myself becoming more easily upset and reactive, with greater tendancy toward flying off the handle. About one month ago, I began tapering off the meds by 1/4 of final dosage per week and found I was sleeping significantly more than while on the meds and oversleeping my alarm more than once.

I have not gained weight, though I work out a lot anyway. Actually I didn't realize that I was that depressed until I started taking it and felt a difference.

column3: CLL, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: This website has been SO valuable during my frustration with different medications. You need to read over ALL the reviews and rule out a few that don't seem to jive with all the others.  There's always a few out there who are dissatisfied. That doesn't mean those same things will happen to you.  Do your research and remember, everyone is different and react to drugs differently.  Don't be scared the first time you see a reviewer mention weight gain or decreased libido.  It's more important that you get to feeling better and you can deal with those things later. I've had depression for 30 years and Prozac 20mg worked for me up until I hit 50. Perhaps it was because I'm pre-menopausal or because I'd taken the same drug, at the same dose for so many years.  I went to the doctor and tried several other drugs. At first, I wasn't satisfied with any of them, so I got on Effexor XR.  Wow!  Please read about the withdrawl symptoms when going off of Effexor, because they are severe. Try all the other meds first. Something will work for you.Bottom line, I'm going back on Lexapro.  I don't think I gave it enough of a chance and it was working pretty well for me. Be patient and don't try to change meds or get off of something without a doctor's advice.  Been there, done that, and it was terrible.  I believe that Lexapro is a wonderful drug. It is sure the best I've tried so far. I believe our bodies get used to something and it finally stops working. That's what happened to me with Prozac, although it was my wonder drug for 20+ years. I'm going to ask my doctor if perhaps I should rotate between Lexapro and Prozac every few years. That may be the answer for me.DON'T GIVE UP. Antidepressants will help you get your life back, but you have to be patient. Also exercise, eat right, and talk to someone who cares. God bless you all and best wishes in your recovery.There is light at the end of the tunnel, I promise.

column3: Easy, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Great treatment for anxiety or life changes. I had been taking 20 Mg for almost 1 1/2 years and it worked great. Sex drive tanks but not as much as with other meds of this type. Very difficult to get an erection and very delayed orgasm (which helped in some cases). I stopped taking lexapro one week ago and just yesterday experienced light-headedness and dizziness after walking up stairs. I also experienced it this morning, which caused me to check out this site. This never occurred while on Lexapro- could be withdrawal symptom as I am finding out now. I am tired of the sexual side effect of decreased drive, orgasm, and erection. Otherwise this is a great med.

column3: lex me up, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: No weight gain/ panic.  Life is manageable.  I got a little nauseous as I increased the dosage.  I'm now taking 40mg in the morning and have been on this dosage for about 3 months.  Sexual sides lasted a few weeks.  Now sex is even better than before.  Complete control.  The reason I only gave it a 3 in effectiveness is that I still have intrusive thoughts that can bother me sometimes for a few days, before it was weeks.  I was able to quit checking my car/apt/and hand washing most of the time.  and i rarely apologize unless I am truely wrong. I still battle with fear of obsessing about a bad obsession.  lol.  but its never really that bad!!  The spike doesn't make me miserable.  Some of the other SSRI's gave me a burning sensation in my body/neck/shoulder. Lexapro gave me a milder burning sensation for the first week at 5mg.  I took it at night to cope.  After it got in my system the burning sensation went away.  This took about a week and was well worth it.  I feel it is a much cleaner SSRI.  I do eat healthy and work out a few times a week.  I also do CBT with my shrink every few weeks.  I was literally living in fear 80 percent of the day before Lexapro. Now i would say its around 20-30 percent.  I can concentrate and enjoy relationships again.  Sleep is better too!  I do find it makes me a little tired some days and manic others, but nothing extreme. Give lex a try if you are sensitive to other SSRI's.

column3: ghtttt, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: It has helped slightly but overall good medicine

column3: spenserb, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: It seems my short term memory has been affected and I also have trouble going to sleep. It does also give me a "I dont Care" attitude. This is the first medication I have taken for depression. I also have type 1 diabetes and it doesnt seem to have an affect on that.

column3: AnxiousNurse, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: When I first started taking this med I didn't know if I could tolerate it.  I was VERY anxious for the first few weeks, probably more so than why I even got on it.  My pdoc wanted me to take ativan 2-3 times daily to get thru the early period of adjusting to this med, and I am really glad I weathered the storm.  I am more level headed, can handle the day-to-day more easily, do not jump the gun and start yelling at people for no reason, and no longer suffer from random anxiety attacks on a daily basis.  My PMS is almost non-existent, whereas before my husband would take cover for 7-10 days before my period.  I truly would have headed for the hills far away from this med had my doctor not warned me about the start-up side effects.  Some people may not have them, but if you are like me and notice EVERY LITTLE THING that changes in you body and mind, you may be more sensitive to these types of meds and it may just freak you out.  Nothing a little scheduled ativan can't handle.  Thankfully my doc trusted me to take this, as I know other docs won't prescribe it for their patients.  I don't know how else I would have made it through the first 2-3 weeks.  Now I almost never have to take the ativan, because when I do get anxiety it is mild and I can talk myself off the edge of insanity pretty easily unlike before when I would just freak out immediately.  I do have a decreased libido but Lexapro comes with a built-in "I don't give a crap" mentality for so many things, including your reaction to the minor side effects you may have to live with.  And it's not "I don't care I'm a zombie" it's "I'm not going to take that too seriously".  BTW I only take 7.5 mg because 10 mg made my muscles twitch for some reason, but it seems to still work great.  Good luck!

column3: Empress of the Cosmos, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
