column10: While I couldn't cum, my severe panic and social anxiety was greatly improved.  Thank you Forrest.

column3: Holly, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column10: I'm on lowest dose..It has been great for a year..and now I am very depressed and wonder if it quit working. Can we build up a tolerance for it after a while. I also drink one to two glasses of wine almost every night.. Could THIS be adding to it not working any more?

column3: janpets, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: i just started this because i ran out of my other medicine so my doctor put me on this until my other pills come in. I feel that they are working very well.

column3: Cindy, 75 or over Female  (Patient)
column10: Lexapro has stabilized my major depression.  Up until I was prescribed various other anti-depressant but they only seemed to work for 7 years.  I'm proud to say on year 9 and still countin

column3: Kaykev, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I noticed a huge difference right away.  I was feeling more calm and able to handle things.  However, I started having the sexual side effects so I talked to my doctor.  He cut the dose in half and that took care of that problem.  Then I started having severe nausea and dizziness where I felt like the room was spinning.  It would last for about 4 hours every day.  After a few weeks I just couldn't take it anymore.  So I talked to my doctor again and changed meds completely.  I did not gain any weight on Lexapro but I wasn't able to lose any, either even when working out and cutting calories.  While Lexapro helped my depression/anxiety, the side effects were just not worth it.  For those of you having side effects be sure to talk to the doctor.  It may just be a matter of changing the dosage.

column3: Futchboy, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I don't feel overwhelmed anymore.  The medication also doesn't leave me clouded or tired.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
MAE, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: This is a great medication without it would be able it throught the day

column3: Momof4, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I am dealing with post-partum depression, anxiety attacks, PMDD, and post-traumatic stress disorder.  I didn't want to take any meds at all, I never have before.  But I was at the point where I couldn't function anymore; I could barely take care of my kids.  I was scared to start any anti-depressant b/c my sister had a bad reaction to one.  This one has been great, but now the positive changes are fizzling out.  My doctor and I may need to play with the dose.  When I take too much, I feel a little manic. But now I'm holding at 10 mg, and while I can get through the day without crying, I'm still sad and lack energy.  Overall I DO recommend this drug.  I've had very few bad side effects.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: It's amazing. I never wanted to be one of those 'statistics'. I didnt want to be on medication every day. But i also couldnt live with the constant (what I call) heart dropping feeling. It was taking over my life. The first few weeks def. took some getting used to. But after being on Lexapro for over 4 months I feel like my old self (which has been soo long since i've seen).

column3: Don, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: My relationship with Lexapro lasted one day. The side effects were so extreme I couldn't even make it in to work today. How odd I've been counting down the minutes until the Lexapro gets out of my system and I can go back to my old, normal nervous wreck. Took dose one last night with dinner. Within an hour felt drugged and nauseous. Fell into a coma-like sleep for about 4 hours and woke up around 7am. Layed in bed in a for a while before I realized the side effects. Heart racing in my chest like it was about to burst, hot and sweaty. Got up out of bed to test the waters and the dizzyness and trembling hands began to set in. Basically it took my anxiety attacks, turned them up to full volume and added a myriad of other side effects. And I could feel the numb, zombielike state blanketing it all. No thanks. This drug made me realize I need to master this disorder through more natural methods. Today scared the shit out of me. I assume a lot of people posting here are young and in school by saying they sleep all day or take 3 naps a day. I have to work full time and couldn't do it taking this drug judging how I felt today.

column3: snc860, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I've never taken anything for depression before and after only one dose, I felt very hyper all day long and then I was very restless at nighttime and it felt like all my thoughts at once were becoming visual and vivid, like something in a Kaleidoscope.  I have trouble sleeping anyway and so this isn't helping me at all.  I woke up very confused after sleeping only about an hour.  Not very happy with this medication at all.  Will be talking to my doctor in the morning.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: When I started taking Lexipro, it was like night and day.  I was diagnosed with MDD when I was 10, and have struggled to find treatment that would work ever since.  The first day I took Lexipro, I felt like getting out and socalizing, something that has never happened to me before.  People around me noticed a difference (my grandpa commented that I had more sparkle).  The downside is if I don't take my pill at the same time every day, I get diarrhea.  I also have trouble sleeping, and as a result am tired all the time. Lexipro also does not manage my anxiety as well as my previous medication, and I have had a sharp increase in panic attacks. Overall, though, Lexipro does such a good job managing my mood, I'm willing to over-look the side effects (which do seem to be getting better as time goes on.)

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Let me first say that for the first 2 weeks, I wanted OFF this, but after a lifetime of no med working 4 my depression/anxiety, I'm SO glad I didn't! I haven't been able to work out of the home for the last 3 years because of my depression/anxiety/add/pmdd) so was able to take the time to adjust. The 1st couple of days I thought I was losing my mind. I'd be crying for ten minutes, then extremely agitated for ten, then ok for ten - press repeat.  Essentially, 1st two weeks didn't feel at all like myself & had severe nausea, sleep problems, you name it including suicidal thoughts (try not to be alone, although I had to). But after having tried no kidding EVERY other drug out there just about with no luck, I was desperate & hung in there, just hoping. 2-3 months into taking 10mg I WAS noticing some improvement but not enough with my anxiety, so my doctor upped me to 20mg. So I had a repeat of the two weeks of hell - after a couple of weeks it was bearable but still wasn't myself for a couple more. Now, while I do still have to fight the depression, at least I feel I can. I can actually usually choose my reactions to stress instead of my reactions choosing me, have spent more time out of bed and actually able to function when my PMDD isn't kicking my butt ten days a month around my period (any suggestions for this?), & have been able to cope MUCH better. BTW, just some of the other drugs I tried (and yes, did give them at least a month or two - didn't have the severe side effects as with the Lexapro, just zombied out): Paxil (never again!), Prozac, Zoloft, Effexor ... there were more I can't remember off-hand, including ones for anxiety/panic attacks.  It had gotten to where I didn't believe in the meds at all before trying the Lex.  Now I wish I'd hung in there before & kept trying until I found one that worked for me. Could have maybe saved me years of grief and a messed-up life. Anyway, REALLY grateful for this drug! Hang in there all & keep trying!

column3: EDM, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Between 45 plus years of diabetes and some serious health issues releated to the disease, along with a family history of depression I found myself needing some help.  The Lexapro has been excellent.  Also, I cannot overstate the benefit of two supportive, fabulous doctors and an insightful, supportive and caring religious leader.

column3: LIFETIMESUFFERER, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Sweat,sweat and more sweat!! It has stopped me from having an orgasm..

column3: catlover, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Unfortunately Lexapro caused a lot of fatigue and could not cope with it.  Not for me.

column3: susan, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro works well for controlling my anxiety, but I feel it causes weight gain. I stopped taking Lexapro for a year and during that ime I lost close to 30lbs. I've been taking it again now for a year and have been gaining weight again.

column3: lexapro-NOT, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I felt great on Lexapro - too great.  I became almost manic - didn't want to sleep more than a few hours a night.  Stopped taking it almost immediately.

column3: Blake, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
Anxious, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: My Gynecologist prescribed Lexapro for my Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD) and I had wonderful results using it; however, I gained forty-two pounds in a matter of months. Although, my severe mood swings and anxiety had all but vanished, I was very unhappy with the weight gain. After almost a year of taking the drug, I wanted off. I quit taking it on my own. The first day was okay. The second day was a nightmare. I got a painful cramp in my upper back and arm. It felt like what I thought a heart attack might feel like, and then the shocks or the buzz. I had moments of staring and not being able to break my gaze. I was lucky I didn't throw them away. I started taking them again and all the withdrawal episodes went away. I had to have medical guidance from my Internal Medicine Doctor to get off the med. After all that, I still think using the Lexapro was worth it, because it did help me. I just couldn't live with the weight gain. I guess I would rather be moody and anxiety ridden then overweight.

column3: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
softballgirl01, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro for depression and I love it...my family and friends do too...they say that I am alot easier to get along with plus I work in customer service so it makes my job so much easier!

column3: Thankful, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I started out taking 5 mg for one week then upped to 10mg. I noticed a bit of nausea and headache for one week, a relatively minor annoyance. I am feeling better and able to cope with work, less emotional for sure, more energy and less appitite. I am an RN and work with some real bak stabbing nurses so this drug is a life saver. My eyelids do feel a bit heavy at times, but that is something I'm willing to deal with. I did make the mistake of taking a few sips (3)of a margarita and felt some "zingers" in my head (difficult to explain)...that was scary, but I'm not a drinker so won't be doing that again.

column3: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column10: It seemed like a miracle drug for the first 3 to 4 years, then came sleeplessness at night and fatigue all day. Huge appetite came with it. No interest in sex. Sweating became an issue. I would be sweating and no one else was even hot or warm! Finally decided to go off the drug. I reduced the 5 mg every other day to 1/2 of that every week for about five weeks, now i havent had any for three weeks. I no longer have too much sweating, still no sex drive, tired all day. Can sleep a little bit at night. Lots of tics, thoughts of suicide etc. I am still in withdrawls now. Reading the other comments is helping as many of the reviews are similar. Getting off is very challenging.

column3: Iamawesome, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I started taking 20mg Lexapro in May 2009. For the first few weeks there was little positive about the medicine. I was very nauseated and had severe headaches. I talked to my doctor and he told me to keep at it. I did and got over the symptoms within a few weeks. After that I quickly noticed positive changes. However, I have gained over 20lbs and have a very tired feeling throughoit the day. Rarely do I have trouble sleeping. When I do not take my medicine for a few days, I become much more irritable and in a bad mood. I also feel quite nauseated, dizzy and these zap like pulses through my body that arent necessarily painful but uncomfortable and dissorienting. My Dad passed away a few months after i started taking this medication and that was quite a test. I felt like I was in control of myself and able to still properly grieve.  Overall, I am quite happy with the results thus far and it is important to keep with it and take it as prescribed.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: This medication has been tremendous and has helped my anxiety.

column3: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I was prescribe Lexapro bout a 1.5yr ago.  To say it felt better but boy was I sleepy, i found myself sleeping at my desk & waking up like I just slept all day...weird.  I thought there were pills to fix everything but overall just changing my diet & staying away from alcohol & crazy broads was the answer.  My suggestion stay away from any pills they'll only cause sometype of long term disorder or problem, srew the pharma companies...

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: When I first started Lexapro, I had a terrible migraine for several days, complete with upset stomach.  Once the headache went away, I could tell an AMAZING difference in attitude and feelings.  Husband says I'm finally the "girl he married" again.  I'm much happier and things just seem easier. Only problem is that I do notice that if I wait until later in the day to take it (at bedtime), I get irritable in the evenings.  Works better for me if I take it around mid-day.

column3: jdamon1, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: this drug has worked for me until now.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I get s severe headache right after I take lexapro.

column3: shaelynn73, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: The first day I took my 10mg pill, I felt spacey and not all with it.  I worried that this would make me not act like myself. Then the next day, I felt much better.  Things were clearer and I felt less anxiety. Other people have mentioned being tired and having their vision impacted, I did slightly the first few days...give it time. I am only on my first week but my vision is fine and I dont feel spacey anymore. My appetite is less, but I am okay with that. I dont know about sexual side effects, but my Dr. told me that she is on it and the first month she had difficulty reaching climax, but then after the first month, it was better!  I will keep waiting for the medication to get into my system fully, which can take 30-45 days.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Used lexapro for about 1 1/2 yr and at first it was a miracle for me, boost my mood after and heart-wrenching breakup. Made me really tired all of the time and I gained 25lbs that I cannot get rid of. I came off it and md put me on Wellbutrin SR, worse ever. Had terrible headaches everyday. My consider coming back to Lexapro, but so scared of the weight gain which makes me more depressed.

column3: holly4576, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column10: doctor prescribed lexapro to my husband for SEVERE ANGER problems. It has changed our lives! Wonderful. The kids arent affraid of him anymore and our marriage has been great for 6 months since hes been it. He has had anger issues for 20 years and now he is a different man. The only bad side effects are insomnia and low sex drive. I HIGHLY recommend it to anyone that has a bad temper!

column3: Student, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: This medication made me black out. I became very light-headed, dizzy, and nauseous.

column3: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: On this med for a while now. I take 10mg. and it gets me good for 24hrs. It does delay ejaculation but it does take the edge off of my anxioty and nerviouseness.

column3: ?, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have bee on this drug for about 10 and have not noticed any difference.  How long does it take to be effective.

column3: Tippy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Keep aniexity at bay and helps keep me patient with elderly parents and grandchildren.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: It changed my life.

column3: sis1924, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
lsayyad, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I starting taking 10 mg and went up to 20mg now back to 10 mg. Notice the difference within 3 months.

column3: carole, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: In retrospect I think that the drug worked well.  I did have a decreased libido and experienced weight gain.  The single worst side effect was sweating.  It was so bad that people began to ask if I was ok.  If you expereince this please know that it may be this drug.

column3: shaelynn, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: The first day I felt "out of it" and worried that I wouldn't feel like me taking it, however after that things changed. I feel like "me" but without the edge and anxiety I always felt. My husband and kids noticed right away that I wasnt snippy, didn't yell as much, was calmer and smiled more. I feel like I enjoy life again without stressing so much. I began taking Lexapro due to my father dying, then my cousin and then my husband being deployed all within a few months. It has helped me calm down and cope with life, rather than being so angry. Only negative side affects is loss of appetite (which I'm okay with!) some strange dreams, but sleep ok so far and sometimes tiredness about 2-hours after taking my pill (10mg) but then I'm fine after that. I am excited to have my life back again and am hopeful to feel even better over time. I've been on this now for only a week so results for me were almost immediate!

column3: tuddy,  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: more relaxed more able to sleep

column3: kkdigital1@aol.com,  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Mom died and I got very depressed. I was given 10mg but it was to strong for me. I became very dazed and just not feeling right or myself. After talking to the dr., he suggesed 1/2 pill. It worked for many yrs  Time now to wein my self off this drug. It did its job.

column3: feelbetternow, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro for almost 2 yrs. due to depression and anxiety.  I found it to have little side-effects, but the two most bothersome to me were tinnitus and weight gain.  I gained 20 lbs in 2 yrs.  It really helped with both depression and anxiety.  It helped with focusing and concentration.  I am now trying to slowly decrease my dosage and gradually get off the drug.  However, I have found this to be difficult due to increasing tinnitus and sleepiness.  I would use this drug again for depression and anxiety.

column3: lynn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: started out on 5mg worked well,felt better,less anxiety,lost 5lbs. After about 4 months it started not to work so docter said to take 10mg,same thing,work for little while then stopped. Docter keeps upping the dose every couple months,now I have rapid weight gain and still anxiety,20lbs in a couple months.I feel the doc does not listen to me and just ups the dose so he can get on to the next patient.So I tapered off slowely over a week,and I am losing the weight and taking zantac for my chest hurting. I am worndering if I even had anxiety or just heartburn.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: The side effects I experienced were migraine headaches that progressively got worst over the 12 months I took Lexapro. I stopped taking this medication.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Really did the trick for my depression an anxiety. I kept feeling like I had to yawn all the time for the first week though... weird side effects but good medication.

column3: Ronda, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I started taking this med and eventually was at 20 mg.  Felt like my head was in the clouds and couldn't focus.  Doc backed me down to 5 mg and that was not enough.  Found a welcome relief at 10 mg.  Anxiety has reduced significantly and can focus, concentrate and remember more.  It took some time to find the right dose, but it was worth it.

column3: zytorin,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: i feel zonked, hard to function effectivley, affects my sight,am not happy with results of only half a tablet.

column3: pookie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: After having my disease for about 11 yrs. with no meds. or therapy.  I couldn't stand it anymore.  I went to my usual clinic, but there was a new doc.  She said she was the "antidepressant queen".  She put me on lexapro and I haven't had anxiety (y main inhibitor) since.  Love It  Thank you my angel doctor.  Oh when I returned for the next visit she was gone.  Job well done!

column3: jay, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: effective but suffer from low libido and insomnia. on 10 mg per day. reduced it to 5 and attacks started. want to taper the medication. the insomnia is killing me.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: It made me feel better. Like more in control of what i was doing. Made me think before jumping in so to speak.

column3: swhit, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column10: while my husbadn was beign treated for terminal cancer and later died i had to take lexapro. one thing i have noticed, it affects libido

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: This medication did work for my depression; however the side effects were bad enuf for me that I went off it...only to need a different medication eventually anyway--went to prozac (good for about 6 months only).  The bad effects that I couldn't stand were soooo tired barely able to work, gained about 15 lbs, and felt like I was having hot flashes quite often. I guess if you can stand all those bad effects, it is definitely effective for the depression.

column3: ladybug, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have taken this medicine for years.  It did work realy good.  Right now i feel it is just not working quite as good.

column3: rathernotsay , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Since I began taking it in July 2009, my symptoms remain the same.  Some symptoms have become worse and there is a corrolation to daily function & how severe symptoms may be on a given day.  Even with CBT (long-term) my overhwelming sadness is a prevailing, predominant symptom.  The fatigue, lack of interest, etc., I truly try to "manage" by just dealing with it trying to move on. Day-by-day, just attempting to get out of "myself" more & into the world & change the focus from my feelings to attempting to contribute to the world & others, as I can, day by day.  It's boring to be depressed & until I die (which I truly look forward to) I better attempt to life as much as possible in spite of myself.

column3: kristenk, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: when i take it i feel tired but it calms me down and if i forget to take it i have a bad attitude and i dont even know it unless people point it out to me.

column3: paul, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Felt no positive effects.  I took it for 3 months and all it did to me was make me tired and dizzy all the time.  Just the opposite of what I was hoping for.  Time to try something else.

column3: momma, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: It took about 2-3 weeks for my body to adjust to this medication. I just wanted to sleep all of the time and had no appetite at all. After the initial adjustment, I have done well.

column3: busycarlady, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Have taken 10mg for about 4 years.  It was a miracle drug for me.  I had been crying and found no joy in life whatsoever.  Although the Dr. forewarned it would take a while to work, the improvement was almost immediate.  I feel like my old self again.I do not have any of the "tiredness or drowsiness" that others have mentioned here.

column3: stephs86, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I loved Lexapro at first. It worked for me great all through college, but it seemed like the longer I was on it the less effective it was. Getting off the drug was horrible everytime I did. It gave me zaps, dizziness, and an overall awful feeling.

column3: Mellow, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I was experiencing extreme anxiety and moods of depression.  Within a week the Lexapro began to work and has kept me on an even keel since.  Great medication.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Anxiety worsened. Could just be me.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Chooreda, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I took tricyclics, then Prozac, then Wellbutrin, before starting Lexapro. None of the previous worked as immediately or as well for me as Lexapro. (My advice: DO NOT JUDGE THIS OR ANY MEDICINE BY SIDE EFFECTS IN FIRST FEW DAYS. If I had stopped any of these medicines based on first couple of days, I would never have taken any anti-depressants and life would not be good. Or really, I might not be here anymore.) BACK TO SUBJECT: On Lexapro, my anxiety was improved, as well as my depression. I used 10 mg for about a year, then upped to 20 mg when it seemed necessary. I will say that I have been more sleepy, less energetic and have an increased appetite (translation: I gained 30 lbs. and I am a skinny person). I also have had increased problems with memory and concentration, and have trouble finding words when I am speaking. I am not sure whether the focus/memory is due to the Lexapro or not. But it doesn't help those areas, so I added Wellbutrin to the Lexapro for a time in order to see if focus/appetite/energy could be improved. I may still do that again at some point. My dr. said that using an SSRI for a long time can lead to less dopamine, which you need for concentration, energy and other things. For now, I am switching to a drug that acts on more than one neurotransmitter (norepinephrine and serotinin) just like the combo of Wellbutrin and Lexapro to see if that helps with fatigue, focus and memory. But I would not change a thing about my experience with Lexapro. It was the right drug for me at the time. If you are anxious and depressed, it is an especially good option. Realize that you may have to revisit whether it's the best option from time to time.

I could sleep everyday, all day if I didn't have to work.  I take naps whenever I can.  I definitely have to really pep talk myself to get out of bed everyday. I've also noticed that I have difficulty finding words when I'm talking to people, which never happened prior to taking this drug.  So, I decided to take myself off of it since I'm tired of being tired.  I guess it's withdrawl, but in the few days after I stopped taking it, I get these weird sensations in my head, like shocks or zaps and I find it hard for my eyes to focus when this occurs. column10: I have been taking 20mg of Lexapro for General Anxiety Disorder (GAD) for the past 10 years.  The drug has worked tremendously to keep my anxiety under control. Lexapro is more of a preventitive medication and it did not control my increased anxiety because of the new job.  My doctor prescribed .5mg of Xanax to try and get the anxiety under control.  The Xanax seems to be working however my concern now is if the anxiety will continue to return when starting a new job.  I had to be let go from this recent new job because if was a computer programmin contractor's job and the client did not want to have to deal with my anxiety issues. column3: newleaseonlife, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have been taking 5mg of Lexapro for around 3 years.  I feel that it evens me out and I no longer worry about the small stuff.  You need to give this medicine at least 6 weeks to give your body time to adjust.  I felt a little weird at first.  I experienced several side effects the first month (mainly waking up in the middle of the night with a rapid heart rate), but it gradually became less frequent & disappeared.  It also makes you a little tired at times if you cut your sleep short.  If I get a good 7-8 hours of sleep each night, I feel energized most days.  I resisted the urge to stop taking this medicine during the first month with the support of my wife and lots of prayers and the payoff was well worthwhile to me.  I am very glad I stuck with it through the initial body adjustment, though it was tough at times.  I finally feel like my normal self again.

column3: mom of teens, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Lexapro has made significant positive impact on my and my family's life.  Normal day to day trials no longer are blown out of proportion;  I can deal with things as they come and not worry too much about things that may or may not happen.  One major benefit that contradicts other reviewers reports are that my monthly migraines have subsided substantially.  I no longer need to take anything for them.  I do sleep much better than before lexapro and sometimes have trouble shaking the cobwebs from my head in the morning.  Sexual side effects are gone, libido is back.  I am grateful for this medication - as my husband is too.  I am back to the person I used to be!

column3: del295, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: A lot of these reviews are suspicious so I decided to write one.I've been taking Lexapro for over 4 years now, I originally started at 10mg, once per day, I shortened my dose to half a pill every other day due to severe anger problems while taking this medication. I can say it definitely helps with depression, however for me it was very ineffective at helping with OCD issues -- I still have my routines, merely in spurts now.I do not recommend this medication to anyone unless all other medications for lighter symptoms fail. This drug is very powerful and should not be taken simply because you had a bad day at work, etc. I can vouch for anger issues associated with taking this medication daily, as well as bi-polar behavior and loss of mental focus, lack of feeling real/alive mentally & visually, etc.I've tried kicking this medication and it is not difficult to get off of, very few withdrawals -- however I suggest cutting the dose gradually rather than going cold turkey.This medication does not seem to conflict with Propranolol.Side effects I have experienced are dry mouth, constipation, jittery eyes and erection problems but they are tolerable in comparison to depression.It is also very expensive, at least $90 without insurance.If you're on this medication, make sure it works for you and you feel it helps, otherwise find one that actually helps you and do not force yourself to adapt mentally to it.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)

I can talk to people now without shaking and my worklife is better.It also helps tremendously with my pms. I highly reccommend this to anyone to try.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I was prescribed Lexapro to treat my depression, and was only on the drug for one week. During that week, my energy level dropped significantly, I could barely stay awake throughout the day and my brain was in a complete fog. I was spaced out and loopy and felt exhausted. It didn't matter whether I took it in the morning or at night, with our without food, the results were the same. I could barely function through a work day, and I probably shouldn't have been driving a car in this state. I didn't cry or feel depressed during the week, but I can't say that I felt much of anything, except strange. I have been off it for 24 hours now, and the difference is amazing. I have my energy back, I'm not loopy and I'm not physically exhausted. I can focus on work tasks again. My doctor has prescribed Cymbalta as the next drug for me to try for treating the depression, which I have not started yet.I read many positive reviews about Lexapro, and I guess the point of me writing this review is so that people can see that in some cases, this drug is clearly not for everyone. And if you are immediately experiencing some of the less common side effects, talk to your doctor immediately.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I have been taking antidepressants since my second child was born in 1988. Lexapro has been the last drug of choice for the past 5 years or so. I have tried just about every antidepressant out there and they usually do what my doctor calls the "poop out syndrume" on me. Lexapro was fairly easy to trasition over to from my last drug, Prozac. However, I have never taken a medication that has taken me back to the way that I once felt years ago. Lexapro just helps me get by and there are times when it lags, such as when a sickness is coming on. In general, the side effects to this drug have been the same as any other antidepressant...fatigue, sleepiness, worsening of mood, when starting the medication. They went away for me in approximately a month. The one thing that I do like about this medicine is that it is easy to mix with other medications that may be prescribed by my other Doctors. Overall for me, it keeps me going, but still doesn't have the end results that I long to have.

column3: City Buddha, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

He first tried me on venlafaxine(generic Celexa) but they made me so sick with just one dose that I couldn't take them. He switched me to Lexapro and at first I was still having problems but what I didn't realize was that you have to give these medicines time to work. It's been a couple of weeks and I'm definetly feeling better. I would recommend Lexapro for it's ease of use and it's lack of side effects. For me anyway there where no side effects.

I would recommend starting slow and working your way to the level that best fits.

column3: aryz1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I've taken Lexapro for the past 6 months mainly for PMDD and find it working during the 2nd month of use.  For the first two months I was taking 10 mg and found myself to be very lethargic.  The doctor reduced my scrip to half a pill, 5mg a day and soon got my energy back.  Since then 5 mg a day has worked for me. I am 4' 11 at 124 lbs and 35 years old.  I was told I wouldn't gain weight on this script and I find that to be true. I have no other side effects except for what it feels like, muscle spasm. Nothing severe and tollerable vs PMS issues I had.  I am happy to have found something that works for me! But, please be patient and tolerate the first 6 weeks of side effects, I found that to be the norm and subsides as soon as your body adjusts. Coming from my experience of course.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I have tried other antidepressants in the past (effexor, zoloft, wellbutrin) and was dissatisfied with the results. Effexor took away the "lows" but is also took away the "highs" so that I felt emotionally "neutral" all the time. I now take Lexapro 20mg daily and I finally feel like I'm back to my normal self (and I haven't noticed any side effects). It's like I've found the right "key" to fit the receptors in my brain. I've been taking Lexapro for 5 yrs and I never want to stop! I consider it a maintenance medication. My advice is keep trying different antidepressants if one doesn't work for you; you just might find the "key" to fit your brain receptors.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I took Lexapro for a little over two years mostly to help with anxiety and OCD. It worked extremely well for the first two years. Then I rapidly gained almost 20 pounds and could barely get out of bed, and I also started feeling depressed for the first time in my life. I don't know what happened--it's like my body just decided to stop tolerating it. I was slowly weened off of it and then went another 2 years without taking anything because this experience was so bad. Now I'm back in therapy due to more anxiety issues but am starting Prozac. Bottom line: everyone's body reacts differently to antidepressants, and this drug was effective for a while. I must admit having negative feelings about it due to a friend's brother that died while on it. If you are concerned about weight gain, try something else. My new doctor says people typically gain at least 5-8 pounds on Lexapro.

column3: jack, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

It also has made getting to sleep a little difficult and made me kind of sluggish.Oerall I'm grateful because it stopped the panic attacks cold and they are a horroe to live through so I will continue to take it until I can find something as effective w/o the side affects.

column3: muchhappiernow, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I began taking 10mg per day in January 05 and have taken it daily since.  I was astounded at the improvement in my mental state within the first 10-14 days.  I realize now how much anxiety and depression was impacting my life.  I no longer feel 'bedeviled' by negative thoughts, anger, helplessness or other repetitive thoughts which really controlled my ability to function optimally.  During this time I also passed thru menopause; and either that or the lexapro may be to blame for decreased memory (short term) and slight weight gain.  Regardless, the improvement on Lexapro has been significant enough (as noted by my family as well) to be well worth memory loss or wt. gain; if indeed it is to blame.  I should also say the anxiety issues are genetic; my mothers family displaying the same type of behaviors I have personally experienced throughout my adolescence and adult life.  I am now 54 and retired from 32 years full time healthcare management (originally RN).

column10: I took Lexapro for 7 months and the entire time I took it I was sleepy ALL the time. It didn't help the depression. My Dr raised the dose and it still didn't help. I have known other people as well who had the same side effects which aren't noted on the drug facts. Now after 7 months of no help I am going to have to remain on thyroid medications for the remainder of my life and continue having blood work done every 3 to 4 months to test my thyroid hormone levels thanks to this drug. I was diagnosed 5 years ago with hypothyroidism. As a teenager, to hear I'd have to be on medicine for the rest of my life because of a medication that didn't present all the facts, I was horrified.

column3: better, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have been on this med for about a year.  Up until I got on it, I was unaware that I suffered from anxiety.  I just thought that was how people are supposed to feel.  When I got this drug, my life changed for the better.  I felt better than I ever had before and I was only on the 10 mg dose.  I really liked it, but after a few months this     great feeling was starting to subside.  I asked my dr to put me on the 20 mg so that i could maintain my great feeling.  After taking the 20 mg for a while, I never got that great feeling back.  I think my body started to get used to it.  I still take it and went back to the 10 mg dosage.  I am not as anxious as I once was, but I have not been able to get back to that great feeling that I had in the beginning.  Overall, I like it.  I think that euphoric feeling is normal at the beginning.  Additionally, I had some insomnia at the beginning, but that has subsided also.  I recommend this drug.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column3: Cheese, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

It completely erased my previous fears and anxiety and allowed me once again to enjoy travel and extensive 24/7 time with people I cared about. No side effects at all in my case and only hope it assists others and can make the same difference in their lives as it did in mine.

column3: INKEDBARBIEDOLL, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was just on Lexapro for about 6 months. I get samples from my doctor because the perscription is too much. I ran out of meds and the doctor was not in and my apt was 4 days after the weekend so I just thought, 7 days without it, i will be okay!!!! Wrong, I have been going through sheer agony. Terrible withdraw symptopms, Horrofic vivid dreams/nighmares. I have brain feezes, cant even remember my own husbands name, or why i walked into a room. I woke up this morning just crawling out of my skin, shivering and had intense thoughts of suicide. I read on several forums this could last a few weeks!!! I am supposed to go get more of the drug today, But I refuse to risk my life to a drug that can have this kind of effect on me if I ever go off of it, even for a few days. I am in HELL!!!!

column3: Bob, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I write merely to say that I'm not sure whether it worked or not worked.  (Took 10mg daily.) I was having some moderate depression and anxiety associated with worry about kids and parents and getting older and did feel better after a month or two.  Was also working with a therapist.  I might have had some sexual side effects and mild weight gain but it's really hard to know whether those were from the drug or the mental condition.  I went off cold turkey four months later as I was feeling better and didn't have any withdrawal effects.  Was it the meds?  Therapy?  Onset of the cheery spring season?  Bad thoughts just coming and going?  Impossible to say.  Might need to go back on if symptoms return. Would rather just take Xanax as I know that works but can't be on that long term.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: This drug worked well for treating depression with very few side effects (mild loss of libido), however, if you EVER have a doctor tell you to quit this cold turkey (or want to do so yourself) - DON'T!!!I followed my Dr's advice to go cold turkey, and I ended up in the ER with a BP of 190/124 and a horrible crawling sensation all over my body like I had to keep moving and couldn't hold still. I was stuck in the median on the freeway and it was all I could do to drive to the hospital. I threw up all over my car and was sweating profusely.  The only thing that made the symptoms subside was to go back on it.  I had to taper my dose for 2 weeks to get off it.  My Dr. thought I was full of it and didn't believe that I had an adverse reaction to quitting cold turkey. I would strongly advise against that, despite what your Dr. might tell you.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: For the past two years, I've gone from being slightly depressed to being majorly depressed. I couldn't sleep but when I did, I never could make myself get up and around the next day. I would cry at the drop of a hat and my moods were insane. My doctor tried me on Celexa, which was the worst drug ever for me. I never had a problem with anxiety until I started that drug && once I did, it just added to my problem. She then decided to start me on Lexapro 10mg and I've been on it for a little over a month and I think it is amazing. I can deal with things so much easier than I used to, my whole outlook on everything is just so much better.

column3: axlerose, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: WARNING. Lexapro has been know to unmask bipolar that would otherwise remain hidden. I was prescribed Lexapro 10MG after a move to a new city and promotion. At first it was great and I felt better than I every had before I started on the medication. After 3 or 4 months, I started to feel too good and started displaying signs of hypomania (high part of bipolar). This effected every relationship, both personal and professional in my life, but I didn't care at the time and I stayed on the medication. After I realized that Lexapro had uncovered a hidden hypomania activity, I weened off of it, taking 5MG a day for two weeks then 5MG everyother day. After I was off Lexapro for a month, I returned to major depression that was way worse than the original episode. The good feelings associated with Lexapro are artifical and it commonly will "unmask" bipolar activities. I was never aware of this risk and no doctor talked about it untill it was too late. Use with caution, Lexapro had large negative long term effects in my life.

column3: tg123, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I used Lexapro for 5-6 years. It was the longest period I've had without a major depressive episode. 3 months ago I decided to go off it and see how i did. Unfortunately I did it on my own, with working with my doc, and went off cold turkey. Several weeks later I had a major crash and have been in a depression ever since. I went right back on the lexapro, but unfortunately it no longer works for my depression, even at a higher dose. I had heard that a small percentage of people experience this when going off and back on an anti depressant. So, now I'm going to try a different AD, pristiq and see how that goes.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: lexapro started working fast, and now im scared to get off it.  im worried as soon as i get off all the symptoms will come back. i hate and like at the same time of not being able to feel my feelings.

I feel a million times better not to mention my relationship has improved dramatically. During my years on Zoloft, I tried a number of other meds like Cymbalta, Wellbutrin, Paxil,and one or two more but always had to go back to Zoloft because they either didn't control my depression or made me feel very angry. I love my new med!!!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column10: I have been on Lexapro for one year. I am afraid to stop taking it becaue of scary withdrawal stories and from fear that the depression/ anxiety will return. I used to not be able to ride in an elevator without holding my breath and sweating. I found after a few weeks on Lexapro, I can pretty much handle anything without anxiety. My moods are much more stable now also. I am down to taking 5 mg every other day and I think its the perfect dose for me. But if I miss that dose, I get a terrible headache. Negatives- strange dreams, 15 lb weight gain that might have been due to my previous depression. I noticed that when I was taking Lexapro everyday, my resting heart rate was in the 40's! Almost the same as hypothyroidism! That would explain the weight gain. Overall , it seems to be working

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

I went to urgent care to see what was wrong and they told me I was having withdrawls.  I went back on Lexapro and I was perfectly fine in 2 days.  My doctor said next time we try taking me off it might be over months, not weeks.  Think about this if you decide to get off.

column3: really lost it!, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I had a devastating reaction to this drug which I reported to the FDA. The side effects grew worse as time went on. On the third week of taking it, I began to experience bizzare thoughts, memory loss (forgot how to use my windshield wipers), lightheaded out-of-body sensations, increased insomnia, compulsiveness and weight gain. By the fourth week, I became psychotic...I made crisis phone calls to strangers, ended friendships, became violent and broke neighbor's windows in addition to trashing my own house, and actually contemplated suicide.  These behaviors are/were totally out-of-character for me and I am absolutely certain the Lexapro caused the behaviors. I really 'lost my mind' on this drug.  It took almost three weeks to wean off this drug, and I was an emotional and mental mess throughout it all. It took a long time for my brain to recover from it, and it added to my depression....

column3: leary, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have only taken Lexapro for one day and am very concerned about taking it any more based on the MANY reviews I've read on multiple websites.I have been under sustained stress (i.e., sickness, death, post-menopause, having to care for disabled family members, finances, etc., etc.) and finally realize that I just can't do it all.  So, I went to my doctor who prescribed 10mg./day.Took the first one yesterday - and while I was okay for the most part, I just felt strange -- probably a bit anxious.  I also take Xanax (particularly for headaches since it's the only thing that works), and the doctor said to take 2/day along with the lexapro.Stress and increased post-menopausal symptoms are my primary issues right now.  Based on everything I've ready, I'm very leary about taking Lexapro.  In fact, I did not take it today.  Unfortunately, I transferred into a department where I thought opportunities would be better and a healthier work environment, but it's the total opposite.  So, it's multiple issues that have accumulated over time, and everyone has their limit.I will call the doctor tomorrow and see if 5mg a day (or every other day) would be worth a try.  Maybe the 10mg is just too much for me.I'm a very active person and must be able to function at work every day -- not so sure this stuff will improve my ability to do the things I need to do...

column3: bmil453, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I am clinically depressed since childhood(genetic), have been on every pill available to man.  Been taking Lexapro for at least 6-7 years.  I have gained 50 lbs. but I am sane.  I cannot exist without medication.  I see in these blogs that people give up too easily.  What's more important to you?  A few side effects, weight gain, loss of sex drive OR death by suicide?  Life in a mental facility.  Some of you might not need these medications at all.  Some seem to be using it because you're unhappy.  Do any of you realize what it means to be truly mentally ill.  Lexapro is my lifesaver.  I take 40mg daily plus 150mg Wellbutrin, plusTrazodone at bedtime.  Please give the meds a chance to work no matter what you're on.  Sometimes it takes 3-4 weeks to have an affect.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Having anxiety is far much better than being on this medication. I was a lunatic and a completely different person. It totally altered my personality and it wasn't pretty. Two people I know experienced some of the same issues as I did on this medication.

column3: EmoBoi, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been on lexapro for about a month or so (or anxiety) the 5mg I'm pretty sure. The first day was easy going for never being on medication like this before. No side effects other then dry mouth and slightly lightened colors (that was confusing). Although, about a week or two later, I started to get very extreme dreams,something like being Ironman. Anyways, The first day was like a miracle compared to the day before ridden with full of anxiety, and nervous moments. I'm not 100% sure if I personally want to continue with this just because of the dreams,and inability to orgasm easily anymore. I do recommend that it is taken at night, it totally knocks me out, sleep fairly well till the dreams. But over all, after hearing things about other drugs of this type, This has been a very good experience for a first-timer such as myself  :)

column3: blue*eyed*girl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column10: I've been taking Lexapro for over a year now and have recently started to lower the dose. It worked ok, but the side effects can be horrible. Even after this long, I still have memory problems and sometimes pretty severe headaches, on top of other issues. It controlled my panic attacks pretty well, but the side effects are getting to me. The withdrawal from this medication isn't pleasant either with nausea, more headaches and the occassional crying fits, but worth it in my eyes to be free of this medication and easier to manage with behavior mod therapy. I know it's worked wonders for others, but it's just not for me.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Before I was put on a lexapro- nine months before I had had a miscarriage. it was devestating of course, but I somehow convienced myself I was fine. Months later, I had moved in with my boyfriend, and would constantly find new girls he was talking to in his phone. I eventually got to the point where I wouldnt want to leave the house, doing fun things was like a chore I had to make myself do. I was contantly anxious and would think up any worse case scenerio I could. I eventually had a breakdown, and had gotten physical with loved ones. Which is extremely outside of my character. I broke down and decided I couldn't live with myself and push any more friends and family away from me anymore. The dr. diagnosed me with severe depression- with mild anxiety. I began on 10mg and three weeks later I was switched to 20mg (because I would still get a little irritated at nite when the meds when begin to ware off). I noticed right away I was beginning to feel better, I started talking to my friends more and just began "loving" everyone like I used to. I enjoy going out and being social again. A huge weight lifted off my shoulders. Which is good when you're only 22. I don't dwell on the past anymore and I'm not so in my head and not as angry. I'm more independent. This drug is very expensive and has made me very tired. I could sleep all day everyday if I wanted to. But anyway- I didnt realise how bad I used to be until now, it's no way to live.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: too tired during the day especially after lunch. it has helped me with my anger against my family

column3: 4elements, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I was taking Lexapro for about 8 months, then feel back into depression at the news of my fathers illness.  I have started taking it again working my way up to a higher dose, but I can tell the diffrence it has made in just the 3 weeks I have been back on it.  It will make me space out from time to time when I am alone I relize I have no random thoughts and my mind is at peace.  A stange feeling for someone who is always thinking 2 days ahead. I am hoping to have the same reaction to treatment as last time but I think I will be on it longer than the 8 months this time around. Dealing with my fathers illnes and moving back home to tend to him has put me in a state of depression that I have not felt in many many years, but with the help of this med and other treatment I know I will be out of this depression sooner then I think.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: panic attacks seem to have vanished

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column10: I have been very satisfied with my 20mg dose, except my hair loss.  When I comb my hair in the morning, I get a full handful of hair on my comb!!!!  I have to keep my hair in a ponytail because of it, so I don't get in my food or other things, etc.

column3: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
Debbie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro for Anxiety and Panic Disorder.  I was at the point where I wouldn't even leave my house. I wouldn't drive and wouldn't go anywhere because I feared having a panic attack.  That also led to depression.  I started taking Lexapro and within a month felt extremely better.  The only side effects I had were yawning all the time and trouble sleeping during the first two weeks.  I also gained about 25 pounds in a years time.  I tapered off the Lexapro after being on it for a year because I felt I was "Fixed"  now it's about 6 months later and my anxiety has come back worse.  Doc tried putting me back on Lexapro and it didn't work this time, made my anxiety worse.  I've tried Pristiq, Zoloft, and am now trying Cymbalta.  I wish I would have never stopped taking Lexapro.  It really was working wonders for me and gave me my life back.

column3: margie, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)

column3: KJ,  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column10: I found this medication to be very subtle in its effects......no highs, no lows.  However, I have weaned myself off of it under doctor's care and find myself very weepy.  I'm not depressed but I feel like all the tears I hadn't cried were stored up and now being released.  That does not change my evaluation of the med, though.

column3: momcat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Resisted taking anti-anxiety drugs after bad experiences with other medications. Finally gave in after everyday anxiety. First week was nauseous, tired and felt off, but hung in there. I feel great now, no anxiety BUT cannot orgasm and have memory loss. Guess you can't have it all, but will stay on medication, write notes and try my best.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Lexapro helped save my relationship. I am much happier and loving to others.

column3: mom of teens, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I went to my MD for depression and she also saw anxiety as a problem and prescribed lexapro.  After 3 days I felt as if someone had pressed a reset button and I was back to my normal self.  Every little thing dealing with teenagers no longer makes me crazy. Yawning and headaches disappeared after the first week.  Do do still have a stiff neck, and most disappointing is the inability to reach orgasm, something that was always rather easy to do before.  I will talk to my doctor about this.  Now that I have read many of these reviews I am concerned about stopping lexapro and wonder what I have started.

column3: lenny, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: when my dose was up from 15mg to 20mg i got very confused nervous amoung others dr told me not to take for 2 days than take 10 mg but when i took it again the same side affects happened

column3: mavsgirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been very happy on Lexapro, having no symptoms of depression, and only minimal panic attacks in the past 6 months.  The only side effect I have had is being tired most of the time, which is a fair trade off in my opinion for the benefits it has given me.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have been taking 30 mg of lexapro and 300 of wellbutrin for almost 3 years, and how I wish that I had not resisted this for so long--my whole life could have been different.  I finally gave in because I could not get out of bed and when I did, my anger always sent me back to bed.  These meds don't make you indifferent to problems--as my 25 year old son is afraid--they honestly help your true self come out, you know the person you can't believe that others don't see in you.

column3: imightbe, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: From the age of roughly 10 to 33, I suffered severe anxiety and depression.  I resisted meds until I became absolutely suicidal.  I felt an immediate change within three days of starting Lexapro.  I was very drowsy, nauseous, and my vision was impaired, but that gave way quickly.  However, two weeks later, the beneficial effects disappeared and I experienced a rough drop back into depression, sadness, and anxiety.  Another week later, everything was stabilized, and each month on Lexapro has given me a gradually better quality of mental health.  It does, however, play havoc with your memory and sex drive.  I still feel unmotivated, but the initial sluggishness I felt at the beginning is slowly evaporating.  I made the proper choice. Skipping a dose isn't a problem for a day or two, but withdrawal is very unpleasant.  I recommend very gradual titration if you want to stop taking it for whatever reason.

column3: myoska, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I suffer from mild depression.  I don't contemplate suicide but am depressed a lot, seemingly without reason.  Seven months ago my doctor prescribed Lexapro so I tried the 10mg dose.  It took a week or two to feel a change but it definitely works for me.  My wife tells me I'm a lot easier to live with and frankly I feel more comfortable most of the time.  I'm certainly much less depressed than before.  I recommend it for those that reap its benefits.  Like any drug, it's probably not for everyone.  However there are some negative considerations as well.  It's harder to wake up in the morning.  I take naps when I can.  Sometimes I fall asleep reading a book, where I never used to.  Sexual desire is down but not gone.  I don't feel it has inhibited an erection but sometimes reaching orgasm can be difficult.  I guess that's why they make Viagra.  Another thing to consider is, don't miss a dose.  I failed to take it one morning and noticed I was a bit more grouchy than usual that day.  I took it the following day and was so spaced out at work that I hope I never forget to take it again.  I was forgetting people's names I had known for a while.  Familiar things were unfamiliar.  It was scary.  The following days were fine as long as I stay on the drug.  I've heard it was hard discontinuing usage of Lexapro now I believe it.  The positives definitely outweigh the negatives for me.

column3: snowy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: taken for hot flashes, with little or no effect over time. weaning myself off this drug is long and arduous. considerable weight gain as well.

column3: towanda, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Mood, concentration, sleep are better; no anxiety.  Some irritability still there at times.

column10: I had horrible post partum depression,I started taking zoloft at first but it didnt work, so they switched me to lexapro and I havent had any problems as in depression,scary thoughts or anxiety the side effects get the best me at times, sometimes I feel little shocks in my head and makes me nausous but I only notice that if I happen to miss a pill. column3: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Mellows me out and I don't stress out. Much calmer

column3: 4moongirl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have fibromyalgia and chronic pain as well as anxiety and depression. I have taken just about every anti-depressant there is and hated the way they made me feel and LOOK. When I was on Paxil, I gained about 15-20 lbs and I am a slim, small-boned person. I was not eating more, so I could not figure out why this was happening. Anyway, I weaned off Paxil and was on nothing for a while. I was going through a very difficult time personally. Then the flu-like symptoms of fibro returned as well as depression and anxiety. I discussed this with a psychiatrist and asked to be put on Lexapro (recommended to me). She said that would be a good choice for me as it is "weight neutral." I have been on Lexapro 40mg for about 3 years and it has been a good choice for me. After reading some of the reviews, I wonder if I should be taking Lexapro at night instead of in the morning. My fatigue level is high most of the time. Now I am thinking it may be due, in part, to the Lexapro.

column3: mskeen25, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column10: At age 25 I had a full hysterectomy. I started with hot flashes and everything else. I started hormone treatment for those symptoms, but my mood swings were still there, and my IBS and acid reflux starting going through the roof. Taking lexapro has made my symptoms so much better. I have gained about 20 lbs but it can be taken care of. I have since lost 12 pounds so it just takes time to get used of. As a mother of 3 small children, lexapro helps me to deal with their yelling and fighting. IT just relaxes me more a lot more than without it.

column3: tamholcombe, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
closertofine, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was prescribed Lexapro to treat my anxiety.  I suffered from anxiety, racing thoughts, agitation, etc.  I am now quite stable, but I do not like the sexual side effects.  I find it extremely difficult to reach orgasm which was once easy for me to do.  It feels as though I'm "numb" down there which has caused my husband a great deal of concern.  I am going to talk to my doctor about reducing my dose from 10 mg to 5 mg.

column3: sunny423, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was diagnosed with Pure O in September which is a form of OCD more focused on obsessive thoughts.  I had constant thought of hurting people which it not me at all.  I am a very loving thoughtful person.  I went through a period of numbness where I didn't feel much once I started taking Lexapro which I did not like at all.  I couldn't feel love, happiness, or joy.....but I also could leave the house and not feel terrified.  After about 3 months of being on Lexapro I am very happy to say that I am a much happier person.  I am back to myself.  Like everyone I have my good days and my bad, but it is no where close to how I was before.  I have not had much weight gain.  A small amount but I chalk that up to the fact that I had lost almost 20lbs when I had my sever OCD.  I would rather have a few extra lbs than not be able to leave my house.  I highly recommend giving this drug a try if suggested.  Like every medication, different things work for different people. Oh and also.....you have got to exercise.  That is no lie when your doctor says that it will help and I imagine that it keeps the weight gain at bay as well.

column3: tootie8764, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I started suffering from panic attacks after I started nursing school. My dr put me on lexapro, and it worked immediately! I had some tingling the first time I took it, which was weird, so I cut it in half and took 5mg instead of 10. It is May, and I started taking it November 5, and I have had 1 panic attack since. There is a downfall...in these 6 months I have gained 22lbs without changing any of my eating habits and I cannot get it off. I've been on a 1200 calorie low fat diet for about three weeks with exercise and NO CHEATING. I have gained 2 lbs. Now I am more miserable than I was before. I would definitely advise you to try something else first. Only use lexapro as your last resort. I am currently weaning off of it, and I have been dizzy, irritable, and had lots of headaches. This is from only taking 5mg!! Please be careful, and check out all these medications before you start taking them.

column3: lori, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I've tried zoloft wellbutrin and lexapro. Lexapro is the only ad that works for me. It instantly lifts my mood and ocd, social anxiety and worrying lessons within one week.Also helps tremendously well for my pmdd. I love this medication, it has saved my life. Side effects are flatulence (hee hee) mild sexual disfunction ( orgasm very mild) and occational stomach pain especailly with mensruation. I sleep much better which is great for me since because of anxiety I suffered from insomnia. No weight changes but notice a card craving I try to ignore.

After unsuccessfully trying a number of other common drugs, I was amazed at how lexapro had absolutely no side effects (except for a little sleepiness, which was quite welcome as I had been having difficulty sleeping). column3: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Truly a miracle drug, it has changed my life and I feel no adverse side effects at all.

column3: MIAMARIA94@AOL.COM, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: is been easy for to take,also has worked for me. im very satisfied with this medecine.

column3: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I have been taking this medication to treat my bipolar manic depression for the last 6 years and it has had a dramatic improvement on my life. I no longer suffer form crippling depression or the manic mood swings that would keep me from sleeping for days on end. What used to be a slingshot rollercoaster ride of emotion has become a leisurely drive through the country. For the most part I average 8 hours of sleep a night now instead of 10-12. I can also get to sleep very easily compared to the nights of laying awake for 3-4 hours because my mind wouldn't shut off. I haven't noticed any side affects. I am an artist and haven't noted any lack of creativity or "passion" for my work. In fact quite the opposite. Now that I am for the most part in control of myself, I can tap into that creativity and passion whenever I want. No weight gain, lose or increase of appetite, loss of sex drive, or even any nausea. I control my emotions now, not the other way around. I have just recently moved back to the city where I went to college 10 years ago and reconnected with some old friends who noticed immediately the change in my demeanor and composure, commenting that I seemed to be much happier and in control.

column3: Eileen6219, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column10: I've been on lexapro for 2 years, same dose (10 mg).  This medication WILL work for you, but you have to give it time.  In the beginning, I experienced chills, increased anxiety, and nausia.  These side effects will go away after the first few weeks.  It is worth it to ride through the rough few weeks because this medication has especially helped me with anxiety.  I would say that after 3 months, you will really begin to see the full benefit of the medication.  I gained a few pounds, but with exercise and diet, you can maintain normal weight.  Having a good support system around is a very crucial part to feeling better as well.  Hope this helps you and, feel better!!

column3: cbwdancer@comcast.net, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I've been on Lexapro for almost 5 years now and I can't imagine life without. Well I can and its awful. I'm now a sophomore in college and life without lexapro is awful. My roomates, who I've only known for two years, can even see a difference in me when I miss my medication for more than a week. There has never been a downside for me taking this drug, I've never had any of side effect and it has greaty improved my life. I'm happier all the time and have more energy and want to get out and do things. I guess the only bad thing about it is when I miss for like over a week (which is rare but happens) there is a drastic swing in my mood and its clear to me and everyone around me. I am a totally different person when I dont take the drug. I'm afraid that I am dependant on it, and although I dont want to be on Lexapro my whole life, I guess I'll just have to wait and see.

column3: drtobe, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I've been on Lexapro for a year and have been very pleased with the results.  Take it for depression/anxiety combo.  Started out on Lorazepam for anxiety attacks, but quickly realized I needed a daily medication.  Had used Xanax for a short period a few years ago, but I like the Lexapro because it isn't habit forming (I'm sure there are withdrawal symptoms, but it isn't addictive).  Started at 10mg, which worked fine until I was laid-off earlier this year, so I switched to 20mg.  Doing fine on 20mg and plan to stay.  Lexapro has made a huge difference in my life - I used to have trouble sleeping, was disinterested in life in general, often wondered what the point of living was, and would constantly worry about EVERYTHING.  I felt improvement of my depression within 1 week of receiving the prescription.  A word on side effects:  I too felt EXTREME fatigue, nausea, terrible headaches, and lack of appetite in the first couple of days.  I was taking it in the morning before going to work and I honestly felt AWFUL within an hour of taking it - but the depression was getting better so I hung in there with the medication, figuring the side effects would go away once my body adjusted to the medication.  I also switched to taking the medication at night right before I went to bed instead of in the morning, so any side effects would occur while I was sleeping and I didn't feel them as much.  Thankfully making that switch did the trick and as far as I know the side effect went away after the first week or so.  Give it time if you're just starting or thinking about starting.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I was diagnosed with Depression/General Anxiety Disorder. I was having panic attacks and couldn't finish a thought yet would lay awake at night and stress all day about anything and everything. I was prescribed 10 mg at first and took that for about a month. After having another awful panic attack in my sleep I asked the doctor to up the dosage. Now I have been taking 20mg for over 2 years and it does wonders for me. I am more even-tempered and don't have the anxiety/panic attacks. Sometimes I still struggle with stressing about things but not like I did before. I can finish a thought and think clearly. It has improved my memory (I have a really bad memory-some short term and long term)and I am able to function much better daily. I did have sexual side effects for a long while but after so long those seemed to dissolve as well. I wish I could tell everyone who needs help about this and how it has helped me. There's nothing more relieving than to be able to function everyday on a normal basis. I would recomment atleast trying this medication.
