column10: boy did i go down fast on this one took me out of my head if your a man dont think this is the one for you as it wasn't for me very bad side eff. after only 2 days on it

column3: waterparkwarrior , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: This drug did a tremendous job of removing my anxiety but it seems to have moved me to the other side of the mood spectrum--I seem to be very apathetic about things.  I don't care if the house work gets done, bills get paid, clothes get washed etc, I just don't care.  I went on a diet soon after starting the drug--I lost 75 pounds in 5 months.  It was not the drug that helped me lose the weight,  I believe the drug helped me stop obsessing about things--food included--and that was what finally helped me lose weight.  Did have sexual side effects, dry mouth (which improved after a few weeks) and some difficulty sleeping.  Unfortunately my insurance will no longer pay and doc wants to switch me to Celexa.  I am super paranoid about gaining weight on Celexa (although weight gain is often a side effect of Lexapro, too) and as I stated before, Lexapro did not make me gain weight.  I am hoping for the best as I switch to Celexa.  FYI--my doc said Lexapro is an improved version of Celexa.  Lexapro is escitalopram and Celexa is scitalopram, so again, I am hoping for the best in my experience with Celexa.

column3: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Been taking it for 6 months. Had been taking Prozac for 10 years previously, but started having anxiety attacks and doctor prescribed Lexapro 10 mgs daily. Worked great the first month with minor side effects (tiredness, hunger), but then I noticed that I was feeling angry or irritable a lot of the time. When I cut the pill in half or skipped a day, the anger would simmer down. I started taking half a pill a day about two months ago and that seems to work okay. Frequent bouts of worry (but not full-blown anxiety) have started it up, but I'm trying out some stress reduction techniques to help alleviate angst.

column3: Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro almost 2 years ago now and it has made me happier and more social. Unfortunately I have had awful side effects all of a sudden. I have suffered severe drowsiness and dizziness. I have weened off and felt better but now having bad withdrawls with dizziness and memory loss.

column3: wciccal@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
Annie654, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I am a 22 year old college student and seeing that my life is filled with many choices and due dates, etc, I have been having some slight panic attacks here and there along with consistent anxiety/mood swings. I was prescribed to Lexapro 10mg and it was a huge relief when I finally felt the difference after the 2nd week in. However, I have noticed that the it has seemed to wear off and I have gradually been getting back those nasty old feelings (trouble sleeping,feel like I can't get enough air sometimes, nervousness, biting my nails all the time, short tempered with people, heart palpitations,headaches). I have also noticed that my libido has gone completely out the window, which is horrible. My Dr. has now prescribed me to Zoloft 50MG. I pray that works for me.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: gave me a seizure and exhausted me.

column3: lovemykitty, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
KKLight, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I took Lexapro for 2 years and then decided I didn't want to rely on a drug in order to function daily, plus I had the "whatever" syndrome and sometimes I really needed to show more emotion; so I started cutting back on my dosage from 20 mg to 10 mg (cut the pill in half) and then I would skip a day.  I would take less med and spread the days apart. I started experiencing a strange sensation in my head especially when turning my head quickly, I would take a small chip of the pill and the sensation would go away. This lasted for about 6 weeks and then the side effect started subsiding, be sure to wean yourself off this drug. Now that I'm not taking any meds, reality is not as easy to cope with and am debating about returning to Lexapro for the escape and to return to "whatever."

column3: Non Worrier, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
CHATLADYX, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: FIND LEXAPRO HELPFUL.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I started Lexapro almost 2 years ago, to treat depression.  I took for about 8 months, then stopped.  Recently, I had symptoms come back, so doctor placed me back on since I did so well on it.  I have expereinced no side effects, and when I take it faithfully, has been a great medicine.  I am one that does not experience any withdrawl symptoms---so if I forget to take it, I only realize it when my symptoms return.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: For years I have suffered with anxiety, especially when travelling.  Seems like the older I get, the worse my anxiety would become.  I've tried Effexor, Wellbutrin, Paxil, Zoloft & others with no relief.  Finally, Lexapro has been my saving grace.  I am now able to travel & drive without fear.  I don't even check the weather channel before I make plans anymore. Thank you Lexapro!

column3: Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I have been taking Lexapro for about 2 years in combination with Welbutrin. Overall I do feel better, but I have gained weight and I feel starving hungry all the time. Has anyone else had this problem? I ran out of the pills and went 2 days without them. I felt horrible! Headache, dizzy, panic, breast pain. Once I got it back into my system within 8 hrs I felt much better. Makes me wonder how hard it will be if I ever want to stop taking it. Already went through bad "withdrawel" from Efexor. I do recommend it as I think it works, just leary of how it will be to stop taking it.

column3: Connie, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: Severe hives after first Lexapro 10 mg med.  Horrible drug. Not help in first med, psychologically.   Medicare/Blue Cross does not have Lexapro in Formulary and will not cover it in co-pay.  My wife will take simple Xanax 0.25 mg, 1 to 3 daily.

column3: cindi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I only took lexapro for 5 days and it gave me crazy headaches and stomach problems so i stopped.now im the Dr.put me on sertraline(zoloft),i will keep you updated

column3: life's mistake, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro for a month and although it has worked mood wise, I am experience intense side effects. Since i've begun this medication I have been experiencing nausea, fatigue, and dizziness. I have no energy to leave my bed. I sleep for 15 hours at a time, being a student and an employee this is not good.

column3: MCR, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: It's helped stabilize my mood a lot, but eventually effectiveness seemed to wane a bit and I switched from 10 to 20 mgs. Initial side effects were serious drowsiness and diarrhea, and I get terrible dizziness as a withdrawal symptom, even if I'm weaning off it slowly or even if I've just missed one pill. I would recommend it for sure, but don't let anyone tell you there are no side effects or withdrawal symptoms, because they're lying. Also, do NOT drink alcohol while taking this--I become a sobbing, irrational mess (yet I never seem to learn...).

column3: inkedbarbie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have only been taking 10mg for a week, but every single time I take it I get an instant migrain/Headache. It lasts for about 2 hours and is almost dibilating. Also I am starving, and I do NOT need to be hungry right now. I have gained 50lbs from sheer depression alone, I dont need that as an additional side effect. If I gain more than 5 lbs on this medication, or do not lo0se these crippling headaches within 2 weeks, I will stop taking this drug and admit defeat and sucome to the depression. I will oficially give up on trying to fix myself and enjoy life. this has been a 12 year long battle that I am not able to fight any longer.

column3: lowcoal, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column10: i was given this when my grief was too much to bear after my mom died and i began being a full time caregiver for my dad. i worked for 3 yrs but i gained 50 lbs and lost muscle mass. eventually caregiving became more demanding and i cried all the time. dr switched to zoloft. do not have the happy feeling anymore but am not crying as much.

column3: asgirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I loved the effects of Lexapro on my anxiety and depression, but something wasn't right.  I was going through life with no emotions, just dull and monitone. I also gianed 45 pounds, which they of course do not liekto tell you.  My husband and I are trying to have a baby and in order to do that, I safely weaned myself off of Lexapro.  Wow, gradual or not, the side effects were some of the worst I have ever experienced.  I have been on and off of several medications since I was 14 years old (I am 28 now) and I have never experienced withdrawal symptoms like those I did with Lexapro.  The dizziness and nausea was too much to handle. I was literally off balance for a month and my brain was constantly "re-setting" itself making my vision blurred, causing headaches, lack of balance and exhaustion.  I recommend to everyone to truly investigate teh side effects of this medication BEFORE you start taking it.  It is now six weeks later and most of the symptoms have subsided except an occassional dizzy spell.  Please talk to your doctor about teh side effects of this medication adn teh withdrawal sympoms which can last anywhere from 2 days to 3 months.

column3: tcqueen, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: When I told my doctor about my panic attacks and increased anxiety since having my son 6 months ago, she recommended Lexapro.  I was told about the possible side effects, headaches, weight gain, decreased sex drive, but I felt the good out-weighted the bad.  I started taking half a pill and then the full 10mg after 5 days.  I did get a mild headache on the 5th day, but nothing that interupted my daily activities.  I have not gained any weight or experienced a decrease in my sex drive.  My attitude and general outlook on life has gone up and I feel a lot happier.  The little things really don't bother me anymore.  I feel as though I'm back to my old self.  Lexapro has improved my life.

column3: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: After being put in a hospital for my Obsessive-Compulsive and depression, they decided to put me onto Lexapro. It has been a lifesaver so far. There has been little to no side effects for me, and has changed my life. I highly suggest anyone with OCD or depression to talk to a doctor about using this.

column3: hds102978@aol.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
lovely, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: After going on and off SEVERAL anti-depressents for almost a decade I finally found a doc who correctly diagnosed me with GAD not just depression.   Then came the lexapro and HALLELULLAH!!!   This drug has been a life saver...it does not change me but allows the "true" me to shine...I recommend for everyone with anxiety to talk to their doc about this one...

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: i tried 5 different medications before this one and none of them worked even half as well as lexapro oral.

column3: FoxTrot, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have suffered from depression and mild anxiety for years now, and was recently put on Lexapro. The sadness and worthlessness are gone. I can actually get up and do things, and I actually like myself for once. The panic and anxiety I usually feel happen a lot less. So in those areas, the drug works. However, the sadness and worthlessness have been replaced by what can only be described as, whatever. I just don't care anymore. And it's not like, oh nothing is worth it, I don't care anymore. It's simply not there emotion-wise. It's like everything is blank. Blank and a little foggy at times. On top of that, I started overeating. Full, or not, I'm constantly hungry and have to stop myself from eating all day long. I also have a slight ringing in my ears sometimes. So I have mixed feelings on this drug.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: has taken away thoughts of worthless

column3: packerfan4ever, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I was on Lexapro about a year ago, and had to be taken off because of insurance reasons.  Ever since, I have been a basket case.  The insurance wants me to be a "rat" and try other drugs in the meantime, and right now (after several others) I am on Celexa-a similar version of Lexapro-but not close enough.  I was also on Topamax with the Lexapro, and dropped a signifigant amount of weight.  I NEVER felt better--not just because of the weight loss, but EVERYTHING.  And believe me, I was under a LOT of stress-backstabbed by a friend who ended up with my husband at the time, and of course my hub and I ended up going through a divorce; death of family members; a close friend; my dog; dang-there's a country song...the Lexapro worked.  And I can especially see it now.  Presently, I am on Lamictal and Celexa. I gained all my weight back and more, am more depressed, feel like kicking the crap out of my ex and his wife. I have an appointment on Monday and am pushing to get back on Lexapro and Topamax.  I KNOW I need it for that extra push. Good luck everyone.  Certain pills don't work for everyone, but I know it did for me!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was put on this medicine for Depression, Anxiety, and feelings of complete and total Anger. Since I have been on it, I have noticed that I have begun having Suicidal thoughts which is not like me. I am on 20mg and my OB/GYN put me on Xanax after about 5 months to help with the severe anger issues that were still coming up. Taking this medication scared me and made me feel like there was something seriously wrong with me. I also noticed that my Depression got alot worse and I didn't know how to deal with it. I was just taken off the medication by a psychologist and I am on something that I am praying will help me since I don't feel like anything else will.  Be very careful when you are taking this medication and don't wait as long as I did to tell your doctor if your problems get worse or if new ones pop up.

column3: Louise, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I've been taking 10mgs for over a year this time. I took myself off a while back and it was bad. I'll stay on as long as it's effective. Anxiety and depression lessened to the point of being manageable. Some weight gain which  might be age and heredity related - easy to blame a pill for lifes nuances. . .

column3: robertalexander509, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I've been taking this medicine for about five months to treat anxiety.  My chronic anxiety had started to manifest itself into irratibility.  This medicine has make a tremendous difference in my life.  My first two weeks on the medication I experienced side effects where I felt "foggy" headed, sleepy and I yawned a lot.  I also felt very relaxed and unconcerned which was a relief.  After that I started to wonder if the effects of the drug had worn off.  What I didn't realize is that I had stop "blowing up" at my family at the end of the day.  My level of anxiety and subsequent irratibility is the lowest it has been in many years.  The only side effect I experience now is a slightly reduced interest in sex.  For me, the benefits far outweigh this negative.  In my case, interest and performance are inter related.  I am 46 yo MWM.  My ability to perform is not diminished by the medicine, but my interest is.  However, when my interest is there, I can perform as any male my age can.  I am much more relaxed and patient while taking this medication and my relationships have improved because of this.

column3: L.J., 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I was having terrible panic attacks! I could not even drive. When my Dr. gave me samples of this medication, I rolled my eyes? I thought I needed to be checked into the hospital for a million dollor work up on my brain? The first 3-4 days I still hade attacks. There were cirtain places I had to avoid,Stop lights,the bank,my kids school parking lot? Then the 5 day it was like turning a off a light swith. I have been on this medication for 4 years, I will never go without it. I started on 20mg of Celexa, when I changed to Lexapro I was given 10mg. I have never had to increase my dose! I take one every AM, I never forget it. You need to realize it takes a week for this medication to get into your system. Also, Lexapro works on BOTH sides of your brain, Celexa only on side at a time. I am so thankful for this medication, I have my life back!!! If it makes you sleepy,take it at nite. If it keeps you up,take it in the am. It is worth you time to really give this medication time to balance your panic attacks and anxiety. Work with your Dr. Best Wishes, God Bless!

column3: blondie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Had depression with bouts of panic, this stuff was great. I had alot of energy and the "talk " inside my head stopped, but after about 3 mo. my breast were so tender I couldnt stand it any more, switched to Pristiq,which interupted my sleep at night. But thats a different story, if it wasnt for the tenderness Id still be on it, the best.

column3: owen 4390, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I love this pill. The only bad thing is, I am SO tired, all the time. Ever since I started taking this pill, I feel like I am going to pass out after work/school. I work till one and go home and fall asleep for hours! It drives me nuts. But the good thing is, the affects help me more than the side effects hurt me.

column3: parforbob, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I've been taking this for about 10 days now. The side effects that I have experienced are the reason I will stop taking this medicine today! Side effects for me include dry mouth, headache, sleepyness, muscle aches and worst of all DIARREHA! It's so bad it's to the point of perhaps 10 times a day. It seems I can't go anywhere or do anything without the need to have a portolet behind me at all times. I'm not depressed though. Overall the side effects aren't worth the the trouble. Without health insurance it is way expensive too. Luckily I got samples from my Dr. so I'm not out the money.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: This was absolutely the worst drug I have ever been on.  It was the worst three days of my life!  I felt disconnected, unable to concentrate, and for the first and only time in my life I was suicidal!

column3: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I Started using Lexapro in July of 2008, starting off with 10mg now 8 months later I am on 30mgs a day. I have not had a full blown panic attack since starting this medication, however I will get to the point right before an attack. I do still worry some and avoid situations or areas I have had an attack before. Considering I did not leave my house before taking this medication. I would rate it a C+, But I do believe I can be far off better then where I am now. As far as side effects, none that I can report of.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: this small pill did miracles for me. I thought that i have physical condition such as heart due to a fast heart beat used to happen occasionally,or even the thyriod that causes the fast heart beat. since I was put on this medication (that I refused to be put on for more rhan a year) my life has changed. I am more calm not depressed,I advanced in my job and looked much happier. It can cause tiredness if you stay home.if you try to withdraw do that with a doctor supervision

column3: Holly, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Lexapro was the best antidepresent I have ever taken.  It made me feel "normal" again.  I felt like I was made whole again.  It allowed me to have emotions, but I was in control of them and could deal with them appropriatly.  The two very unfortunate side effects to this medicine were severe weight gain.  I was 118 and am now 147.  I gained this much weight in a matter of just seven months.  I finally requested to go off this medicine and have been off it now for two weeks with no weight loss yet.  The other very serious thing that occurred with me is that my sodium level dropped severly low and the doctors thought my addrenal gland was failing.  It was only after a great number of tests that they realized it was the Lexapro that was causing my low sodium levels.  I was so low, I was put on anti seizure medicine and was also at risk for stroke.  I would be cautious in recommending this medicine to people.

column3: arizona-girl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I used this for some anxiety / panic / depression symptoms. It worked great for me although i was a little sleepy and after a whle I did have some sexual side effects I didn't like (no orgasm).  I have tapered off after about 18 mo. and feel good so far, only I have been dizzy since going clear off. I did taper off slowly. Has this happened to anyone else?

column3: KCDSatins@AOL.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I began taking this 3 mths ago for treatment of anxiety/panic attacks. I take 10 mg and my panic attacks are gone. Stress still exists but how I handle it is much different. I had very little side effects, just a little nausea in the beginning. I have gained no weight. I take it at night to avoid the sluggish. I exercise regularly, and I think that has also helped to give me energy etc. I would recommend this product.

column3: kbhappy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I was put on Lexapro after the unexpected death of my father. I had already lost my mother several years before. It did help with the depression/anxiety but have been on so long, it seems I am immune now. I did, however have bouts of "breakthrough anxiety" in which I had to be prescribed Xanax to calm down. I was on the verge of a nervous breakdown though and the Lexapro and Xanax kept me from losing it. My doctor has now prescribe me Effexor as a change to  see if that will help since some of my original symptoms are coming back.

column3: shala, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
jeansbeans, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: Don't know if my experience was 'typical' side effects, but I couldn't stick around to find out..I was wandering the house all night, not that I couldn't sleep but almost driven to get out of the bedroom and go somewhere else, could not eat, I only drank Gatorade for days,felt like I was not in my body, disconnected, echos in my head.AWFUL, SCARY, UPSETTING..this drug worked for my brother so MD thought I'd do well. After 3 days begged MD to discontinue.

column3: MissmyMom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: My Mother passed away unexpected 5 months ago. Immediately after her death I began Xanax but became immume to it within a week so my doctor put me on 10 mgs Lexapro. It has been excellent! The first week it did make me loopy & I took it at nite and I was not sleeping. So I took it along w/ Ambien.  After 1 month I have not side effects, the loopy feeling is gone. I dont cry all the time.  If you are going through the unexpected death of a loved one, this medicine will help you make it through each day sanely.  It may not be for all though, a few friends and a cousin could not take it for they gained weight and they felt "medicine head".  It was hard for them to think clearly.  My experience has not been that way, it keeps my appetite under control and I have not gained weight.  I plan on staying on Lexiprol for the next year.  One other piece of info, I had to change from taking at nite because I realized it kept me awake w/ too much energy. Now that I take it in the morning, it helps kick start my day and I am sleeping much better.

column3: Lyssa, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I've been on 10 mgs for a week, so it is too early to tell.  My depression has lifted somewhat, as I felt I was always on the verge of tears, but I am very tired. I need a nap during the day, and I am not motivated to do much.  My doc said it din't matter if I took it in the morning or at night.  I think I will switch to taking it at night to see if I am more awake during the day  - however, night sleeping has been good.  I specifically asked for a drug that would NOT put weight on  - too soon to tell about that, but I seem to be less hungry during the day  - maybe I'll be one of the lucky ones who actually lose!!  However, this is apparently a pretty powerful drug, efective or not, so I'd be careful with starting or stopping it.

column3: Jim M, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: taking lexapro has given me a side effect of earpopping and earaches and discharges offluid from my ear.

column3: jblalock, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
mustang_guy, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I was taking zoloft for a little bit until the sexual side effects started, then i was unwilling to take anything that had sexual effects, the doc put me on wellbutrin and ive been fine on that for a while but my wife says my symptoms are getting worse, now the doc is doing wellbutrin and lexapro, but im concerened about the sexual side effects, i see no change in my mood or feelings but thats my opinion. if the lexapro has effects, are there any others that yall have had luck with not messin with your mojo? thanks

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column10: I had a "trifecta" of issues when I was put on this family of antidepressants eleven years ago.  Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, Depression & Panic/Anxiety attacks mainly related to death of my mom and overall loss of both parents. I started with celexa then was eventually changed to lexapro. Simply said, this medication saved me from serious issues.  Initially doctors "played" around with some other antidepressants that did not help and more often made issues worse or caused worse side effects.  That trial period of being a lab rat was not pleasant but ultimately a good doctor finally decided it was seratonin that needed and so I began taken the meds. Under doctors supervision I have been taken off or switched to other meds on three occasions over the last eleven years and ultimately go back to lexapro.  It's the one that works best for me.  The worst thing about this drug is the associated weight gain but I've decided I'd rather have a "muffin top" and be a positive, happy person than wallow in fear, anxiety and sadness each day.  Not to mention, the only person stopping me from exercising to lose the weight is me.

column3: myhappypill, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I used to have a lot of anxiety and depression and I refused to take an anti-depression pill, my doctor recommended Lexapro and I have NEVER felt better.  It is my happy pill!  It lets me be myself but takes the edge of my depression.  It works for me! ! !

column3: ljj6, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Get off this drug asap. It almost killed me when my hart rate dropped to 30. I had to stop abruptly. I had a pacemaker put in last week and now my heart rate is normal.I have withdrawal symptoms but its worth it to know that I am through with lexapro forever.

column3: ann, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Gpa Steve, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Dr changed me fr Celexa to Lexapro.  Had bad side effects, maninly I was having mild seizures at night.  Dr. put me back on Celexa and seizures have all but gone away.  I was less than thrilled with Lexapro

column3: bennysmom1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have been taking 10mg of Lexapro for 2 weeks now.  I am suddenly experiencing increased urination, pain during urination, my urine seems to smell funny, cramping, naseau, dizziness and confusion.  Has anyone had the urination side effects I have mentioned?  Dr. says it isn't a side effect but urinanalysis is negative.  Stopped taking Lexapro because I am convinced it is causing the symptoms.  Hoping not to have withdrawal next!

column3: lexapro, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
Liz, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I couldn't live without it

column3: sandy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: i was suffering from mild post-partum as soon as i started taking this i was feel like i did before pregnancy.

column3: Chemgod, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I am never "full" and overeat constantly.  I have gained 25lbs in two years on Lexapro which in turn has loweredd my self esteem ever more.

column3: dilo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: this stuff is garbage!!! i've never felt suisidal in my life until i got on this crap. all i did was go in for a regular physical, new dr. in the practice heard i was a 9/11 survivor and had never been "treated" next thing i know i'm taking this stuff and i've never felt worse in my life. stay away!!!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
tnt, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: So good they should put it in the water !

column3: blondie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I call this my happy pill. I was suffering from a mild depression as well as mood swings related to post hysterectomy(no hormones).I take 10 mg,it took about two weeks and I felt like myself again. Not only does my internist prescibe it but my gynecologist would have as well. She told me that she recommends staying on this for two years. My doctor told me that a weight gain is possible but I have worked hard to exercise so that doesn't happen.

column3: meandj, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I am very "anti-medication".  I fought taking meds for PTSD and anxiety for 10 years.  I started this med 18 months ago, and it has changed my life.  I am a huge advocate now...... there is no reason to suffer!

column3: uGODio, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was prescribed this drug after my father passed away last year as a "boost" to the Wellbutrin I've taken for several years.  The side affects I experienced at the beginning were nausea, headache, dizziness, tiredness, etc - the usual. I stopped & started the Lexapro several times due to the side affects.  However, I found if I gave it more time (at least 2 weeks) it worked wonderfully with the Wellbutrin.  Especially for anxiety.  The only pitfall I experienced was a very decreased libido and lack of orgasm.  This placed stress on my marriage.  I weighed the cost & once again stopped taking it after a few weeks. It has now been about 3 months off the drug and I'm having anxiety almost everyday.  I know I need something to supplement the Wellbutrin & the Lexapro did wonders except for the libido.  It's quite possible I didn't hang on long enough to see if that symptom subsided as well.  I most likely will go back on it since the overall result was positive and helped me to feel more like my old self.  After all, it is about the one taking the medication - to ward off the anxiety and depression, right?  Therefore, in my opinion if you can get past the initial onset of side effects, Lexapro is a winner! Side note for another writer - Wellbutrin works when you don't even realize it.  Try going off it & see if others don't notice.

column3: Meow1941, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

The initial side effects were a bit tough, but stick with it. I have had NO loss of libido. Some delay in ejaculation, but orgasms are 100% more satisfying! I can't say how much I appreciate feeling like me again. I still feel tired a lot, I think that's from the Seroquel more than the Lexapro. I see my psych on Monday and am going to see about discontinuing the Seroquel and going with just the Lexapro.

column3: Missy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Three years ago I was taking Lexapro for depression.  I have always believed that suicide is a selfish act that is no less evil than murdering another human being.  In spite of this, I tried to end my own life.  It was my first and last attempt.  I lost my friends, I scared my family, and I had to drop out of school because I was put on stay of commitment.  While I was in the hospital watching TV I saw an ad urging people to sue the drug companies if they or someone they knew tried to kill themselves while on certain medications.  Lexapro was one of them.  I had been put on this drug to lower my depression, when in fact it just increased the probability that I would try to kill myself.  The meds I'm taking now work a hundred times better, and I have no desire to kill myself whatsoever.

column3: Quixote, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have battled severe depression for years and tried a number of medications.  Zoloft worked for a while, but eventually I needed pretty  high daily doses.  Parnate (a MAOI) worked very well, but it comes with too many restrictions and adverse interactions with other drugs. Lexapro combined with Wellbutrin has worked extremely well for more than 2 years and this treatment has helped me find a real stable place with ups and downs, but no dramatic swings in either direction. With other drugs I found that after a while I was confident I could handle it myself, only to find a deeper depression when I stopped meds and resistence to the same meds for treating the new episode.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

That was last November and I started having terrible panic attacks in the middle of Feb this year.  I decided to go back on lexapro only 5 mg to get used to it.  At first it really helped me but I still have panic attacks.  They make me feel crazier.  I am not depresssed I just have anxiety. I have never been more tired.  I want to work out but my heart beats so rapidly that I am afraid to.  Sometimes it feels fluttery.  I get dizzy and it sometimes feels like im falling.  My ears ring, Im constipated, I still get anxious.  I feel spacey. I'll be mid-sentence and pause then kinda forget what I was saying.  I eat constantly and I get shaky and sweaty.  I also don't feel anything.  I just want God to help me with this, I don't want to be on anything anymore.  I've decided to ween myself off.

Immediately experienced flushing in hands and face; third night, woke about 2 a.m. with suicidal thoughts, feeling manic and desperate, with the worst panic attack ever. I've been okay since; this was about 3 years ago.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: DISCONTINUING LEXAPRO IS HELL. Most doctors do not warn patients about SSRI DISCONTINUATION SYNDROME, so please research this before deciding that Lexapro is right for you.Lexapro was fairly effective at easing my depression, but every time I missed a dose, I felt sick.  Because of this, and the sexual side effects (complete inability to orgasm, no arousal during sex, no interest in sex), I decided to switch to Wellbutrin, and let me tell you, DISCONTINUING LEXAPRO IS HELL.  PLEASE, please before taking Lexapro, look up SSRI Discontinuation Syndrome on Wikipedia. It has been over a month since I finally tapered off Lexapro, and I have felt sick the whole time.  It's like having the flu every day but it doesn't go away, and the feeling of being "zapped" every few minutes is VERY disconcerting.  I am only JUST starting to feel better, however I still get major headaches every day, I feel like I have a low-grade fever and my body still hurts most of the time.  If you do take Lexapro, DO NOT QUIT COLD TURKEY. TAPER OFF VERY SLOWLY to lessen the very unpleasant effects of discontinuing it.  My doctor had me taking 50mg/day, which sounds like a lot, but it took that much to be effective for me. But nobody warned me that I would have to take it the rest of my life or suffer the misery of discontinuing it. Lexapro can be a very effective medication, and the benefits of taking it can outweigh the problems it may cause, so do the research and make an educated decision based upon your personal needs.Keep in mind that WebMD is sponsored by pharmaceutical companies, so you probably won't find anything about SSRI Discontinuation Syndrome here unless you are reading what patients have submitted.  Please research carefully and thoroughly so that you understand exactly what you are getting into if you do decide to take Lexapro.

column10: I highly suggest this medication for anyone with depression, anxiety and living a stressful life.  I have taken this for 2 1/2 years and have faired well. column3: me27513, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I've been on every SSRI out there for panic disorder and depression for the past 20 years. Most docs don't tell you that you may need more than just one drug. The best combination for me is Lexapro 10mg at night + Wellbutrin XL 150mg in the morning. Initially, I was on too high a dose of each individually, and almost gave up. Luckily, it took awhile, but I feel like a new person. Docs don't tell you that you build up an immunity to most SRRIs (like Lexapro) over time. Wellbutrin helps fill in the gaps, helps improve libido, and increase energy. Worst side effect of Lexapro didn't turn up for two years...night sweats. They're horrible, yet they go away completely if I skip my dose for a few nights. Ob/gyn tested hormones for menopause and that's not the problem. Weird that the side effect listings don't describe that problem. It should be easier to report side effects to the government. The FDA website makes the process next to impossible unless someone has died as a result of the drug. Overall, Lexapro is worth trying for its milder side effects, but no generic is available just yet.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I took Lexapro 10mg for two days for my PTSD and it gave me unwanted side effects.  Not long after I took it, it made me dizzy, then very sleepy (a lot of yawning). The second day I was nauseous (not too bad though), sleepy (yawned a lot with the feeling like I wanted to vomit every time I yawned), and a little anxiety.  But the straw that broke the camel's back, was my inability to achieve an orgasm - that's when I called my doctor and she told me to discontinue. column3: GetWell, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Had repeated periods of intense nervousness, anxiety and lightheadedness to the point of nearly fainting, and a lot of trouble sleeping at night, which I attributed to stress and/or too much caffiene.  Then I had my first panic attack.  I was sure I was going insane.  Dr. put me on Lexapro 20mg per day and Klonopin as needed if I felt an attack coming on.  The Klonopin also helped ease the transition onto the Lexapro.  I was able to stop taking the Klonopin after a couple of weeks when the Lexapro was fully effective.  In the time since the Dr. has bumped my Lexapro dose up to 30mg per day.  After nearly 2 years I have not had a single panic attack and my anxiety issues are gone.  I feel normal again.  I only take a Klonopin if I am going into a situation that I know will cause stress (like flying), and that is only a couple of times per year.  The rest of the time I am doing fine on the Lexapro, sleeping well, not worrying all the time, sweating less, etc.  I don't care if I have to stay on this for the rest of my life, I feel normal and happy again, and that's worth it. I take it at night just before bed because it does make me sleepy. This drug is not for everyone, so don't give up if it doesn't work well for you, try Effexor or Welbutrin.  You don't have to live with panic or anxiety, it is caused by a chemical issue that CAN be treated with the right drugs.  Best of luck to you, and get yourself well!

column3: Cinderella, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I have read about 100 of the reviews posted for this and wish I could talk to some of these people.  I just took myself OFF of Lexapro because it has left me feeling like a zombie.  I can't get off the couch & my anxiety builds as I watch things around my home pile up because I'm not getting anything done.  The side effects from going off this medication are scary to say the least. I feel like 1 lady who posted w/one of my withdrawls from this med. Small brain seizures (as if someone is startling me), headache, shaky, super rapid heart beat and when I move my body I feel as though I tingle all over and that I am going to fall down. It's as though I cant control what my body is doing.  I used Lexapro for depression, migraines, extreme pain & panic attacks after my ex-husband tried to kill himself. The coward tried to kill himself when I caught him cheating 4 times in 6 months while he was out of town working. I had my beautiful 2 year old son with me when all of this happened & I just fell into such a deep depression because he didnt stop the damage to our family with the suicide attempt, he ruined us financially, tried to get full custody, let our truck get repoed while I had our son at the grocery store and the list goes on.  I went through several antidepressants and this one had the least amount of side effects.  I feel as though I built up a resistance to it because I just didn't want to do anything anymore.  Thus, I took myself off of it and the withdrawls are terrible.  I really want to try and change my diet & exercise to balance out my body and it's chemical makeup.  I hope the things I am feeling now go away within a couple of days because I am even afraid to drive my car.  I just feel like someone is shaking me and my body is tingling.  Best of luck to all of you that are trying to get healthy and I hope there comes a day when doctors stop pushing pills for everything.  ebaydeals07 at yahoo dot com.

After taking one pill yesterday morning, about two hours later, I had tention in my muscles, severe shaking, hightened anxiety with exhaustion, and inability to sleep past 5 hours. I had a friend come over because I was so scared. I also could not eat after I took the pill.  I cannot aford to lose any more weight.  I've already lost 25 over the last year, 15 in the last month do to stress.  I am going to take the pill again today, but not until I have a large breakfast.  I do for the first time in a year feel hungry this morning.  I will try Lexapro for one week.  If the side effects don't go away, I will stop and try something else. Am am really frustrated that I have to take medications, but I am also greatful that they are out there.  I guess I worry more about the long term effects more then short term.  Plus what is going into our water systems?  Two headed fish and frogs?  If it makes some of us have no labido, then what will it do to the whales?!?  We are all drinking the same water.  Maybe that is why so many people are having mental health issues in the first place!  Just thinking.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Marcy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column10: To the poster below seeking withdrawal advice:I took Lexapro for 11 years after the death of my son and husband.  Got tired of taking it and AMA, I weaned myself off it a little tiny bit at a time.  I actually shaved down the tablet over 4 months until there was nothing left.  Side effects were "brain freeze", delayed vision, nausea, headache, feeling like I was falling backwards, and other minor ones.  I put my friends and employer on notice and they helped out a lot.  If you decide to withdraw, do it very, very slowly and watch for the side effects.  They disappear over time.  I've been off 2 years now and I'm fine.  I cry but I prefer that to not feeling anything. On the other hand, Lexapro helped me get through the roughest thing I'll ever experience.  I could not have done it without help and Lexapro stabilized me enough that outside professional help was possible.

column3: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I'm not one to write or put much stock in online reviews but I did read these before taking the drug so I'll review now that I'm off it. Not to scare anyone but I didn't take well to Lexapro. The side effects were overwhelming especially considering I am 29 and very healthy and in shape. It made me very depressed, when I have no history of depression, and the sexual side effects were   staggering. I took 10mg's for two weeks in combo with lorzepam and 20mg'f for the last two weeks. It simply wasn't worth it- I'd rather deal with the panic. I'm back to valium here and there for now and though I realize this drug can and has done great things for a lot of people, I really didn't take well to it and it was not the drug for me. The onset of the side effects took a few weeks and I gave it a try but, if you're at all like me, don't feel bad if this drug is not for you. Everyone is different and I can assure everyone I will never touch this stuff again. I had night terrors on it and depression I don't care to revisit. I have had no withdrawl effect. A minor headache and some very minor insomnia is all.

column3: Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I am 25 years old  and have been taking Lexapro for roughly 20 months.  Before taking Lexapro I was taking Effexor XR.  After weaning off of Effexor XR (which I had been taking for about 6 years for anxiety and depression) I began having horrible panic attacks.  My doctor put me back on Effexor XR but it did not help at all, so I began taking Lexapro (15mg daily).  It was a wonder drug!  My panic attacks stopped and I have not had one since taking the drug.  I am now trying to wean off Lexapro and went from 15 mg to 10mg in March of 2008 and just went from 10mg to 5 mg last Friday.  I am experiencing intense night sweats, blurred vision and mood swings since going down to 5 mg.  I really hope this will stop after my body adjusts to the new levels in my system soon.  Has anyone else out there successfully gotten off of this drug???

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro maybe 6 years ago.  I remember the day I started it.  A few hours after I took the first dose, I became very very ill. I was at work, sweating, throwing up, just a terrible feeling. I called the Dr. He said it will pass in about a week or two, and to just wait it out.  It did work very well for my panic attackes.  Before I would pass out from them, but after taking the medicine they almost stopped.  I would have a few every now and then.  The side effects were horrible. The throwing up stopped after the first week. I had sever dry mouth, and then got the wonder side effect of not being able to achieve orgasm. I didn't know it could effect females like that.  I evently had to stop taking it. It was very frustrating not being able to "finish" with my partner.  It made her feel like she was not good enough.  That was not the case.  But anyway my panic attacks have been coming back but not nearly as strong. If it didn't have that side effect then I would probably still be taking it. I now take Wellbutrin XL and Seroquel. They seem to be working okay other then the Seroquel has made me gain weight like crazy.

In my particular world depression has won nearly every match and continues nearly undefeated headed to the playoffs.

column10: After being physically assaulted, I experienced death wishes and overall depression.  This drug slowed my thoughts and controlled the depression. column3: a concerned patient, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: After the first day of taking this medication, I was unable to sleep more than 4 hours that night and had virtually no appetite.  This continued until the 3rd day when I experienced extreme palpitations and fast heart rate with some pinching and tight  feelings in the left chest area.  At that point I stopped taking the medication but was unable to return to the prescribing doctor due to financial concerns.  I am still concerned this drug may have damaged my heart in some way, or precipitated a heart condition I have never had before.  Also, after discontinuing this drug I was completely exhausted and weak for several days.  Maybe my experience with this drug is uncommon, but I still believe this drug is too dangerous to be on the market.  I would not recommend it to anyone!!!  (It should be noted that all my tests the prior year were negative including complete lab work and a nuclear stress test.  I am 54 years old with no known prior medical conditions.)

column3: godfollowers, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: When I first started taking Lexapro (anxiety) it made me really sick to my stomach. I would feel very lightheaded. I was taking it in the morning though. I switched to nighttime and after about a week or two the side effects went away. So to anyone out there experiencing side effects give the medication a try for about two weeks. I was on 10mg at first and I did notice a difference. I wasn't so high strung, was able to focus so much better, and was able to deal with life in general much better. This only lasted for a couple of weeks and then I was back where I started. I went back to the doctor and he doubled the dosage to 20mg. I must say I've been taking it now for about a year and half and it is WONDERFUL for me! I am able to handle situations that I never would have been able to handle before. It also helps me with my "monthly" bouts of depression. If you're a female you know what I mean. I've got to be honest this has been a wonder drug for me. I realize that medication effects people differently and what's good for one person may not be good for another. But, if offered Lexapro by your physician, give it a chance. As with most other drugs you will probably experience some sort of side effects the first week or two. Thanks for letting me share and hopefully this review will be able to help someone.

column3: la, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I took Lexapro (10mg) for 4 years for mild anxiety and it worked very well. Weaning off of it was a nightmare. I felt like I had the flu for 4 months.  I had to wean VERY gradually to avoid severe headaches, feeling comatose.  Though it helped me through a tough era, I must admit if had I know about the withdrawal symptoms I would never have taken it.  I'm an active, busy person and I felt miserably sick during the weaning.  If you need to wean, get appropriate advice on doing it slowly.

column3: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Before I quit Lexapro I was on it for about 7 months.  The first side effect I began to notice was stiffening of muscles followed by joint pains.  I've now been off the drug for about 2 months and the joint pains haven't gotten any better.  I feel it prominently in the bones of my knees and elbows.  Beyond that, while on Lexapro, I had lowered sex drive, increased appetite, dizziness, and slight drowsiness, all of which discontinued upon stopping usage.  Withdrawal symptoms included vomiting, dizziness, confusion (at work), and a light head feeling.  The drug did alright while I was on it but the negative effects it caused in me didn't come close to outweighing the positive effects.

I have been going off the medicine gradually (tried going off cold turkey but that was painful - brain shocks and headaches that were scary).  Yaz has helped my mood swings and regular exercise has been great for my anxiety attacks.  I also know that eating healthy food helps me tremendously.  I'm hoping once I'm off Lexapro completely, I'll lose the excess weight and stop sweating!

column3: Sonia, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I was a 23 year old when I first started taking Lexapro for anxiety. Prior to starting the med, I was very stressed and close to depression. The main symptom I was experiencing was extreme muscle pain in my neck and shoulders along with tension headaches that would make me nauseous. I would also sometimes have panic-like symptoms, such as fast heart rate and sweating in some circumstances. Taking Lexapro was like NIGHT AND DAY. It made me feel less irritable, calm, and care-free without that "flat affect" feel of some other meds. Most of all, it reduced my muscle pain dramatically. The heavy cost of the med is completely worth it. Substitutions like Celexa (Citalopram) have side effects like weight gain and are not as effective. Lexapro is a great option for those that are physically stressed and need a pill to feel normal again. I stopped taking Lexapro when I felt ready (approx. 2 years later) and do not feel dependent at all. Make sure you  follow doctor's orders and wean yourself off it slowly.

column3: Corrie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: My daughter was murdered  March 2005, I started the Lexapro 6 weeks later, because I could not function at all.Since I have been taken it I am able to live my life, and raise her three children.Can't imagene where I would be without Lexapro. I have no side effects.

column3: Anna, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Had reaction at first when started with a whole pill. Had to stop taking it - felt very woozy and couldn't concentrate at work. I went back to my dr. and she told me that was normal at first but would go away in a few days. I tried again, taking only half the dosage for awhile and eventually moved up to the whole pill, without any trouble. And it has definitely helped me cope with the stress of life. Only other thing, I can't drink alcohol as I did before. I used to drink socially and having 2-3 drinks on a weekend was no problem. Now 1 is my limit - alcohol seems to affect me much more strongly and I don't enjoy having a drink like I used to. One more problem - sex drive decreased.  But overall, feel better and wouldn't dare stop taking it.

column3: jennyp, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: This medication has worked for me..almost immediatly upon taking it..my anxiousness has stopped and my sleep has improved dramtically. I would recommend this medication to anyone who can take it.  I had very little side effects from it.  All I had was a migraine the first few days, as i assume this was my body just adjusting to the new medicine

column3: mom2girls, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have been on and off lexapro for a few years.  It worked wonders for me.  I recently thought that maybe I would be ok without it and my anxiety and panic attacks returned.  My husband immediately knew that I had quit taking it!

column3: 50anfabules, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I was on Topamax and developed strong anxiety and panic symptoms.  I went on Lexapro and the first 3-4 weeks were terrible.  I was more depressed and anxious than ever.  After that fourth week, I literally felt like I woke up and discovered myself again.  I felt like me again, and didn't recognize how bad the depression was until the lexapro kicked in.  I still can feel all emotions, sadness, anger, etc. They just don't consume my life and the anxiety is around only when it truly is warrented.

column3: odie, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column3: coach's wife, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: jayde_riplee, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have stress induced depression brought on by circumstances out of my control at the time being. I have noticed a huge change, I smile more often, I sleep better at night, I'm less irritable. You don't realize how bad things are until you feel better, then to look back you wonder how you lived like that for so long. I'm very grateful for how i feel today!

column3: hardtopjeep02, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I was living with anxiety for about 6 years thinking that it was just going to go away. That was about 8 years ago. I was perscribed lexapro and was willing to try anything to make myself feel better. I started this medication and it made everything worse like 10 fold! But because of other people that I have known to take this medication I kept taking it and letting it work into my system. I didn't notice any signs of inprovement until about 3 and a half weeks. The side effects were horrid for me too! But after that 3rd week I started to defenately notice the pressure being taken off. I would recommend that if you are perscribed this medication take it for at least a month unless you have a bad reaction to it! It really has given me my life back! Just deal with the short time side effects it's so worth it!

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

I'm hoping over the next few weeks, things will improve. It's too early to make a proper judgement on the med. My anger has increased also. These may not necessarily be caused by Lexapro.

And I'm also going thru a challenging time in my life and panic attacks were happening a lot more often and it's helped that immensley. I was scared of losing myself and becoming a zombie as some have mentioned can happen on antidepressants and since this is the first time I've ever taken anything for anxiety, I was really nervous. But overall I have to say, I am pleased with Lexapro. I'm glad a I switched to the lower dosage and it's true, give your body a couple weeks to adapt, and then some of the effects go away. My side effects were dialted pupils, yawning, no appetite and extreme tiredness. Because I was so tired at first I took it at night and it did help me sleep! Anyway, I am grateful for Lexapro. I feel much better and I feel like I have a handle on my emotions.

column3: Pegasus, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I used to call my son names. then after words cry and tell him i was sorry. Now he is grown. he told his wife every thang i did . he has nothing to do with me now.

column3: Sleepless in the ATL, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: i started taking this medication for anxiety and sleep disorders.  it has been a life saver!  apparently, my moods were not that great before i started taking this as well as i feel like a new person, and i do better in my work, and with my family.it is never too late to start.  i began taking this at 45 and feel like i have a new lease on life.  i wish it had been available earlier.  i've not had the side effects characteristic of other drugs that i've taken that treat mood disorders.  no dry mouth, the detached feelings, or the occassional 'bad' thoughts.  from my perspective, it has been a wonder drug.my only regret is that every time i try to come off it, anxiety increases and i feel fatigued and dizzy.  sleeplessness also occurs.  apparently, some of us are just hard wired for certain things and need the drug to even us out.  it is worth it for me.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have been on anti-anxiety/depression meds for almost 15 years now.  I have tried everything from Paxil to Prozac.  The only other med that worked as wonderfully as this one was Paxil, I was on that for about 5 years untill I experienced 'Paxil Poopout'.  I switched to Lexapro from Citalopram after taking that for 2 years and the effects were immediate! Within 2 days I was calm and had NONE of the side effects that I have experienced with all the others.  The best.. no sexual side effects, my husband has noticed such a difference!

column3: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was having severe panic attacks and a little depression. I was a knew person after I started Lexapro. You always feel happy and content nothing bothers you any more. I think it causes a little weight gain, not sure if it's the medicine or me but, I did gain a few. I'm trying to come off of it now because I feel like I may be doing better now, I will go back on it if I start doing bad again. I started having seizures this is the reason for the Lexapropanic attacks etc. It has been about 1 week now and i'm feeing a little lite headed and emotional again.  If you decide to come off the Lexapro do it slowly and I think you'll be fine but, speak to a Doctor first. I was told you could start and stop any time no problem by a Doctor. Always talk to a Doctor first before any medicine, be sure it is right for you. Glad I know it's out there for me.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column10: My doctor and I were experimenting with some anti-depressants to find out which one was right for me. We came across Lexapro and we decided to try it. This pill made me lose weight. The downside of this was that if I missed a day, it would be like a bad crash and burn after an energy drink, and it would take my body 2 to 3 days to reboot back to normal. Also, when I would crash and burn by missing a dose, I would also get horrible headaches, like someone who drinks caffeine constantly and just goes off of it cold turkey.

As soon as I stopped talking it, I was able to deal with the anxiety - it wasn't as bad, then my doctor put me on Klonopin and I was back to normal again.

column3: hollywood, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column3: Blueyez, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Lexapro worked quite well for me other than the 12 lbs I gained during the short time I was taking it, with no change to exercise or diet. I finally felt like I was able to process emotions in a normal way.  My husband and I are trying to start our family so I had to wean myself off of both drugs.  Wellbutrin was quite easy to stop taking, however Lexapro was terrible.  I could not sleep, suffered from brain tremors" and could not concentrate on anything.  It took 3 weeks to completely get off of Lexapro and I still sometimes feel the side effects of stopping.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I am receiving treatment for depression from a psychiatrist. I wanted to die. I had fits of rage. My husband has PTSD long term .I started taking 10 mg Lexapro daily. It really pulled me out of the anger and depression . The dose ws increased to 20 mg.My suicidal and homicidal thoughts went away. Nothing bothered me. I literally became numb emotionally, just like my husband.I could not cry. After the dose was raised to 20mg,I had palpitations and chest pain, pressure. I went to the Dr. He said if these symptoms returned to call. These side effects subsided.  I experienced the fatigue, it passed. The worst side effect I've had is severe joint pain. I thought I could handle it, I was afraid of my depression returning. I decreased the dose  to 10mg. This didn't reduce the joint pain and swelling.My last dose was Sept. 18.I am 61 years old. My concern is that the drug has placed me into the possibility of having permanent arthralgia, arthritis. I am very healthy and work over 40hrs/wk as an RN. Will the pain diminish?

column3: dazilous54, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
alabamamelissa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I took my first 10mg pill on Thursday. I felt very nauseas and had severl loose bowel movements. I started to feel dizzy and shaky with cold sweats and had shortness of breath. I took another on Friday because I thought it would get better as it got into my system. NO! I was in the E.R. within 3 hours of my dose. I felt like I was not inside of my body. Like my thoughts were being controled for me and I had no emotion. I looked at my 2 year old crying and just watched. My husband was with me, thank God. He took me in and they told me to come off of Lexapro right away. I still feel very weak, disoriented and sick. How long does this last? I don't suggest this med to anyone! It may work for you, but I wouldn't risk what I went through!

This medication has helped me get back on track and lesson my anxiety as well. I recommended it to a friend as well and she could tell it helped her out in a few days as it did to me. I've been on Zoloft before and that took months to take effect and even then that did not seem to help as Lexapro did in just a few days. My drinking has also been cut back because of Lexapro.
