column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: Nausea was tolerable, headaches not great, insomnia for more than 2 day was horrible. Flushed the lot down the commode after 3 days.

column3: on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column10: I've been taking Lexapro for 5 weeks now and have just asked to be switched to a different medication (I start Sarafem soon). I have been on 10MG a day. The problem is that I have no sex drive and no more orgasms! It's horrible!!! To make matters worst, it didn't help resolve my PMDD I just ended up crying all the time. I'm glad I took it because it did make a difference in making me feel better as far as anxiety, but this one is just not for me.

column3: Hope, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column10: I take 10 mg a day. It has really helped me  A LOT. I have had no side effects whatsoever. I've been on it about 3 months and it started working right away. I took St. John's Wort before this, which was not strong enough. Then I took 5HTP which worked better for me. But due to some bad life stress, I needed something even stronger. Prozac worked well for me years ago, but my body became tolerant to it. I wanted to try something different. Had a few side effects with Prozac, but no side effects with Lexapro. It balances out my  moods. It is expensive though because there is no generic available in the USA and my insurance won't cover it. So eventually I may try to just go back to using 5HTP, in addition to non-medical ways to reduce stress.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: My doctor diagnosed me as having PMDD, so he put me on this medication. It has worked very well for the past 13 months. I don't have severe mood swings, my nerves don't feel "raw", and I feel like I can get through the day without it being a struggle.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was put on Lexapro (10mg a day) after having prolonged anxiety and panic attacks. I have now been on it for about 10 months and it has helped me immensely! I am much more calm and rational. The only side effects I had were during the first 2-3 months: one of my legs would suddenly jerk if I were lying in bed reading or watching tv. Kind of strange, but not something that would make me stop taking it. I have no side effects whatsoever now and it is truly working for me!

column3: Mandy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: have been on for only 1 week but unable to keep warm, day 3 could hardly stand up legs shaky, had a hypo type episode also. always tired more so than prior to commencing.wasn't having sleep issues prior, some now. sensory issues also-vision. feel like crap!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I was placed on a cocktail of Klonopin (aka Clonazepam) and Lexapro (10mg) for serious anxiety that was somatizing into physical stomach pains.  The combo worked great, and the klonopin worked to combat the drowsiness.  Things changed and my anxiety decided to become monogamous with mr. depression, so they upped my dose to 20mg a day (still with the klonopin).  So, it is working...but like everyone knows, these drugs take time to build up in your system, and it takes your body even longer to stop hating them and making you sick.  I am nauseous into week 3 of the increased dose, and still dizzy all the time.  But, just as I did when first prescribed, I know it will be worth it, so I will wait.Sexual side effects- TRUE.  Zero sex drive.Weight gain (aside from normal fluctuations or just eating like a piggy): 13 pounds in 2 and a half years total.Note about anxiety/panic- I was suffering from 3-5 debilitating attacks a week.  Even on my cocktail of only 10 mg of Lexapro, I had ZERO.

column3: Ronald, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have been moody all my life so i am hoping that this pill will let me be happy

column3: kaycee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have been on lexapro for over two years at 40m.g.per day and cannot say how much it has improved my depression.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: MAKES ME VERY SLEEPY.

column3: littlekat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Have been on this medication for three years and it has changed my whole outlook.  I am not fearful of leaving my house anymore due to having panic attacks at unexpected times.

column3: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been taking Lexapro for about 5 weeks.  Overall, I would say that it has definitely helped me with depression.The main reason I am writing this is that I experienced strong anxiety, bordering on panic attacks, for the first couple of days that I was taking the drug.  My doctor was skeptical that this was possible so quickly - one of the main reasons he prescribed Lexapro specifically was due to the relatively low incidence of major side effects.  I just want to make sure that anyone else who experiences a similar reaction initially knows that it is not just them.  The major anxiety went away for me after a couple of days.  I have had some degree of a lot of the side effects listed (dry mouth, stomach issues, some decrease in sex drive, etc.) but they have dissipated over time.With Lexapro, counseling, and some changes that I made in my life, I have been able to go from being pretty depressed most of the time (to the degree of having borderline suicidal thoughts) to feeling fairly close to normal.So just some encouragement that though some people may have more difficulty getting started on the drug than they are led to expect, it has been worth it in my experience.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro changed my life.  I definately was lacking something in my brain all my life.Always Anxious, angry & agitated, unable to enjoy life, unable to feel. Since taking Lexapro, the last 5 years have been the best years of my life.  My family also noticed the change in me.

column3: none, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Had it prescribed to treat postpartum depression.  It helped my depression but has its drawbacks.  Weight gain, no libido, occasional depression(not as bad), fatigue.  I'm going to see if my Dr. can prescribe something else because I've started have short anxiety bouts, palpitations. I don't think that's normal.

column3: johnnie, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: Impotence should be discussed before being put on Lexapro. And viagra or something simliar along with testosterone replacement if needed

column3: Amy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro for 2 months. The side effects were horrible in the beginning. I could not even function to go to the grocery store. It actually took me a full month to adjust, but now that I have, it is working wonderfully. I am borderline anorexic, so I am watching my weight very closely. I have actually lost 5 pounds (which I didn't need to lose), but exercising with it makes me feel a ton better. I plan to continue unless my weight changes. I am so glad that I stuck through those horrible weeks.

column3: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: This was given to me for depressive disorder, I have been on it for 3 months and overall I feel good.  A few draw backs that people need be made aware of that I was not until after I began treatment.  1. Sexual side effects for me have been horrible-  I have NO sex drive now  2. I am tired all the time. 3. In 3 months I have gained over 20 pounds. If you are willing to possibly give up sex, be tired most of the time and gain weight- then this is a great anti-depressant.  Nothing bad to say about the effectiveness- just the side effects add a whole new load of issues to deal with.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: i am much more even tempered but the sexual side effects are not great

column3: barb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: my physician prescribed Lexapro for hot flashes that were making my life horrible. I was having a flash every 10 minutes and now I have around 5 a day.

column3: tried almost everything, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Really helps with GAD and depression.  Only problems have been with severe burning stomach pain which has began to subside after a couple of weeks. This med has worked better for anxiety than any other anti-anxiety med I have taken. So far it has been better than ativan (I was so out of it with even low doses on this med) and even k-pin (which seemed to make me almost psychotic at times). As long as it works, I'll never stop taking it, since it helps both my depression and anxiety.

column3: supplymsgt, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
CHICO, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: My MD prescribed this for PMDD- Boy sorry I even started it.. I was a witch BEFORE now it does not even stop when I start my cycle!! This made me more depressed crying all the time feeling useless and disgusted with myself. Also made me gain weight!!!Never again.. I have heard good thing about Sarafem for PDMM anyone else?

column3: ccam, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have tried many other meds for Depression and GAD, this works best with very minimal side effects. It does make you tired, so I make sure to take it in the evening-not morning-works much better.  It works great for anxiety especially, very calming but not drugged feeling. It is very expensive and my insurance doesn't cover the cost, so I have my doctor write a perscription for 20 mg pills (same price as 10mg) and I just take half a pill (10mg). That has cut my monthly cost in half ($40 mo instead of $80). Very difficult to stop taking....it takes months to reduce the dosage and taper off of the medication, still unpleasant.

column3: Devorah,  Female
column10: I am  unsure yet of my experience with this medication as I just started on it. I also take a medication for mirgaines, so I must be careful what I use. My last migraine lasted 70 days and as a result my coping skills were depleted hence the lexapro. There is a side story here, but I shant go into it. I have not experienced weight gain just the opposite I have no appetite. I have been told no wheat gluten as it will increase the chances of a migraine and I also have just recently been told I have cysts on the left side of brain that need to be removed  hence the cause of the mirgaine. When it rains it pours does it not. I am sensitive to meds so my options are limited. But you all are so very strong and will get through this. I have read many of your comments and what I hear from all of you is there is strength in your voices. And you share your stories here with each other so people like me come along and read them and we do. We take strength from your words and your perserverence and admire your willingness to shre with strangers. Thank you all. I wll say a prayer that all of you find hope in the sharing. I never join these kinds of things but I do not know what is happening to me and I feel like I am standing on the outside of the world looking in on everyone else. I have never been sick broke my neck once but I came back from that with Gods help and my friends and family. I am the strong one for others, how do I be strong for myself? God bless all of you. Be well one day at a time, Chersih you life today and now. Devorah

column3: none, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
t_irongirl00, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: HORRIBLE (FOR ME)!!! DOC SAID THAT LEXAPRO WAS SUPPOSED TO BE SO GREAT AND DIDN'T HAVE AS MANY SIDE EFFECTS AS OTHER SSRI'S...SO I WAS EXCITED! THEN...I TOOK MY PILL..ONE SINGLE PILL... AND WITHIN A MATTER OF 30 MINUTES I WAS AT THE TOILET DRY HEAVING(I WOULD HAVE THROWN UP ACTUAL FOOD BUT THE ANXIETY WAS SO BAD I COULDN'T EAT), THEN I GOT THE RUNS...MEANTIME I HAD A SEVERE POUNDING HEADACHE, WAS EXTREMELY DIZZY AND DISORIENTED, VERY WEAK...THE NEXT MORNING I COULD BARELY MOVE...ALL THESE SIDE EFFECTS MADE ME SO EXHAUSTED..TWO DAYS OF HELL FOR ONE 10MG PILL. IT WORKS AMAZING FOR SOME PEOPLE, BUT NOT FOR ME! NEVER AGAIN!

column3: kam52599, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I took Lexapro for 1 1/2 years I loved the way it made me calm, relaxed not drug induced just like you would feel when you weren't stressed.  Most people with GAD doesn't know what that feels like.  I had VIVID dreams yelling out but asleep, trying to get away from someone and kicking my husband (hee hee) It was all funny in the end.  This stopped and the tiredness began.  I was EXHAUSTED all the time could sleep 24/7.  We ran every blood work we could think of and finally came to the Lexapro.  I was taking 20mg then cut it to 10mg and slowly quit taking it.  The Fatigue went away.  I was so unhappy because I knew I would have to switch and loved Lexapro.  But if I can't get out of bed to care for my children there isn't much benefit.  I have been switched to Cymbalta.  I hope it is Lexapro without the severe fatigue.

column3: 2parrotmom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: 3weeks of use.starting at 5mg. as this med gets into my system i am experienceing less anxiety and a more even temperment. No instant fix but give hope that this will be what works for me. I Like the tiredness side effect because i have trouble falling & staying asleep. Weight gain is a major concern as I have worked hard to lose and keep it off, but will continue to eat right and excercise and watch the scale. No other side effects have been experienced. Its a trade off concerning meds, but sometimes what you need to make you feel better is your attitude and constant check in with yourself, There are no instant fix me drugs out there. It all must work together but feeling less overwhelming depression is the goal to effective decision making.Important to work with your Dr. be honest and do not follow your own advice as far as how much you need or dont.You need to work together on this, their medical knowledge is what you pay for. Have tried many different drugs for depression but this one is so far so good. Hang in there.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I took Lexapro for depression, OCD, and trichotillomania (hair pulling) for 2 years until I was on new health insurance that wouldn't cover it. $200/month for the prescription wasn't an option!  Now that I'm on insurance that will cover it, I have been on a month. However, I am epileptic and had a small, myoclonic seizure this afternoon (similar to a reaction I had to a migraine medicine). I'm upset that I might have to stop taking the only drug I have found to treat depression, OCD, and trichotillomania!

column3: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column3: goldie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column3: happyvamp, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column10: I love this medicine, it truely saved my life!

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)

(crying, depression, anxiety) I started on Lexapro 10mg and after 1 week I am sleeping really well, have no anxiety and feel more balanced all around. I've had no sexual side effects. I love it.

column3: cruise1vmp, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: fine

column3: Stormie03, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: This was the first antidepressant I have ever taken. I took 10mg, once daily.  I felt better after just 2 doses, more energy, less depressed.  The first dose caused nausea, so I took it with some juice and yogurt the second time and had no nausea.  Then the next night I woke to shortness of breath and chest pains.  After a trip to the ER, they determined I had a rare (like affects less than 1% of population) side effect of a severe panic attack.  I had never experienced anxiety to that extreme or a panic attack, so it scared the living crap out of me.  I was advised to stop taking it immediately and after 24 hours, I had no more anxiety or jittery feelings.  I feel like Lexapro would have really helped my depression if it wasn't for that side effect.  I'm apprehensive about taking anything else right now and have been trying vitamins and supplements to help with my depression.  However, I think I'll be talking with my doctor to try a different antidepressant...

column3: me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I felt ok with taking this but had to go to 5 mg once a day to wean off of it and it has made me feel nauseous and really irritable and tired since I finaly stopped a week ago.  Am I the only one this has happened to.

column3: sandy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I fell good while useing this medicane but i just realised i am not suppose to use this medicane if i have seisureaze its hard to spell some times they also use it for head ach relive i dont always feel well.

column3: debbyoz, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I have CFS and have not slept one night in 14 years since I have been on Lexapro I have slept  and feel very rested in the Morning.

column3: sherrynms, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have just begun taking this drug (2 weeks now) on the advice of my PA.  I have never taken any type of depression pill before now, I am 50.  I felt like I was going to lose my job of 21 years, and I had to get myself through a very bad place with my employer.  So far, I am sleeping much better, I have chosen to take my 20 mg. pill at 8:00 PM, so I am not so tired in the morning.  One of the great benefits I have noticed is that my fibromyalgia has virtually disappeared.  I noticed that some folks are complaining about weight gain so I am taking extra care to eat healthier and I feel like exercising again.  I hope this positive reaction I am having keeps going.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: saved my sanity

column3: mtfchef, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was taking lexapro and was feeling great, than after about 3 months I started having suicidal nightmares, and nightmares of killing friends and family, I called my doctor after a few nights and she took me off it that day.  7 days later I went through major withdrawls and had the worst day of my life.  I now take .5mg twice daily of alprozolam, and I feel great.

column3: nanc, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I feel this has helped me a great dealwith my night sweats and day sweats dueto menopause

column3: baglady54,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

My desire has not changed in fact I think because I am more relaxed now instead of sad or moody my desire has increased and wondered if it was because of the medicine.

column3: cat87, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro 20mg for about 2 months. Have had great results. I took Zoloft in the past and I don't notice the same numb feelings with Lexapro that Zoloft gave me. Side effects-I have a decreased appetite and will find myself spacing out and not participating in conversations. Overall-a big help with my anxiety.

column3: Dee,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Be careful what you wish for on this medication. I had a trauma induced depression and was recommended this to treat the depression and for anxiety. It took away the axiety alright. It also took away my sex drive, my laughter, my sadness, my happiness, my concern for others and my concern for myself. I was a complete flat line stuck in purgatory. Two of my friends had a similar experience, plus weight gain. I had NO anxiety because all of my emotions were sucked out of me. I almost drove off the road and did not even flinch! This was no way to live. I was off of meds again for another 8 months until another tragedy happened. I went on welbutrin recently and have had significant improvement in my mood and overall well being. My goal is to cope. We are supposed to experience some level of disappointment in life, so I am not sure why anyone would want that kind of fix. I just started welbutrin 2 months ago. I am very satisfied with the results. I laugh and cry, like a normal human being. Lexapro was also difficult to come off of. I had problems with my equilibrium for nearly a week.

column3: stugglingmichelle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have been on the drug for 6 months now, and my depression has worsened. I have gained 20 pounds, muscles cramps where i can hardly move, and the gas I have on it is outgrageous. my libido has been zero, i can not get off to safe my soul.  I am switching to Wellbutrin because of less side effects and to help curve the cravings.

column3: quiet thunder, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I was initially prescribed Celexa for panic disorder but eventually switched to Lexapro because my primary physician said it works better in women with severe cases of PMS as well. I'm good now. The only real issue I have with Lexapro is the cost. It seems an outrageous amount of money to pay for a month to month supply when Celexa seemed so much more inexpensive. It's even worse when there's no insurance. They say you can't put a price on staying healthy; yes you can. It's a catch 22. I'm disappointed.

column3: Eileen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

It seems to be working --I have taken it now for 6 months and the side effect that bothers me the most is the weight gain -- I have gained almost 30 lbs :( -- not to happy about that but I am happy not to be having panic attacks !!!

column3: wildflower, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have tried so many different kinds of anti-dep., and this one is the best so far.It is helping with my anxiety a lot and also my PDSD.I plan on staying on this one for a long time as depression runs in my family and when i go off my meds i feel awful so i guess i really need them.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have just started taking Lexapro for anxiety. I am pretty relaxed but very tired. I take it at night to help but it doesnt seem to matter. My doctor said it just takes a while to build up in my system and my sleepyness should go away.

column3: corelle2, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro for 1 week now for Panic Disorder, I already feel so much better. My family has noticed a difference to. I am very happy with it. I am also taking ativan for those really stressed out days. With the combination of both I feel great. Much better than Zoloft and Xanax.

column3: dream247, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: my doctor prescribed lexapro after i began getting constant headaches from generic paxil. the first week i seemed to be fine with no headaches, but did notice increase in weight.  i have been on an exercise program now for 5 months and have been very successful in losing weight. one month on this med and i have gained a total of 15 pounds all that i lost plus 5. because of this weight gain i feel more depressed and unwilling to go and do anything.  i decided to go off the drug slowly,10mg, 5mg, to 5mg every other day and this is my 5th day without and i feel worse than ever. i am angry, sad, dizzy, aches and pains all over, nightmares, night sweats...i have called my doctor and hopefully she can subscribe another med that will help me get through all of this.  i have never experienced a feeling like this before, i'm worse off than before.

column3: Ribflipper, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I was originally given Lexapro at the clinicI go to for depression associated with severe chronic pain.  I also have to takenarcotic painkillers & muscle relaxers and though it took some time to work Lexapro hasbeen VERY helpful for me with no negativeside effects or interactions with my other medications.  The use of antidepressantmedication as well as the excellent care I'mFINALLY getting for my maddening debilitat-ing pain has literally SAVED my life and given quality of life back to me.  Thanks!

column3: Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have experienced reduced symptoms related to my depression within a few weeks of being on the medication. I have few or no side affects. I take my pill every morning around the same time and my day is brighter. The only side affect I notice and its only cuz I have been taking it for 2 weeks is I get unpredictably tired. I can sleep at night 5-8 hours, and during the day, I want a nap for a few hours. Other than that...no problems. I have not been as depressed or anxious since starting this medication.

column3: on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year

column10: I feel pretty good. I am much more happier. The only thing that has me feeling bad about myself is the weight gain. I think I've gained weight because I'm content with myself.

column3: christina, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I really feel like this medicine has helped quite a bit for depression and anxiety. The down fall is that I do not have insurance and I have to pay full price and it isn't cheap!

column3: applefarmer, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: It worked, but it caused insomnia and also sexual side effects (loss of sensation) so I had to switch to Paxil.

column3: mac7637, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I started this medication because I was having panic attacks on a regular basis with no specific cause.  My doctor recomended that I start on Lexapro to see if his would help with them. column3: stella, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

I didnt mind it actually.I went up to a max 20mg per day dose and my partner said i was a little more spaced out then, but not really noticeably. Im now back down to 10mg and over the last year or so have started to experience severe night sweats, im absolutely drenched in sweat and wake up most mornings feeling very tired, drained and dehydrated. I thought it may be a relation between the drug and my hormonal cycle. There seems to be some correlation between it and the time of the month.I hate the sweats but i dont want to stop the drug because im scared of how i will cope without it.I also see the trouble people have with other drugs, Lexapro seems to be the best available at the moment.What im curious about is...how does the drug make you sweat more? What is the chemistry behind it? Does anyone know?

column3: JK , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

My personal relationships have improved with my husband, kids, and other family. My family doesn't "annoy" me as much as before taking Lexapro, and I just feel like I can better handle and actually enjoy the constant demands of being a good wife, mother, daughter, sister, and full-time teacher. I don't worry about stress causing other health problems or damage to my family relationships anymore.

I continued to take it, thinking that it would go away.  On the 3rd day I began to feel flushed and hot.  The only way to describe it is as though my entire body was on fire on the inside.  I literally lay on the cold floor, nude, to get some relief (which didn't help).  I called the ER who put me through to poison control.  I was told basically that what I experienced was not a reaction and there was nothing to do but wait it out.  2 years later, a teacher in my school had the same experience with burning after taking this drug for about 1 week. Switched to Celexa...much more calming experience-made me yawn a lot...and feel a bit too lazy...now I am off all of them except my nightly insomnia med-sonata at the moment. Don't let your Dr. force antidepressants on you if your only symtom is insomnia. It may be a change of life issue, not a depression/anxiety issue.

column10: I have been on this med for almost 3 years now. I started taking it once about 5 years ago and stopped for about 6 months and it was hell. This med is a lifesaver for anxiety and depression but DO NOT discontinue use abruptly!!! The withdrawal symptoms are AWFUL!!!

column3: LD, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I was on both wellbutrin and Lexapro to stop smoking and was to stay on wellbutrin only a few months.  It ended up I switched doctors and I stayed on both a while then stopped the Lexapro because the wellb. gave me more energy.  I didn't realize over time that I'd become less able to think clearly or calmly.  I was shaking, trembling at times.  Bursts of anger and panic attacks, mad at the world and going over and over bad things that happened and really everything got to me.  I just last week returned to using the Lexapro.  Starting on 10 mg and this doctor said to go to 20 mgs.  At first I was dizzy and sort of sleepy, but I also was calmer and got things done.  I was having trouble leaving the house.  Now I get ready and go!  I can concentrate better and I'm getting so much more accomplished.  I sleep better and feel like I'm in a good mood, actually a little perky and much more outgoing.  I was on lexapro for about a year before the wellbutrin was introduced and it really helped in quitting smoking, but I now see I should have stopped the wellbutrin and stayed on my Lexapro.  It's expensive on my RX plan $50 a month but I feel convinced it is well worth it.  If anyone know when the generic will come out, let me know!!!!!  Thank you for listening!

column3: mamaclaire, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been taking xanax for years and my Dr combined it with the lexapro the first week was horrible the anxiety was 10 times worse but the side effects subsided and now im very happy and using less xanax, you have to work through the side effects to get the end result there is no miracle pill out there. You have to give your body time to adjust to the medication.

column3: Mel, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: MD prescribed 5 mgs/day for change sypmtoms and mild gad.  I had been on it for 6 weeks. Not bad at first. After about 3-4 wks I began having fast heartbeat, weakness on right side, insomnia got worse, felt more anxious than ever before. It was not good so I stopped taking it altogether and have been feeling much better. The weakness on the right side was very scary.  It also raised my blood pressure even though I take med for BP control.  Lexapro did not agree with me.

column3: slesmond, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I had no emotions what so ever; good or bad. Plus I was always tired but when I got in bed at night I couldn't fall asleep. I was worn out and it really made me feel worse off than before I started taking it.

column3: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: Mrs Norm, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column10: I became suicidal using SSRI's. My brothers were given Lexapro; one became suicidal, the other was agitated, suicidal and extremely hostile. The doctors did not agree it was an effect of the drug, but the FDA person I contacted wanted a formal complaint which I filed. These men and I were in our 50's, but the warnings only mention kids and teenagers. It was horrible  since the doctors did not believe Lexapro could be so damaging, but one brother harmed himself severely. Twice.

column3: Larry 36, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column10: I have been on med for a week. I am a caregiver for my spouse who is battling lung, brain, & bone cancer. PROS: Lost some weight, quit daily binge drinking, worrying less. CONS: Nothing serious yet. Constipation was handled with Sennecot. Drinking lots of water and Gatoraid for dry mouth. Still fantasize about women.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro almost 2 years ago and love it.  I'm happier than I've been in 20 some years.  I was in a VERY bad place when I finally saugh help.  The first month it did make me tired so I switched it from morning to evening.  I don't really remember if it caused me to eat more or not.  I really don't care if it does.  I would much rather be fat and happy than thinner and suicidal.  I am loving life now!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: My dr. prescribed lexapro for me on friday for general anxiety disorder. The first day I took it, I started suffering from severe panic attacks... I would get burning hot through my arms, neck and chest, and would start to hyperventilate. I also was nervous/anxious all day, and was starting to get rather depressed, crying thinking I may have to live the rest of my life like this. The dr said I was having a reaction to the med. I stopped taking it 2 days ago, and am slowly starting to feel normal again. She is going to try another med tomorrow, but now because of this reaction, I'm soo scared to try something else. Has this happenned to anyone???

column3: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

The only downside is the weight gain, but some general dieting and exercise really help to take care of that. (I hear exercising helps with depression some too.)

started over a week ago. tonight will be my 9th does of 20mg. was on zoloft 50mg for many years and decided to taper myself off to 25mg while also quitting smoking with the patch. needless to say I went into a bad state of anxiety, experiencing 4-5 panic attakcs daily for a few weeks. doctor recommended lexapro. first 5 days were horrible. I was experiencing bad head pains, inability to concentrate, inability to be around anyone but myself and shaking. called my doc after 5 doeses, he told me to hang in there, let it work for 2 weeks. last 2 days been feeling better. little to no anxious feelings. hope it works because its scary not to be able to function in life.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I would not tell anyone I know to go on this drug. I was like a zombie and had people telling me I had no emotions. I experienced weight gain big time on this drug, along with not sleeping and being tired all the time. I started weening it out of my system 2 months ago and I feel so much better. if you are looking to go on this drug please go and type in side effects from lexapro in your browser and you will be shocked at what you will find. I love webmd, but all the side effects are not listed here.

column3: gretchen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

Doctor changed me to Zoloft after 6 weeks because I gained 26 lbs. in 6 weeks. Other than the weight gain I would reccomend it.

column3: angie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: the feeling of being dizzy is to much for me to tollorate... I have not slept well for along time this was supposed to be the fix it drug, it seems to be making things worse.. Tingling in my fingers and toes...

column3: sarah, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column10: there is no generic for the lexapro, but it is well worth it.  It alleviates depression and anxiety.  Spend the money on yourself, you will be glad that you did.  No headaches, dizziness, or sexual dysfunction with lexapro.

column3: pc, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: Took Lexapro for anxiety/depression. While it did calm me down, I felt like a zombie. Had no feelings what so ever, felt detached from life. Very scary experience, I decided to start and end with half of the pill 5mg. Took it for 3 weeks, three days since I stopped taking it, and still feel like a zombie.

column3: Redheadlady911, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I took this medicaion when I was going thru a divorce. Initally it helped a lot, but after being on it for about a year I and my family notice a change in me and a decline in effectiveness. I would even say it turned against me. I gained a lot of weight (30+ pounds) and I became more severly depressed. I even found myself thinking I couldn't live this way. That scared me to death. I quit taking it. My new boyfriend and family said they noticed in a week after quiting that I was a different, happier woman. Since quiting it I was fine and did loose the weight. That was the clincher. I have seen and heard from other patients similar stories in my work in the medical field. I would not recommend it. I felt the side effects were worse than the depression I felt. Please seek help though. This is my opinion only. There are many options.

column3: stressedout, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Took Lexapro for about 1 year. Help with anxiety. I did gain about 20lbs and had bad sexual side effects. I had no desire to have sex and when I did it took forever. I stopped taking the drug and was dizzy for a few weeks, but it finally went away.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: It saved my life! I was so riddled with anxiety I didn't want to continue to live that way. I have little to no anxiety now, I can laugh again and focus on things other than the "what if's"! I have gained a lot of weight. 40-50 lbs! Partly because food is not the enemy anymore. Even with a diet and exercise I am unable to loose any of it. I have also lost my sex drive but I think it may be due to the unattractiveness of my current heavy state, not a side effect specifically. I hesitate to go off as I can feel the anxiety if I forget to take it. Do I stay on it forever? How do I cope with the anxiety with out it? How much more weight will I gain? Is being fat and unhappy better for me than being anxious and unhappy? Will I have horrible withdrawls if I wean off? these are some things I still need to find out. Anybody have answers?

column3: Anonymous, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: Lexapro is a drug that you should NOT just stop.  You definately need to be "weened" off of it. column10: I wrote a comment about a week ago, explaining that the side effects were terrible.  Now that I've been on this for almost 2 weeks, I'm not experiencing the side effects as heavily. column3: Pam, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

( As a woman I know we research the weight gain part of meds.) Also, lexapro is a very mild medication, and only takes the edge of MDD.  I am supposed to take stronger meds but hate the zombie and weight gain effects.  In conclusion, I am not sure if their IS ANY help for this condition.  Side effects can further the depression.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I gained about 75 pounds.  I am making a conscious effort on the Lexapro.

column3: LifePaths, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I am on week 4. My temper and outbursts have minimized as well as my axiety.  During the first two weeks I took 1mg of Lorazepam in the evening, and 1/2mg in the morning to ease the transition into this therapy which seems to be working well.  The Lorazepam helped me to sleep at night until this medication began to work.The most difficult side effect for me has been the morning nausea (the urge to vomit).  I discontinued the use of Lorazepam after three weeks with some insomnia and night sweats. Sexual desire has waned slightly, and arousal takes a bit longer but engaging is still as good.  I am a large man but have not experienced any weight gain but the urge to eat more frequently is there.This therapy does work but I am not certain if this is for a lifetime.Take Care!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have suffered with PD for around 8 months. Lexapro was the first medication I tried and it worked really well. I still feel a bit depressed sometimes but it has worked wonders on my anxiety. I can leave the house and drive on my own again. I have been on 10mg a day since January 08.

column3: mamaR, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro for intestinal and digestive illness.  At first the racing heart, and being unable to sleep for two weeks was unsettling. I blew up at a technician at the hospital for no good reason the second week!  Anger was not my thing before taking this drug!  I was told by the pharamacist that Celexa would be so much cheaper since it just went to a $4.00 price, but I'm not sure of the change, and my doctor ignored me when I suggested the change.  Perhaps he makes more money when he orders Lexapro?  Although my stomach calmed down some, I experienced a huge appetite, the opposite of what I was told by the doctor!  I ignore my stomach now, and I'm not as moody as I was when my stomach was always painful.  I must say though, I also seem to have developed a void of emotions.  It's like I can't even cry when it would be appropriate.  I question whether this is a temporary thing.I'm going to continue to research this drug before taking it long term.

column3: sunflower13, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column3: doll, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

LrCarterCPhT, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have been taking Lexapro for a week and I am soooo tired, I am taking it for depression & a chronic pain syndrome. I see alot of people on here say they can not afford this drug. Google discount drug cards and thousands come up and u can check the price, the cards are free and you can print them out. GOOD LUCK!!

column3: ANY ONE GETTING WEIRD SIDEEFFECTS FROM LEXAPRO ? , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I crashed from anxiety, stress and i jumped out of my skin, horrible mental breakdown out of nowhere.  (years of stress or hormonal imbalance, not sure) Either way I have tried to keep my mind stable.  I felt very stable before i crashed.  I started Lexapro 10 and it was too strong, it made me scattered, hyper mentally (no physical side effects) and I couldnt complete a chore because I couldnt think straight.  Somewhere in the middle of all this I became OCD with horrible thoughts ( i think it was panic/depression setteling in) and i fought this away.  With doctors guidance, I lowered lexapro to 5 milligrams and most days seem ok, but like today, I woke up fine exersized mentally perfect.  I took lexapro same time every day and within 15 minutes It makes me feel weird, detached, cant focus, WEIRD and not a good weird.  feel horrible.  It takes a while to wear off and I take 1/2 a lorezepam to fix what the lexapro might be doing.  I am not 100% sure about lexapro or just going natural and taking a lorezepam or 1/2 a lorezepam when panic/mind racing starts to come on.  If anyone is having the same problem with lexapro, please respond in this website.  I want to try and like and stay on lexapro but it can give me really bad days after I take it.  I FEEL FINE BEFORE I TAKE IT.  I dont get it.  Thanks.

column3: josephine davey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have tried MANY different drugs for panic/depression. Nothing worked. Most made things worse.  I was finally diagnosed OCD and prescribed only 5mgs of Lexapro. It really made a HUGE difference. I could enjoy things again!!! The only side effects I had were some dry mouth (and that went away in the second or third week, and I had more bowel movments(!)This was accually a good side effect. It seemed to make me more "regular". I am definately happy with this med. The only reason I only gave it 3 stars in "ease of use" is it costs alot even with my insurance, but even that is not enough to make me stop taking it.That being said, my husband also took it, and it didn't work for him. his dosage was higher, and he experienced sexual side effects, both lack of desire and anorgasm. It was bad enough to make him change to a different drug. I have known a few other people who tried this med. Now, this is in no way a scientific survey, and comes from a very small sample, but from what I have gathered from other users, it seems like this drug may work much better for women the men.

column3: Joe, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: After 4 days on Lexapro (5mg), I stopped taking it. The side effects were so bad -- extreme tiredness, weakness, very dry mounth, lost of appetite; restlessness, jettery, and nervousness. This is the 2nd  day without Lexapro and I still have thw side effects. I am not going on more anti-depressant drugs again.

column3: Bree, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Was first put on 10mg Lexapro for GAD but it wasn't doing the job.  Dr. then put me on Celexa 60mg/Welbutrin 300mg. After 5wks on both, I had severe panic attacks 6-8 times a day. From there I went on Zoloft 150mg. HORRIBLE!!!! Couldn't get out of bed, sad all the time. Finally put back on Lexapro 20mg.  AMAZING.  I feel in control, strong and independent.  No panic attacks, less obessive thoughts, only sad and depressed with situations(not "just because".)  This medication has been a real lifesave.

column3: mjomalibu, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

When I read the reviews it almost looks like the people with Anxiety benefit far greater than the people with depression or greater dis-orders.

I felt more alive than I think I ever did. I got off of it because of the weight issue and my blood pressure, I am now on Effexor...no weight gain, just as good of results

I have been taking this for about 4 months now, and I have not had any bad side affects.  I have lost weight, not gained it and it is as easy to take as any other med.  I am glad I've taken this and I seem to be much happier on it.

column3: lunasea4@gmail.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

My side effects are quite different than those mentioned: I become extremely tired and sleep well at night and it actually reduces my appetite. I have lost a few pounds. After three months, I wean myself off the medication, until the next attack occurs.

column10: This drug has been very effective in mitigating my depression.  However, the insomnia, weight gain, and negative effect on my libido are unacceptable side effects and are profound indeed. column3: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Vegan World, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Neither my psychiatrist nor psychologist can tell me what diagnosis i have exactly. But, the general consensus of the three of us is that i have characteristic (in my blood & bone, born with it) depression and anxiety. So they said: "Go with Lexapro". I have been on it for a little more than a month now. I think it's working. My anxiety has subsided. I used to have these feelings of loneliness, despair quite often and easily triggered. I still get anxious and lonely but not as frequently and i do not  start feeling as hopeless. The first week on this pill i could not sleep, now i can barely get out of bed in the morning. But it is a kind of nice sleepy feeling, very relaxed and comfy. Strange. I have always sweated a lot, with wet stains underarms. Now it is even worse. But, i swear, it does not bother me as much, i kind of look at it more calmly, without panicking and running to change the shirt. Funny. So, Lexapro is working for me pretty decently, but i certainly do not want to be taking it forever, and i hope to not get bad withdrawal symptoms.

column3: Was_normal, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Although it did help somewhat with my anxiety, the side effects were terrible. Muscle pain and weakness. My Dr. recently did blood test and thinks I may have fibromyalgia. I never had any symptoms of this before taking Lexapro.

column3: feelinggreat, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was against taking a pill everyday, but I was at the point that I was letting anxiety and OCD completely control my life to the point that I didn't even want to leave my house.  I have tried a few different medications and I have found Lexapro to be the most gentle medication to my system.  The first week was a little hard to sleep and I felt dizzy especially when I was standing in one place for a long time.  I have been taking Lexapro for almost 5 months and I feel like me again.  I cannot wait to not have to take it anymore, but since I have been thrown quite a few obstacles lately, it is definitely helping the anxiety.

column3: shirl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

After having my son 15 months ago I feel like my patience and my worry is going through the roof and Xanax makes me want to sleep so I am trying this out again... has worked before so we shall see!

column3: sherri, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I initially started taking Lexapro for bipolar depression.  This medication made me worse, I wasn't able to concentrate and had two car accidents in one day!  I hate this medication and I told me doctor that I refuse to take it and showed him an article from the London Times that Lexapro has been banned in the U.K. and I believe it is a bad medication.
This medicine made me feel like I was wearing a 10lb. helmet on my brain.  I also, had word retreval problems.  Not easy to get off this med...

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: My number 1 complaint has been impulsive anger, sometimes to the point where I feel like I just want to rip my skin off.  My therapist has waivered in diagnosis from Panic Disorder to Depressive Disorder-NOS, and at this point I don't know what the diagnosis is, but Lexapro has helped a great deal!  It also was a pleasant surprise to find that it has helped my bug phobia and has helped me be a little more outgoing as well.  However, I have found that I am VERY sensitive to it.  Initially starting at 5 mg and then increasing to 10 mg, I had what I would describe as mild hypo-manic episodes and then when I tried to discontinue it due to sexual side effects (anorgasmic) I experienced SSRI Discontinuation Syndrome (withdrawl).  Within days I felt like I had been hit by a truck, my entire body ached so badly I could barely get out of bed, I experienced an electric shock sensation in my brain approx. every 30 seconds, and my temper was through the roof!  So, I ended up back on Lexapro to allieviate those symptoms and to wean off it more slowly.  Months later, I came off of Lexapro with just the electric brain shock sensation (that never seemed to really go away) and after finding Wellbuitrin SR and XL ineffective, requested to add back 2.5mg of Lexapro and I'm back to feeling pretty good again.  Not as great as 5 mg, but at 2.5 mg the sexual side effects are minimalized.

column3: Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: All I wanted to do while taking Lexapro was stay home and sleep.  It made me SO TIRED!!! After a two week trial, I stopped taking it just to feel alive again.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro off/on for about 3-4 years...and it has helped so much once it gets in your system.. DO NOT TRY TO COME OFF OF IT BY YOURSELF..I tried this and I couldnt sleep for a week..it gave me a nervous feeling in my legs like someone was trying to pull them off. No a good feeling. I went to the doctor and he said it was like a "withdrawal" effect. But Lexapro has tremendously helped me! I would recommend it to anyone!

column3: Cathy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: changed my life, I cried everyday and was panicky all the time.  No more!

column3: ASR, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro prevents my from crying uncontrollably, however it has a marked effect on my libido (in the negative way).

column3: Michael , 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I developed panic attacks from accumulated job stress 2 years ago.  I was absolutely resistent to drug treatment, tryting months of alternative therapies.  After virtually no relief I finally "caved" and began Lexapro as part of a multi-pronged aspproach that seems to be working: I requested a role change at my job, committed to getting more sleep & eating better, started seeing a therapist, and began Lexapro @ 10mg.  It took 6 weeks for the med to work - the panic was less frequent and less intense but still needed xanax on occasion.  After 3 months, upped dose to 20mg and I am thankful at how I am WAY better than a year ago.  One noticeable side effect - I've gained 12 lbs in the last 2-3 months (hadn't gained weight in many years before), my Dr. told me virtually unavoidable with this class of meds.  I look at it as a necessary evil - I am functioning consistently almost like my old self again.  The weight gain is frustrating and I would think I'll lose it when I can wean off the drug, but it does work for me and is giving me hope to restore balance to my life again...

column3: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: My physician prescribed this medication for chronic pain.  I was having terrible headaches and nech aches for months, with no success from physical therapy etc. etc.  I was going through some life changes and had some anger issues, as well as mild anxiety and just a general lack of happiness.  I went from waking up in a bad mood and getting mad atleast several times a day to getting mad twice in 6 weeks!  I actually laughed afterwards b/c it was so amazing that I had changed so much.  I am generally a much happier person, though I am experiencing some side effects.  Difficulty sleeping at night (mild insomnia), and it is quite difficult to orgasm, though my girlfriend does not complain.  Overall my sex-drive is back, at first it went down, probably from frustration in not being able to orgasm, but I have control of that now.I've been on 10mg for 6 weeks and am very satisfied.

column3: Jo, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro since Oct 2007, due to stress and depression from my job. I started taking 10mg, along with The Patch to help me quit smoking. After a couple of weeks, and the Lexapro began to take it's full effect... I soon discovered that the two of them did not interact very well together. I ended up passing out from it. My Dr took me off the patch, purged my system from everything, increased my dosage to 20mg/day...Lexapro has helped me a great deal... I am back to work, with a better attitude, no thoughts of suicide, all is going well again.If I forget to take my meds before I go to bed (once in a while), I definitely can feel it. Or if I forget to call in my perscription and I'm off of the meds for a couple of days, I start getting the chest pains, become very agitated, irritable, and I begin to feel depressed again. So I do recommend Lexapro, and I do recommend that you don't forget to fill your perscription. If it helps you and you see and feel that it has improved you... and made you feel better than what you were feeling before you started taking it... keep taking Lexapro as a maintenance. It really does work.I hope this helped.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: i have been taking lexapro now for 3 to 4 months now and after about 2 months i started feeling depressed again and up it to 20mg and i feel better again but i havent been able to have a orgasm or even having the want to have sex

column3: jules, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: So far, the Lexapro has helped me,hard to tell about the side effects,I also started taking Lyrica,so it's been quite a ride so far.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column10: I've truly wish to extend a WARNING to all who decide to try Lex. It should be taken off the market. ANY drug that elevates your seratoin will also drop you hard. Ask ANYONE who's come off it. 40+ years ago, My brother was unwittenly addicted. He kicked that habit after going to Hell and back, swearing never again to replay that part of his life. However, recently he was involved in a near Death experience (roll-over accident), because of his inability to get back behind a wheel of a car, his Dr. prescribed him Lex. to help with the anixeity. The first month he was great! The end of the second month, his greatest nightmare RETURNED and has been ever since. This stuff is worst then any narcotic. I am not lying. I am talking from experience. I am really mad at his Dr. for prescribing this to him, without informing him of it's severe addictive powers. He now gets to deal with the sleepless nights, twitching, night sweats, nightmares, no energy, etc.; because of his Dr's lack of knowledge of medicines. This is a repeat of 40 years ago, when Doctors got a very young boy addicted, after an accident. Then after his families insurance ran out-they deemed him cured. Although, they forgot all about to un-addict him, during the process.Please, Please be ware!!! This stuff is like playing with Fire, you will get burned!

column3: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column10: I had bad depression after my father passed and wife left, moody and anger at simple things. With Lex 10, i can control my anger, feel relaxed, can sort out what is important to worry about and what isn't. No bad sexual side effects, actually can stay erect alot longer!! Have only been on for 4 weeks so far and it seems to be working great!

column3: 13-18 Female  (Patient)
column10: I switched to this medication after being on citolpram (celexa). I had severe nausea for the first week and could barely keep food down. However, it was completely gone after that and I felt grea. My anxiety is almost gone and I am much more laid back. I also don't feel any symptoms of depression & feel better than ever. I recommend it!

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I started Lexapro this past November after a suicide attempt. After about a month I felt wonderful and as an added bonus I had no appetite so I was losing a bit of weight. However I fooled myself into thinking that I didn't need it and stopped taking it cold turkey. DO NOT DO THIS!! I became depressed and suicidal once again. If you feel that it is time to discontinue use please talk to your doctor!! I am now back on it and feeling somewhat better. Live and learn I suppose. A few drawbacks are mild dizziness and nausea and a major one is NO sex drive but perhaps in time it will pass.

column3: missa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: It took a while to find a medication that works for my depression.  But I have have the best luck with this one.  I am still having major trouble gettting the pannic attacks undercontrol though.  One step at a time I guess.

column3: SMBTX26, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column3: Trader, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: Two partner neurologists treating me for spinal stenosis, vertigo and resulting anxiety after 2 years of suffering symptoms decided after less than 3 minutes in my first appointment that I just HAD to be 'depressed', and prescribed Lexapro.  Within 4 days I landed in the ER with a diagnosis of "acute drug reaction Lexapro" and they were peeling me off the ceiling.  Never before did I have such horrible thoughts... of homicide, suicide, insanity or unreality.  These neurologists should have had their licenses pulled, and this drug should never be prscribed unless by a licensed psychiatrist or psychologist and only after proper testing and full evaluation for 'depression'.  I've never been depressed a day in my life, thank goodness, and I'll never again accept an anti-depressant from any so-called 'doctor'.  This drug caused me the scariest incident of my entire half-century of living...

column3: EARS/BRIAN BUZZING, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

I sometimes feel weird/not like myself, and feels due to the medication.  It can put you in a manic (fast) state of mind.  The anxiety has subsided, but I am afraid to travel far from my doctors because I worry that the drug will flip me out a little.  Exersize is excellent, Lorezepam is excellent just in case and deep breathing great as well.SIDE EFFECT:  For the entire time, there is a low buzzing/like a radio frequency/ringing that I can hear in the am while waking up and middile of night when up from sleeping (can hear when its quiet)  Doctor not sure, pharmacist not sure.  Blood pressure and physically all tests fine.

Ive been 20mg now for about 6 months, and i have found myself in a constant state of depression. very little anxiety, but ive come close to suicide a few times. column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column10: From my heart....please, be careful when you take this.  Yes, it helped my anxiety and panic. I am a loving, sweet person and having a outgoing personality.  Lexapro made me have extreme mood swings and I became VERY hostile.  I actually, bought a book on "Anger Management".  I felt like I had no control over my actions and it was not a way to live.  My husband called me "PITBULL", because of my out of control aggression. It was a horrible six months!!  I finally came of Lexapro and I am back to being the sweet, kind, gentle individual, I use to be.  Now, I am on Cymbalta and it really works for the panic attacks.  Please, watch for side effects and talk to your DR, ASAP if you notice anything unusual.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Dr. prescribed this for anxiety and depression.  Was doing 20mg, then 10mg after side effects became unbearable. I had insomnia, weight gain, jaw clenching, excessive yawning and tiredness, almost no sex drive, and a jittery buzzy feeling.  I also enjoy a glass of wine or beer, but not with Lex.  More than 2 glasses and I get a head splitting migraine.  I don't know what's worse - feeling depressed and anxious or physically feeling like crap.  I was hoping the 10mg dose would help.  I stopped taking it and feel fine physically, but now I'm irritable and have the anxiety again.  Or maybe it's just I have too much stress right now?  I'm thinking of seeing how it goes for the next couple weeks after stressful stuff is over.  If I still feel anxiety, I may try 1/2 the 10mg pill to see if I can even out the feelings and not have the terrible side affects.

These side effects subsided after a few weeks.  Now, 3 years later, I am still on 10mg and doing great.  I have never tried to come off of it because I am scared I might start with the depression again.  I would recommend this medication to anyone suffering from postpardum depression!!  It sure has made a difference in  my life!!

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Was on it for 3+ years and decided with my doc to change meds because my sex drive was NONEXISTENT and other meds had become available that had fewer sexual side effects - We weaned me down VERY slowly - Literally over a month's time or more - Did the last .25mg for 2 weeks and then stopped - Felt weird at first and then exactly 10-14 days after my last dose I crashed - We had had a snowstorm the night before and all the dr.'s offices in town were closed - I wasn't suicidal, per se, but I definitely had a concious understanding of how people can be - Scared me very badly and I went to the emergency room immediately - The psych on call ended up working for the same place where I went for therapy sessions so I started seeing him and everything went very well after that - So my primary opinion is that you should be VERY VERY careful when you are going off of it

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I only took Lexapro for one day, but my symptoms were so outrageous that I know it's not for me. One of the symptoms that I saw no one else listed was difficulty breathing. When I had been sitting for a long period of time and got up to walk around, my heart would beat a lot faster and I couldn't breathe very well. After a couple of hours, I became very tense to the point where my lower back began aching. Near the end of the day, I was so awake I couldn't sleep ALL night, even after I took a sleeping pill. Lexapro may work wonders for some people, but I just felt like I took a stimulant rather than an SSRI.

column3: Me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I was on another a.d. for years and it was fine but I am always seeking something better.  YOU CANNOT TAKE THIS AT NIGHT if you have anxiety.  Yes, it will keep you up as I was up for 56 hours and no I am not bipolar because I was exhausted.  Dr. told me to take first thing in the morning and since then I have been fine.  In fact, a bonus for me is I have no appetite.  I'm only 50 lbs overweight and I am trying to lose weight but am an emotional eater.  So this has helped.  I just started it 3 weeks ago at 10mg, so we shall see over the next year how I do.

Need to see about getting xanex instead and just take when i need it.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro after my Zoloft stopped working. Noticed a big difference. My mood swings and anger are better. Although I do go off sometimes. He would rather I be on the meds than not.

column3: Jennyrose44, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: This drug has changed my life. I have been on 5 mg/day for 4 years to treat anxiety disorder. I had panic attacks since age 3, then anxiety disorder since 14. I had been entirely resistant to taking medication to treat my anxiety, but after being diagnosed with PTSS (after a near-fatal car accident in my family) my doctor said I really should give this new drug a try. It doesn't take away the consciousness of being anxious or worried for me, but does take away the physical symptoms of anxiety and allows me to deal with it so much better. I went from being afraid of leaving my house to moving alone to Scotland and traveling the U.S. for work. I suggest this drug as an option for anyone struggling with consistent anxiety (not just "being stressed"). It's not for everyone, and I would suggest starting with a low dose first to see how that does, especially if you're as resistant to going on drug treatment as I was.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I started Lexapro after severe side effects taking Zoloft (which was odd since I had successfully been on Zoloft for 16 months 3 years prior). For Lexapro, my dr. started me on 10 mg, to be increased to 20 mg after 10 days. I took 10 mg for 10 days before stopping. I stopped because I had tremors throughout my body (face, tongue, hands, arms, legs) and mucous diarrhea from day 7-10, as well as increased overall anxiety and panic attacks that were worse than the original anxiety. It has been 5 weeks since I stopped Lexapro, and I now take half a .25 mg Xanax every 2-3 days as needed(at first it was every day). I also have been exercising at least 3 times a week. My anxiety is almost gone now. This regimen is working out much better for me than the SSRIs for now.

column3: Finally Relieved, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro for 1+ yrs and have no problems with it, it have greatly reduced my anxiety and concentration levels; unlike others I am experiencing loss of appedite and weight lost.

column3: Birmingham, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro for General Anxiety Disorder, most recently manifested in roller coaster blood pressure (varying between 180/110 and 95/65 within the same day in spite of BP medication), and the fluctuations causing debiliting vertigo. In the past I have also suffered from panic attacks, migraines, irratible bowel syndrome, stomach ulcers, etc. -- thus the diagnosis of GAO. I was unable to tolerate the full dosage of 20 mg of Lexapro, due to continued feelings of anxiety, difficulty sleeping, nightmares, and a general feeling of "weirdness" or "unrealness", even though I was taking clonzipene to offset those symptoms.After 4 months, my doctor finally decided I was too sensitive to Lexapro to take 20 mg and reduced me to 10 mg, as well as prescribing Ambien to help with sleep and nightmares/anxiety dreams.After another 4 months at 10 mg, I finally feel like a normal person again.  Blood pressure is stabilized, allowing reduction in BP medication.  Feeling of "weirdness" has disappeared.  Still have some sleep problems, which I expect to continue as long as I take Lexapro (a decongestant or caffiene will keep me awake all night.)

column3: goingforgood, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: This drug has improved my life so much. I can actually "feel" emotions now. I'm much more outgoing. I have had NO side effects. I feel amazing.

column10: lexapro gives me headaches and naeusa very bad and i dont feel any better. i also get blurred vision. does anyone else get these type of side effects!!!!!!!!!!

column3: Joyce, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Taking 10mg for over 2 yrs & overall, feeling much better. Used to scream and yell a lot--I was miserable & others around, me, too! I've gained 20lbs--not good. Sleep a lot--that's o.k. I used to feel everything, like having my tentacles (octopus tentacles) stepped on. Now, they are retracted & I don't hurt near as much emotionally. I still get sad and want to cry, but I don't outwardly cry that much anymore. I still cry silently inside myself. But, overall, I do feel so much relief as compared to before taking Lexapro. I don't want to go back to being that old, mean, person.  I was irritable, aggressive, hateful, had no patience, and very talkative.  Couldn't sleep and always complaining.  Now, I'm an angel!  My boyfriend is very happy with me now.  So, the drug definitely has helped me. I'll be on it forever.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I hate this drug! I'm 32. I'm on 10mg. In a span of 2 1/2 years I have gone from 105 lbs. to 139 lbs.  I cant get my six pack abs back. every time I try to stop taking it I get VERY sick, I throw up, I've passed out, dizziness, headachs the list is never ending. I told my doc I was gaining waight, tired all the time, couldnt sleep at night.  He said "people that are happy now do gain waight and thats a good thing" NOT. I cant hold my eyes open at 1:00 in the afternoon and thats when we start surgery at work!  NOT a good time to fall asleep!!!! My dr. office wouldnt give me the weaning dose.  I'm doing as my sister did when she got off of it and will never take anything ever again.  I feel like a drugie needing a fix.  I have to take benadryl to help me sleep at night. 2 cups of coffee to get me up in the morning!  I see tracers with my vision. I quit the stressful job right after I started taking it and love my job now.  I dont need this little white pill. Trying to quit is making me more crazy then when I didnt take it at all.  I say to anyone that reads this DO NOT START TAKING THIS MEDICATION!

column3: CD, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I've only ben on it for 10 days and I already believe I'm experiencing positve results. I was diagnosed in 1995 w/ Lifelong or Double Depression (Dysthymia) along w/ severe anxiety. Needless to say, I've tried several other meds and up until now Zoloft or Effexor have been the ones I have been going back and forth w/ every 18-24 months. I was on Lexapro before but it seemed to "wind me up too much" and add too the anxiety. But now that I'm taking oxycodone for severe back pain from work injuries, it seems to help w/ the sedating effects of the pain meds and has helped the depression and anxiety.

column3: Kids, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column10: I started on Lexapro for severe anxiety and job-stress related issues, but also have found it to be absolutely fantastic at relieving menopausal symptoms!!

column3: Female
column10: I began taking Lex for depression that I have been battling with.  Only after being off of it can I fully comment.. It worked wonders for mild depression and anxiety.  Day to day life was definitely more positive and much clearer.  It increased my motivation and focus.  However, you do feel "numb"- I couldn't cry or feel much emotion at all.  I gained almost 20lbs in 6 months, had NO sex drive, and had the inability to orgasm.  The weight gain seemed to continue and I drew the line.  I weaned off over a 3 week period and felt pretty bad in the process- sick, dizzy, headaches, etc.  I'm happy to be off- looking into trying something new!

column3: Jeff, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years

column3: Rosey6, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I had been suffering from depression for years, and when I finally sought help, my doctor prescribed Lexapro.  I started feeling a difference in days, and found a new balance in my life in just weeks.  Now I usually feel normal and have an occasional bad day in stead of the other way around.  The only side affect I've noticed is that it made me tired for the first couple weeks, but then my body adjusted and I don't have any noticable side affects.  This little 10mg pill has literally changed my life.  I wish I had sought help much sooner in my life.

column3: mitcham29, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: So far so good.  It took about 5 full days for me to get used to the side effects of this drug but each day got better-less dizzy, less nauseous, less tired, etc.  The only lasting side effect is the loss of appetite.  Food sounds almost disgusting and I cant eat more than a couple bites a day, so Im surprised how many people gained weight on this one.  Ive lost it!  But Im weaker due to not eating.  I did start taking all the appropriate vitamins and suppliments after talking to several women who have been taking the same thing.  I take extra Vit D, fish oil, probiotics and a multi with iron.  I also have not had any alcohol since starting this drug.  So all in all I feel pretty great.  I have not had any panic attacks since starting this drug and I feel pretty mellow.  Im very happy with it.

column3: myopinion, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I put weight on.  I was famished all the time.  AFter almost four months I put on 30lbs!  I weaned myslef off for month and a half, and during that time it caused dizziness and headaches.  I recommend for people who are depressed and have no appetite and are underweight, you will gain weight.  Panic attacks stopped, but I also quit my stressful job, so that helped as well.  Won't take any SSRIs again as Paxil put weight on me a few years back as well, I took that for 9 months and had a horrible time weaning off, I was so dizzy I could not work for a month. Now I've been off Lexapro since October 2007 and need to lose 30lbs that doesn't exactly make a person feel better.  Try something else.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I began Lexapro after having severe panic attacks along with depression.
