My MD added Wellbutrin to the mix which is said to help the food cravings but it did little to help me and I continued to eat uncontrollably and gain weight.   I decided to go off the medication.  At first I attempted to stop using Lexapro cold turkey.  Do not do this, the withdrawal effects are terrible and I had to go back on.  I then began a program of weaning myself off under the supervision of my MD which worked much better.

column3: 25-34 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column10: i was using this drug for about 4 years i started with 10mg then went up to 20. at first it worked great my panic attacks decreased,my mood swings were under control and i felt more control over my life and had a good amount of energy too. 4 years later though is completley opposite. and now i have new problems i cant concentrate as well i zone in and out of conversations. harder to follow through with simple tasks and weight gain. also if i go more then a day without it i get severe headaches to the point of vommiting. and i am so tired on it that about after a hour from taking it i fall asleep. and i notice it keeps me tired all the time. i finally told my doctor that i cant live anymore on this drug. it took away my life in away and my friends and family noticed that as well. i started i new drug this week in conjunctin with the lexapro to help ween me off it. i hope it works. bottem line is if you have mild symptons of deppression and anxiety i would only recomnd taking it for a short period of time otherwise you might be dealing with a whole new set of problems. for people with severe deppresion i would look into something diffrent then a drug thats mostly prescribed for panic attacks.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
TextLife, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I gained 30 pounds taking this medication, despite careful diet and exercise.  (My primary care doc says he 'doesn't understand why I'm not losing weight.') On the other hand, I don't cry at all, ever.  (I've been to two funerals for close family members and, while I certainly wanted to cry, I couldn't.) In that regard, I think that the drug has evened out the real "lows" of depression I used to experience, but I also think it has rather flattened my affect.  Parents and friends remark that before I started taking it, I seemed much livelier. I also have practically no sex drive since starting it.  (And I used to be a gal that really liked sex.) In short:Pros: Flat affect (no mood swings) Cons: Weight gain, 'zombie' feeling, low libido

column3: Gunja, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: For years I have been struggling with hidden anxiety and depression. Though in regular life I was feeling normal but without any reason I used to have occasional high BP and nervousness especially when visiting my doctor. I used to think much about life and death. I was not enjoying my family life. Finally I was prescribed Lexapro 10mg/day about 6 months ago and for me it worked fantastically so far. I take this medication right after lunch. I have slight weight gain and in the beginning I felt erectile dysfunction for a month or so but by the time I was back to normal except prolonged ejaculation time. Sometimes I hear and read about Lexapro that it is not good for liver and heart which scares me. Is there someone who has such information to share?

column3: HoustonHopeful, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: Age 45, male.  Brand new to depression.  Spent 8 days in the hospital a few weeks ago due to sudden onset of severe depression.  While hospitalized, I had to work up to 50 mg of Lexapro to stabilize (highest dosage I've seen posted).  I've been in group therapy about 3 weeks now.  After about a week on the medication, I started having some nervous shaking, teeth chattering, and one MAJOR panic attack.  Doctor put me on some Klonopin and that took care of the anxiety effects.  Overall I am doing much better considering I was in the hospital 3 weeks ago and am now at home (though going to group therapy daily on short term disability).  One bad side effect of Lexapro for me (being a male) is sexual dysfunction.  But, from what I read online, that is a "common and known" issue.  To describe the problem in "kind words"... let's just say the bomber can take off and fly the mission, but can't deliver the payload.  I know that may still be too graphic for some, but I tried to be polite about it.  I hope the doctor slowly tapers my dosage back and that issue gradually goes away.  But, for now, I will take it as an acceptable trade-off compared to being hospitalized with depression and feeling there was nothing to live for (though I have a great life going!).  Good luck to all you fellow Lexapro-ers out there.  Hang in there everyone.  Depression is what is bad, WE ARE ALL GOOD PEOPLE.  We will get better in time.  Take care!

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column3: kavakahn, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: My psychologist gave me samples packs to treat anxiety.  I took one at 10 pm since he said it would make me tired.  By 2 am, i was wide awake, shaking, eyes dialated, vomiting, crapping myself, couldn't sit still, chattering teeth, fever, telling my mom "this isn't good drugs, ER" in between surges of puke in the toilet.  tried to take some pepto but got nothing but pink puke.  after about four hours, i passed out from exhaustion.  if we had health insurance, i would have been in the emergency room.  the doc told me it was an impossible reaction.  and just to spite me, my dad took a lex pill to prove i imagined the whole thing. [he was fine.] they switched me to celexa (a cousin drug) and had nausea and vomiting every day for a month before i boycotted that stuff too.  Behavioral therapy helped me after that, plus being re-diagnosed with PreMentsrual Dysphoric Disorder which the psych docs didn't think to evaluate me for even tho it has coordinating symptoms. now take birth control to alleviate symptoms caused by hormone fluctuations, not serotonin problems like they had thought. i would not recommend lexapro to anyone. i think i almost died.

column3: may18, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I am 49, female, in peri menopause. I took Lexapro for symptoms that were related to anger, lack of interest, depression related. I have taken a variety of different depression meds over the last 10 years but had stopped about 2 years ago as I felt that i had plateaued. I was given this med by my OBGYN. Started on 10mg, after about 3 weeks increased to 20. At first I felt an immediate response at 10mg, however I still felt very sad, so I asked for an increase in dosage. Again, almost instantly the med incease kicked in and although the depression was pretty much gone, so was everything else. such as, any energy, I was sleeping much to much, I was happy not to be so angry or sad, but well aware that I felt lethargic and very bla. At 8 weeks I saw my obgyn and explained my concerns and symptoms, it was agreed that having no energy, flat-line personality, and a weight gain of almost 10-15lbs was not worth this particular med. The weight gain flipped me out as I was already over my limit, having no energy kept me from wanting to get off the couch, having a "who cares" attitude didn't help either. My very big concern is on the flip side of all of the negatives is that I was very calm and mellow, making me a very easy person to be around, my family reacted to this part of the treatment with me so well. I am disapointed that I am not able to continue this med for that reason. My Dr. suggested that I take the med when I feel an episode of overwhelming sadness or anger related to my periods - mostly what took me to this in the first place...  I felt that there was no happy medium with Lexapro. I am off it completely now, I am clear headed, have not felt as depressed and have started to walk every day and work back into a healthy full excercise and diet regimine again, I am also being very mindful of my inner thoughts and moods more so that I can not be as reactive towards my family.  Lexapro was weight gain, sleepy, no interest in anything, inc sex.

column3: mom#3, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: i have been taking for only 2 weeks and feel much better. i wasn't wanting to do anything..laundry, play with kids, walk the dog, or cook. now i'm back!! give it a try.

column3: bjr28, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was prescribed Lexapro for Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD) and depression.  Initially I was prescribed 10mg, then 20mg, and finally, 30mg.  I was on 30mg for almost a year, but I noticed no change in my anxiety/depression.  Despite the very high dose, it just didn't seem to work.  Perhaps that was because I didn't have much anxiety in the first place, or perhaps I wasn't that depressed, but nevertheless, it just did not work for me.  Getting off of it was easy; I would advise (to be on the safe side) decreasing the dosage by 5mg at a time (for maybe a week or two), then repeat until you hit 0.  Although I am not a psychiatrist, I have heard (anecdotally) that Zoloft is a superior anti-depressant/anxiolytic.  Zoloft also works for OCD, I believe.  I would talk to your physician (and do some research) before starting on Lexapro...you may find that Zoloft is superior for your symptoms.
Perscribed this for post partum depression. Helped immensly, but haven't been able to wean myself off of it yet

column3: jek, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: Due to a death in the family and having suffered a previous heart attack, I thought it prudent to see me Doctor to get some medication to calm my nerves.  Along with a prescription for Xanax, he gave me some sample packets of Lexapro to be taken once daily.  On the second day I began to experience moderate muscle pain and night sweats (no fever) ..   3 days was enough and I stopped taking.   Took two more days for my system to get back to normal.   In talking with other people about this, it seems that doctors now are pushing these antidepressant meds off on patients with anxiety problems (for whatever reason) and equating it with depression, giving you free samples of  powerful antidepressants from your friendly pharmaceutical company.   I feel like a guinea pig rather than a patient.Rest assured my doctor is going to get an earful when I see him next.My advice is to be very careful when taking these antidepressant meds.  They results are not always positive and they are powerful.  Be careful and use common sense about how you are feeling.  It is your health, and your body, and it seems pushing drugs for the pharmaceutical industry is getting more mainstream in patient treatment.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have forever been very anxious.  I would startle,stress and shake n'stress. Total panic! Worse-people could visually see.Since college my mood swings went nuts. I have seen many doctors.  It was PMS,PMDD, PERI MENOPAUSE,MENAPAUSE & NUTS! I started my period at 9-thought I was dying from a toilet seat germ! Well enough this year I went to the doctor at the pleas of my family. One mood swing too many and a thrown glass too many-two pets dying slow deaths three homes in two years,a military wife,daughter graduating and going from high school to college,proms,driving her everywher and teaching her to drive, knee surgery and septic infection from glass on a lake---------New home with sewage line break times three and broken custom tub flooding den and frying computer!  And dealing with it all???????? PRICELESS!  These are all stress ?  There is tons more but enough.  Lexapro has numned my anxiety and myself at times. I have vivid nightmares, significant memory loss moments, no appetite to ravenous appetite episodes,dizziness,sleepiness,sex suppression -----. However my overall mood is vastly improved. I can handle whatever comes next------I hope.  Cymbalta was the worst for me and Paxil did nothing.Xanax was temporary.  Lexapro  so far a mind saver.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column10: Im 15 years old and have been suffering from severe and embarrassing aniexty attacks and moods of depression since i was 13. I started Zoloft and had taken that for about a year and it made it even worse, than after seeing my doctor i was put on Cymbalta, but because my mom didnt feel comfortable having me on that i was put on Lexapro. I have been taking 5mg daily and its done nothing. I cant sleep, i just lay awake at night like i have all my life. The only medicine that helped me was Cymbalta. Taking Lexapro has not helped at all with my anxiety, and people are starting to notice me regressing, and so am I.

column3: zlt, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was given a sample packet of lexapro after visting with my doctor. I had signs of derpression after losing one parent and another parent had a stroke.  Taking lexapro was a huge sign of relief.  I am not a pill taker and I don't want to become dependant on pills for life.  However, I have only had positive effects from Lexapro.  I no longer suffer from terrible angry/irritable mood swings. I do have trouble staying asleep at night and I yawn often.  I hope to see more benefits from taking this medicine the longer I'm on it.  I would like to get back to my regular workout routine.  Which I still have a lot of trouble doing.  No longer have a desire to run or lift weights.  Which I've done for over 20 years.  I'll continue to take this medicine for a few more months.

I have decided on my own to stop dringing alcohol.

Some weight gain noticed, but it coincides with me getting older, so it is hard to tell if it Lexapro or not).

column3: joeanddonna45, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Lori, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have been on 10mg for just under a year.  I should of done some investigating.  I told my doctor I wasn't sleeping well and was somewhat unhappy with what happened to me time after having 2 kids close together.  It is called life....I should of listened to my instinct and waited to get more me time than letting my dr. put me on meds.  I specifically said I didn't want to gain weight and I enjoyed my sex life and didn't want any interference.  Unfortunately, I let him talk me into it and continued with it til now.  I have since gained at least 20 lbs. and have a harder time orgasming. The weight gain has not helped my self confidence either.  I started weening myself off the meds slowly and will try to deal with the side effects - dizziness, nausea, memory issues both on and getting off meds.  I have since been able to join a gym which my kids also enjoy going to.  That is how I used to be - very active.  I just had to be patient until my kids were a little older to allow more time for me.  Again, I should of listened to my instinct, not cover up everyday issues of a new mom with medication.  Some people need extra help with all kinds of issues.  I just think my doctor was quick with prescribing without understanding my background.  Too quick to line the pockets of drug companies.  There are way too many people on meds that might really not need it.  I am not discounting some real mental issues that need meds.  I used to work with a psychiatrist and do believe many do need meds.  I just would recommend investigating the meds and getting a couple of opinions if possible.  I just cannot wait to get off this med.  Good luck to those of you on it.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Due to panic attacks, on Lexipro for about 6 months 20mg.  Helped greatly, no longer any attacks.  Feel better, gained some weight, no sex drive.  Hate panic attacks, so willing to trade some weight gain for the attacks.  Starting to taper, on 15mg for 1 week, now have headaches, not sure if related.

column3: tmr0223, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column10: I was on paxil before and feel that it helped me better with my anxiety than lexapro has.  I still have some axiety on lexapro, but not as much as when I wasn't on anything.  However, when I was on paxil I went up 2 dress sizes.  So far on Lexapro, I'm pretty much the same size.  Gained just a little weight.  With lexapro I have absolutely no sex drive.  I want to go off of it because of that.  I'm afraid to go off because I'm think I'll have the same experience as I had going off paxil.  I felt dizzy, couldn't stand up, couldn't drive, etc.  I would love to go on something else, but I'm afraid they all have the same side effects as the paxil and lexapro.

column3: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Aktta, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Hi! I'm 16 and I have been on this medicine for a few months to treat my social anxiety and depression. The medicine helps a lot with depression and it has improved my depression by about 80%! However, this medicine barely helped with my anxiety. It helps specifically with being happier, more optimistic, and more calm in nervous situations. But overall, it has only improved my anxiety only by about 25%. The side effects are definitely noticeable too. I experienced trouble sleeping, weird dreams (especially nightmares), and low energy. I also had alittle nausea the first time I took it and yawn a lot. Please try to make sure you eat something when you take it, I think it helps. I think overall that I am going to discontinue my use, because the side effects are so great and it didn't help much w/ anxiety, which was the main reason I started taking it. But I still think if you are considering taking it, you should give it a try- results vary so it may work better for you then it did for me. I think you should definitely try it if your problem is depression, because I think it works best for depression- but most people have side effects so you should know although it alleviates depression symptoms, it will probably give you new ones from the side effects. I hope my review helps all of you! =)

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I am a nurse who had an awful job that brought on a lil anxiety/ocd problem.  I was started on lexapro to get me over the hump and it work amazingly.  Despite how amazing this drug is at treating symptoms, it also comes with a lot of baggage.  When I first started the medicine, I was manic for about 2 weeks, not sleeping, singing all the time, pacing  .. etc.  After all that goodness wore off, I had no sexual appetite and when I did couldn't finish.  After I self dc'd the med (as a sexual relationship is very important), I even tapered off (I know better then to just stop) I was so dizzy I couldn't stand, sit, drive do anything!!!  I was miserable for about a month.  Although this drug worked wonders for me (temporarily), I've had to move onto other things to control my anxiety as I could not deal with all the side effects!  There are other meds out there, don't give up the hope!  Best wishes!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column3: goffy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: does'nt seem ta help anymore an at 40 mg seems lik it would be helping

column3: Zoey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Lexapro helped with my transitional periods of moving to a new place...(I've moved several times) and it seemed to be a life-changing experience, my analytical side of the brain kicked in...and it seemed like every thing accelerated for me, thinking, moving, speaking, but then it would make me so tired, unable to sleep, irritated, and restless...I would notice that if I skipped a day, I would feel calmer, and feel more connection with people.  I felt like I could go up to any one and talk to them...and when I was around obviously mentally ill people...(homeless schizophernic people)  I felt like my mind would go where thier mind was...to a scary place, and felt unsafe...so I would avoid places like Venice Beach, where there are a lot of "strange" characters.  I finally had to get off it....and the withdrawal symptoms are horrible....I have lost several jobs from being overally emotional and not able to get up and function.  I highly recommend having your doctor direct you in getting off the meds.

My doctor prescribed it for stress which had given me a wild case of dermatitis all over my body. I know that it takes awhile for your body to adjust to a new med but this stuff makes me jittery, unrestful sleep, and my head feels like it weighs 50 lbs. Also despite an interest in sex, and feeling like I want to have sex, I'm unable to climax. So I'm wondering is this going to be worth it? I'm also very concerned about the difficulty in the weaning process, what I've been reading sounds pretty horrible. I think I'll start cutting my pills and stop the madness before I get in any deeper, after all everyone has stress in their life that they have to deal with, right?
great!

(My cholesterol shot up so Im fighting the effects of the Lexapro to make me gain weight to try and lose it for the sake of my heart) Anyway, I definately think the Lexapro has benefited my mental and social well-being, my sexual and physical however, have suffered. It's definately a give and take relationship with this drug

column3: BlahBlahGinger, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I've been talking this for almost a month now, and I've seen a huge improvement in my depression/GAD. My only problem with is that I'm nauseated a lot, and I frequently have to deal with dry mouth. Also, been having some anorgasmia, which I hope will subside soon. Other than that, I feel like it's made a significant difference in returning me to my old self.

column3: Pam, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column10: I am bi-polar and have been on medication for 20 years.  Trust me they all stop working sooner or later for those of us who need to always be on meds.  I have been taking Lexapro for about a year now in combination with three other drugs.  I has helped me tremendously up till now by giving me energy.  Yes energy.  I take Cymbalta, Seroquel, Triliptal and Lexapro.  I did have some side affects in the beginning but went away in weeks. My shrink has upped the dose once so far.  I believe I need it changed again and checked on here to find out what size of a dose people usually take and how well it works for them.  Hmm my suggestion to anyone reading this is to make sure you go to a shrink and not just a family doctor if you suffer from anything other than just a bout of situational depression.  These drugs all work so different on each of us.  I am an "older" person who lives alone and gee at times I wish it did slow down my sex drive but suppose I am fortunate that I have never experienced that with this or any of the other.  It is also the most expensive of all the drugs I take but so far it has been worth it.  I had terrible withdrawl symptoms from my Paxil but I do everything under my doctors advisement.  Never, never do I play with my meds.

column3: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

It is slowly helping with my depression. I am sleeping more soundly at night, however, I am sleeping too much at times. I can sleep 10-12 hours a day with this medication. Unfortunately I still need to live. I hope this need to sleep will wear off in time.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been taking paxil for about 5 years. Decided to give lexapro a try because it listed less side effects. It was the biggest mistake of my life. I couldn't sleep, my anxiety/panic attacks became more frequent, I became irritable, grouchy, nervous and on edge all the time. My appetite became non existent, I was staying so very sick to my stomach and could not eat. I also developed horrible heartburn that would not go away. I was dizzy and off balance. My doctor switched me back to paxil and ALL of these side effects have subsided. My attacks are now almost non existent, my nerves have calmed down, the heart burn is gone, I can eat and sleep very well now. I would suggest that anyone who is considering the use of this medication to be very careful.

column3: chandelbriar, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I started taking this for anxiety, panic attacks and maybe mild depression. It was a horrible experience! I was so nasuas, diarhea, extremely tired, could not drive bacause I thought I would fall asleep.  Not to mention I had a very scary episode of extreme sweating!!  I talking EXTREME!!  Very scary.  Would not recommend to anyone.  I only took 10mg of Lexapro.  I will soon be trying Zantax.

column3: kristen9800, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I gained 20+ pounds and was always tired.  I woke frequently at night also.  Med worked well for depression for several years, then seemed taper off.  I switch to Wellbutrin XR after Lexapro's effectiveness faded and I was able to lose the weight I had put on and I have so much more energy and can stay awake past 9 pm.  Overall I feel better off the Lexapro.

column3: mamareed, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column10: I was very hesitant to use any type of drug therapy, after a horrible bout with Paxil six years ago. I have found this drug to give me some hope of healing!

column3: copley55, 45-54 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Weight gain

column3: Aviator, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was taking xanax for yrs.  It became ineffective.  My Dr.  gave me lexapro and it changes my life for the better. No more attack, I feel better and thoughts are clearer.  Worked great for me.

column3: jim, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: lexapro is a great med for gad and depression.

column3: SuJun, 45-54 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: Can I say this was less than ineffective?  I was on this drug for 11 days.  I have NEVER ever been this dizzy in all my life! Laying down, moving, sitting, turning my head; I was always dizzy!  My appetite was completely nonexistent, and I am thin.  I could only eat a few bites then I was full.  I suffered from hyperventilation and ultimately hypomania.  I have never had a good experience with an antidepressant and  Lexapro only confirmed their toxicity to my physical health.  Since I have stopped Lexapro I no longer hyperventilate, I do not suffer from hypomania, I can eat, and I am not dizzy.  Taking Lexapro was a horrible experience.

column3: Patty, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro has been a godsend for the paralyzing anxiety I experience.  I can't believe how well it works. It does make me somewhat depressed, but I can tolerate being slightly depressed if my anxiety is relieved.  I have not gained any weight. It does interfere with my sleep.

column3: Ake_Breake, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
13-18 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have gained probably twenty-pounds while on lexapro... It seems to take care of the anxiety somewhat though

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Lexapro really takes the edge off but has definitely caused me to gain weight

column3: Starr15pak@aol.com, 45-54 Male  (Patient)
column10: Too much a dose can make you lethargic.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have suffered with depression most of my life and have been resistant to taking any drugs. Lexapro changed my life. I feel like a weight was lifted off my shoulders and that I am finally seeing the world in color. No sexual side effects at all. I was taking it in the morning and feeling drowsy, but just switched to night time and I get some of the best sleep I've ever had. I yawn a bit more than usual, but considering how it's made me feel that is no big deal. It has also completely eliminated my PMDD, I never know when my period is coming unless I check the calendar!

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: This is the first antidepressent I've ever taken. I was prescribed it for anxiety and mild depression. I have been taking Lexapro for seven weeks and still have symtoms of both. I am constantly hungry and have gained 5 pounds in the past month despite exercising regularly. I also have no sex drive whatsoever.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column10: I did not like it cause of my decrease interest in sex, I had none, causing trouble in marriage.  Seems like I started loosing alot of hair since I started using it.  It did work very well though, but I'm gonna get off it and see how I do.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: Lexapro has changed my life. For years I couldn't do normal 'college activities'... go to bars, parties, or anywhere that I may have had an anxiety attack. I've also been dependant on kolonopin and xanax for as long as I can remember. However, when I'm taking Lexapro I feel normal, no anxiety, no stress, no mood swings. Only the stable, happy, positive me--all of the time. I do however have no sex drive and I sometimes feel like the always constant mood is slightly zombie-esque...but for me these pills have given me a new lease on life and the side effects are little and manageable. I highly recommend this drug!

column3: clc71, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Being on 20mg of this medication has been wonderful for me! I noticed the medication working within 2 weeks. However I've noticed the week before my period I start having "old" feelings.  I have had NO side effects.

column3: cajunkat2k7, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: i still get occasionally short of breath and dizzyness and i am very nervouse but the medicine has helped me alot.

column3: kcrabtree, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I started taking Lexapro for Depression and started feeling excellent within 2 weeks.  However I was nauseous at times so I always had to take it on a full stomach.  Then the cold weather set in and I would break out in hives all over my legs and arms whenever I got cold.  It was horrible!   Then my face started to break out in a rash.  I stopped taking the pills and the hives stopped once it was out of my system.  However the rash still remains.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: After Zoloft, Prozac, Paxil & Cymbalta this drug finally helped (20mg/day).A word of advice: do not stop this drug abruptly - after 2 days I experienced paranoia, sadness, fatigue and tingling in my lips, jaw & fingers.

column3: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: This medicine has truly been a God-send for me. I'm someone who has recently stopped being a VERY heavy drinker, and this has helped to stabilize my mood swings without heavy side-effects. I'd say this is a perfect 1-2-3 combination with Trazadone and Valium for alcoholics who have recently quit drinking and are SERIOUS about keeping liqour out of their life. However, if you continue to drink, any of these three medicines will be very dangerous.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: This drug has been very effective. It has made it possible for me to get though the day doing normal activies like working and going to school. However, after a few weeks of not taking the pill in the past I found the withdrawl symptoms to be very sevear. And at my current dose of 40mg a day, I am starting to face new side effects that might be a result of taking this drug. Basicly mild visual and auditory hallucinations along with vivid, and strange dreams. At lower doeses, the typical 10mg or 20mg, this was not an issue. This is by far the best antidepressent I have ever taken and it has less side effects than most.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: This medicine was very easy to use but it did nothing to improve my depression. I am now on Cymbalta and that is helping much more. I wouldn't recommend this med but everybody is different. I hope that you find something that works for you!

column3: dudeboy, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: This medicine has helped me come out of the depression I seemed to have been in for decades. I was never treated for it until four months ago, when I went to an alcohol rehab. It has been amazing, I have my old optomistic self back, not the pessimist I had become. The only drawback is my libido. Almost impossible to come, and hard-ons don't last like they ought to. At least I don't have to worry about satisfying anyone else at this stage of my life. But, I can't even have fun masturbating anymore.

column3: Livinglife70, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I have been on Lexapro for 7 months for anxiety and mild depression. My only negative side effect was the sexual kind. Total interest loss of sex and trouble having a orgasm. I think it is a good mellow drug, but as with any chemistry altering drugs..do your research and talk to your doctor.

column3: Renda, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I took 10 mg for about 5 years then when I quit smoking needed to up it to 20mg. I've been on tht for about 2 months now. I love lexapro except for I have terrible night sweats. No problem with sex drive and it works great for me so I figure it's worth it because I have taken zoloft and that took away my sex drive and wellbutrin gave me bad mood swings.

column3: xelus, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I take this drug to help with my neuropathy symtoms, or so the doctor says. I call these my happy pills. I have been on them for about 8 months and although I still think about how severe my condition is going to get, this drug makes me not want to act on the situation. A big downside to this drug is it makes you forget everything. So far this drug is working for me.

column3: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
over it, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: The first few days I had dizziness and sleepiness, worked well for my anxiety for about a year then it just made me numb and killed my sex drive.  When I decided to stop taking it I began slowly weaning off as directed by my doctor and am now 9 days into being lexapro free.  I am having severe headaches, stomach issues, restlessness, anxiety and dizziness.  While I was satisfied for a while on this medication, I suggest to anyone considering it to make sure they do ALOT of research before hand on how hard it is to get off or never plan to quit it.  I hav enever felt so terrible and helpless to control my body in my life.  This withdrawal period has made me hate this drug and I will never put it in my body again.

column3: Don, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: I was prescribed Lexapro by a Neurologist.(without knowing the reason) and within 10 day's I woke up to new world!!!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Lexapro has helped me soo much with both my depression and social anxiety. I tried other medication prior to this, but none worked as effectively as Lexapro. This drug has helped me so much to enjoy life and feel like a NORMAL person!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
13-18 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: This was my fourth anti-depressant and has been the most effective with me so far, although I have experienced some tolerance development. Overall, its symptoms were easier to deal with than the others I'd experienced. I would sometimes get sick to my stomach after taking it, other times I would get very agitated and aggressive. Other than that, it was effective and easy to use. The best I've had so far.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was put on Lexapro after my father died...I was all ready having anxiety issues due to my divorce and custody disputes with my ex. 10 mg a day took care of my anxiety, but I am an extrovert, and the Lexapro took my bubbliness away...I had NO sex drive, I didn't care about anything, I was a robot...Thumbs down...

column3: friskmemrcop, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been diagnosed with depression, anxiety problems and adhd. I'm currently on the 20 mg dosage. Lexapro has made changes in me that I didn't even notice I needed change in. My b/f has seen significant changes in my mood, what we argue about, my social life, memory and focus. It's been my gold in a bottle.

column3: tarotsfool, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I have heard all the warnings and horror stories about antidepression drugs. That made me very reluctant to try them. I have been in therapy for months,suffering from major depression and anxiety, was hospitalized for suicidal ideation, and still didn't want to take the drugs.  But I have three children who need me, and it reached the point I would try anything.  Thank Goddess I did. After a matter of days, I feel like I have my life back.  I can think, I can feel, I can simply be happy!Lexapro hasn't made my problems go away; it has returned me to a state of mind where I can deal with them.  Very slight stomach upset the first night.  Some people have more severe reactions.  But I must say, don't be afraid of trying these types of medication. They can make the difference of a lifetime!

column3: Surfing_Nana, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: After taking Serzone for years and asking the doctor to change it with no cooperation, I moved to another state and new doctor. Upon realizing that I was taking Serzone, the new doctor said, "We have to get you off the serzone." He started weaning me off gradually. Then prescribed Lexapro. After taking it for about 4 years, I still thank God daily for the Lexapro. Before Lexapro, I laid in bed with no will to live or sat in my recliner doing nothing. I had no interest in anything. About 3 or 4 months after starting Lexapro, my usually unobservant son-in-law remarked that I seemed to be a different person from when he was worried about me at Thanksgiving. I now have gotten on with living doing volunteer work with the elderly in nursing homes, having grandchildren over regularly with big celebrations on holidays with as many as 22 in my home. I highly recommend Lexapro. I never want to be without it.

column3: Lindsay, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: The effects of this medication is working great. I have noticed changes like mood swings and anxiety

column3: labeled, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column10: My internist gave me lexapro to slow my rapid heartbeat. It slowed it from 150 down to 79. However, I had a spell that appeared to be a heart problem and the er doctor, after he saw I was on lexapro refused to do the heart test my doctor had ordered and put me on a valium drip, saying all I had was an anxiety attack.  He sent me home with a pulse of 120, which I had for 3 days.  I went to a heart doctor who said the attack did not sound like anxiety to him.  He found I've had an electrical problem with my heart all of my life that causes my periodic rapid heartbeat and probably caused the attack that sent me to the er. I've stopped the lexapro and now am undergoing mild depression symptoms which are getting better each day. Prior to being on the lexapro I had no anxiety attacks, but while on it I had several of what appeared to be anxiety attacks and had to take valium to help the sypmtoms.  I also had a huge increase in migraine headaches and migraine auras.  My family doctor told me the new problems were imaginary, but they have improved since I stopped the lexapro.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Noticably lowers sex drive

column3: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

I am thankful to be on this medication and getting back to myself again!

column3: aabev124@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I actually feel normal for a change.  Definitely not as edgy.  Even my boyfriend is happier w/ me on it.

column3: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
alenka, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I've been on Lexapro for more than a year now. And I have to admit that it helps me with my depression symptoms. For some people like me who was born with chemical disbalance and suffered from depression and anxiety since childhood it is a really powerfull drug. I see everything differently now than I used when I was depressed. But....there are some side effects that I connect with the drug. I always feel very tired and I can sleep up to 15 hours a day, which is not really helping my relationship with my boyfriend and my lifestyle. I still have some anxiety epizodes and experience a shortness of breath. Occasionaly I take Atarax for my panic attacks... But considering what this med has done for me these things are pretty minor.

column3: sakura_aoki, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Well it does it's job very very well but I had a very strange side effect that only my mother and I (as she was also on it) had. I slept about 20 hours straight about once a week or I slept 14 hours every night. This also occured when my dose was moved up from 20 mL to 40mL.I was, before it, a self harmer. Probably once every other day, about a month after I was able to stop completely though this doesn't always happen. It sometimes made my head spin a little and I was often dizzy, though that is possibly just me. The other thing is I had severe withdrawal reactions. To be honest i felt like i had an axe in my head. My best advice with that is don't drive, don't take any of your thoughts seriously, and likely if you call a pharmacy they will give you two if you can't get through the weekend (i discovered this and it was a lifesaver). Most people apparently do not have this problem. It also works very very well along with concerta. It is a very good drug for what it does just doesn't match up with my body chemistry.  I suggest it and if you can't afford it's price Celexa works as well it just is missing an anti-anxiety affect.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I've only been taking this medication for a little more than a month but I have noticed a difference in my mental clarity, my mood, and just overall feeling of well being. I was hesitant to take a medication thinking that I shouldn't be depressed because things in life weren't so bad. However, I feel much more like myself than I have in some time. I'm resting better at night and feel more awake and engaged during the day. My only complaint with the Lexapro was the regular bouts of diarrhea I experienced. Were it not for this side effect, I would consider it a complete blessing.

column3: Henry, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I've been taking Lexapro for depression for several months.  The depression is better, but the side effects have been worse.  I've developed sleep myoclonis (involuntary muscle twitches all over the body both day and night), for which I'm now having to take Requip to counteract.  I've also remained very fatigued -- at least as badly as before treatment, if not more so -- and have not have the energy to resume the exercise I used to enjoy before the depression hit.
It makes me a little tired and know that I no longer can tolerate alcohol.  Two glasses of wine or mixed drink and I feel it tremendously.

column3: mcknny, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: deb749, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: I haven't experienced any unpleasant side effects  with Lexapro, and I  feel like normal again. I got my zezt for life back.I stopped crying at started making plans for my future. Does not make you feel numbed like some of the others can.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: It makes me feel normal again.

column3: MichelleBerk, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: This is my second week and I really need Lexapro to work for the long run.  The side effects are so minimal, I have a ringing in my ears at night and in the morning and then it subsides during the day.  My anxiety keeps trying to get through the Lexapro .10 and I get a little disoriented but focus on something else.  I must say, I have been feeling a little depressed from taking this and I have never had depression, but out of nowhere three months ago, I started getting severe anxiety out of nowhere.  My mind also started scrambeling and having horrible thoughts, became little twisted, not sure what the heck happened, but the lexapro did calm the mind.

column3: Wendy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I had a very stressful demanding job that nothing else helped, but Lexapro. The sweating wasn't as bad as w/ effexor. Once I changed jobs it took me about 3 mths to wean myself completely off of it. I had slight balance and nausea issues and feeling as though I was dropping in a elevator at random events. My responsiblities have changed again and the stress has returned along w/ the old symptoms of being angry and edgy all the time. It is symtomatic of the position as my coworkers are all under the same stress and half of them are flipping out! The rest are burnt out... I can't flee or fight the changes as I need to keep my position and as the company is paying for it I will finish my education. I will be speaking w/ my Doctor next week to get put on a 10 mg dose as the stress level will be managable w/ this increment. If I take the 20s I will be a flatliner again and I need to retain my personality...

column3: shoelady, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column3: cat7598, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: this drug also has controlled my hot flashes.

column3: FlyfishermanBill, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I will try to stay on this medication.

column3: vernality, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column3: Akiko, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column10: I couldn't achieve an orgasm with this medication.  I was ALWAYS tired, sometimes on the weekend, it would take me forever just to get out of bed. I was always yawning, I would take little nap breaks at work and I would never do that! Even though I had 8-10 hours of sleep, I always felt that wasn't good enough.    I was also bitchy...  It did nothing for my depression. For my social anxiety disorder, that helped, in that sense I felt more confident in talking to people but if you got on my bad side, then oh well... you know the rest, lol  I was also hostile to my therapist and accused her of not supporting me!  I told my doc who was doing med management for me what was happening to me and he says, okay we'll put you on Wellbutrin.  Mind you, before I was taking Lexapro, I was taking Paxil CR (now that was a totally different story).  With Wellbutrin, I can get up from my bed, clean the house and actually function as a normal human.  I find myself looking at life a little different. I'm currently on the 150 mg and later will be on the 350 (I think but too lazy to look at the bottle in the bathroom, lol)..  I will write later and let you know how the higher dosage works compared to the 150 - but see the Wellbutrin reviews.  It does make me thirsty, so thats a good thing, I also have my libido back as well as my earth shattering orgasm, yippee!  Depression is gone, I am always smiling and my eyes look alert.  Bottom line, Lexapro did jack for me. If you like sleeping, looking tired, sweat alot, bitchy and hostile, the inability not to have an orgasm, have a low libido, I say go for Lexapro.  If not, have your doc put you on Wellbutrin.

column3: Widowed by Lexapro, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column10: THIS MEDICATION KILLED MY HUSBAND. Normally optimistic, after suffering a bout of insomnia - he became withdrawn and zombie-like. He hid despairing thoughts, and wrote a suicide note 5 days after taking this drug. Three weeks later he killed himself at the age of 58. He had everything to live for and was the last personality type who would commit suicide. This drug can be a killer for certain individuals, especially if they are do not fall into a typical depressed category. His doctor gave him samples "to help him sleep". DO NOT LET ANYONE YOU KNOW TAKE THIS DRUG WITHOUT THE CLOSE ATTENTION OF A PSYCHIATRIST. OFTEN PEOPLE, PARTICULARLY MEN, WILL LIE OR HIDE SUICIDAL IMPULSES EVEN WHEN ASKED DIRECTLY (AS I DID). I watched my husband for any signs of suicidal ideation, and there were none. He hid it all. I disliked the zombie quality he was exhitibiting, but I knew that the medicine claims to need weeks to begin to work. THE FACT IS THIS MEDICINE CAN TAKE ONLY 3-5 DAYS TO TURN THE BRAIN CHEMISTRY AROUND TO SUICIDE....My advice: Don't let anyone you know take this drug - there are so many other antidepressants out there with less risk. Lexapro is being pushed as "safe" but hundreds of people have committed suicide out of the blue on it. History will record Lexapro as being one of the worst offenders in pandering this drug as safe, when it is clearly not. Sample packages are still being given out casually all over the country. BEWARE THIS DRUG.

column3: schwaermerei, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Depressive with anxiety, OCD, personality disorder. Lexapro 15 mg per day. (Previously on Celexa.) Lexapro has lost a lot of efficacy with time. Weight gain, despite claims this is not an issue. Effectiveness as an anti-anxiety agent variable (I also take Xanax). Muscle pain has become a problem. Diminished libido from the start. Some blunting of affect. A big advantage for me, though, is that I am sensitive to meds, and Lexapro is one of the best-tolerated of the SSRIs. I'm hopeful that supplementation with another med, and/or tweaking the dose, will restore the beneficial effects for me.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I would often feel overwhelmed and sad, often crying for no reason, or getting irrationally angry, even when people were trying to help me.  The scariest thing of all was that I knew I shouldn't be overreacting the way I was about inconsequential little things, but I felt like I had lost control of myself and my emotions.  I began lashing out physically and hit rock bottom one night and punched a hole in the wall.  That's when I went to see my doctor and told her about the symptoms I had been having.  She diagnosed me with depression and prescribed Lexapro.  It's really worked well for me.  My family no longer has to walk on eggshells around me, fearing that I'm going to either explode or break down at any moment.  I haven't had any side effects and I've been able to live my life normally!

column10: Old Doctor had me on zoloft for several years to help control panic attacks and depression. Zoloft was not helping me personnally @ all. I have still had some set backs with the Bi/polar area but being aware and and educated has had some benifits.I cannot do it all @ once but I am trying. If you suffer from panic attacks please give this a try and @ least 30 to 45 days of medication, you will be happy you did, and you wont have to suffer for as long as I let myself(seven and a half years is to long to be stupid and not take chances) Glad I did in Tn.

column3: snoopmom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I was recently weened from Lexapro after being on it for a little over 3 years; I found it to be a wonder drug. In the past I tried Paxil and Prozac and did terrible on both. Lexapro basically saved my life. I do remember when I started the medicine I would have extremely vivid dreams at night that didn't make sense and it took a few months for that to subside. One downside of the medicine is that I gained a TREMENDOUS amount of weight; I'm only 5'1", used to always weigh around 115/118 lbs, and I ballooned up 144 lbs. The drug manufacturer doesn't state weight gain as a side effect, but everyone I know who has been on the medicine has stated the same thing. I religiously watched my diet and couldn't lose the weight; this is actually the reason I went off the medicine. I am in a much better place, both emotionally and mentally, than I was before starting Lexapro, but I found the weight gain to be something that made me more depressed and miserable.

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was scared to take it at first because the thought of taking medicine freaked me out, but I took it and it has help keep the anxiety under control at the same time it's not just the medacine, you have to change the way you look at life.  If you're stressed out, work out.  Don't let anxiety take over you!  You can change the way you think and the way you feel.  Change your situation.  It might take a couple of days before you feel "excellent" but believe me you will.  Talk yourself out of getting excited.  You have to say "I feel fine" and you will realize you do feel fine!  Pray to GOD and ask him to help you to think positive and pray about whatever is stressing you out and GOD will take that stress off of your shoulders and heal you but you have to believe.  Don't just say the words, but believe in him.  Have faith! Everything will work out, you don't have to take the medacine forever.  And when you do ween off, there is a tea not from safeway, but from a chinese shop (look it up online too) where you can go and these teas are for healing not for pleasure.  Working out has truly changed me physically and mentally.  If you don't have time to go to the gym theres so many things you can do from home, just stay encouraged and stress free.  peace and love.

This was from one pill! I didn't sleep at all last night, I had to turn off all the lights and tv so I would overstimulate my eyes, and the diarrhea was still occuring up until a couple hours ago. The doctor suggests I half the dose, but I don't know if its worth going through this nightmare again. If you are sensative to medication I would say be careful about your dosage!

column3: don't suggest, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: The doctors don't tell you this, or maybe most of them don't know.  I took Lexapro for a couple of years to deal with depression from a stressful job/condescending boss.  It did work, but when I stopped taking it I started getting brain jolts, zaps in my mouth, dizziness, vertigo type feeling when I would move my eyeballs, spinning when I would move my eyeballs, and I also had headaches.  It is very hard to explain the symptoms, but you know it when you are dealing with it.  I was absolutely miserable.  I didn't know what it was from and ended up at many doctor's offices thinking I had a brain tumor, multiple sclerosis, you name it.  They gave me an MRI of my brain, lots of tests, you name it.  Finally I did some of my own research on the internet and found that there a LOTS of other people that were going through the same thing.  I just had to type in the right thing in google and there it was.  There were so many people with the same problem, not only from Lexapro but other anti-depressants as well.  You would think doctors would know!These horrible things finally went away after about 6 months of torture.  I don't wish what I went through upon anybody.  I guess if you are never planning on getting off the meds then you are ok, but if it's just a temporary thing then I would recondisder.  The withdrawl symptoms are just too much.  I was also suicidal during the withdrawl.  It is out of my system now and I am clean of anything and feel much better.  If only one person reads this and listens to me it will be worth it to save them from something like this.

column3: 2much2do!, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have taken several antidepressents in my life time and I started after my last child when I knew I was in trouble with post pardom depression. I have been off them now for many years until just recently when a family crisis brought me to go back on them.I've been on Lexapro for 5 weeks now and when I first started, I was really tired, could barely work, alot of yawning, jaw clinching, NEVER a problem with sex for me. Haven't seen the weight gain yet. I did notice though at about 5 weeks, on the way to work I felt very bad as if something horrible was going to happen to me. I don't know if I was trying to fight off a panic attack but I finally felt better late afternoon but it was the worst feeling in the world. Like my life was ending right before my eyes and there was nothing I could do to stop it. My girlfriend told me to call my doctor and tell him about it. Never did because the feeling subsided. The problem with me is that I get to feeling better and I get tired of the possible weight gain and ween myself off them. I'm staying on this one for now, seems to be working but is there an antidepressent out there that won't put the weight on?
Worked for a while--quit working.  I am told this is very common with straight SSRI's versus the combo agents.

column3: Batman, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: Started at 10mg via regular Dr.  Ended up seeing a Psych and incresed to 20mg.  Took about 6 weeks on 20mg to get relief, but still get occasional panic attack, but not obsessing about things as much.  As with all treatments, be patient for the drug to work and be sure to seek a therapist/psych-not your regular Dr.  And if the current therapist/psych does not seem to "fit", move on to another until you get the right one.  Again be patient and persistent.  Decreased libido, but worth it.  No weight gain.  Some lethargy.  Increased sweating.  Found out that increasing intensity of exercise helps with the anxiety.  Also helps with my minor OCD of excessive cleaning and organizing... now things are messy, but I can live with it. :-)

column3: j.littrell8525, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column3: Corrie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more
column10: Without Lexapro my life would not be like it is today. My daughter was murdered 31 months ago, and I am raising her three children. Lexapro has kept me on an even path, I have no side effects, and life seems as normal as it can be. I highly recommend Lexapro, I can't live without it.

column3: Bud, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have been taking antidepressants since 1970 and recently came to believe that my depression has been caused by anxiety--worrying constantly sends me into depression.  Lexapro is the first antidepressant (others:elavil, norpramin, prozac, wellbutrin) which has effectively suppressed my anxiety.  I have not felt much, what I might call, joy.  But I have not been deeply depressed for over 3 1/2 months.  I've never gone more than 4 months without sinking into a dark tunnel.  The next month will be crititical, and I hope that I can follow up on these remarks.

column3: Melodious, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column10: I was on this drug for about 6 weeks and noticed a very positive change in my mood as well as less panic attacks with anxiety.  However, right about the six week mark, I woke one morning to swelling in my hands and feet three times the normal size.  I could not fit into my shoes.  Also, my limbs ached terribly like I have never experienced before.  My feet hurt to walk on our hardwood floor, I could not hold a cup of coffee because my fingers ached so badly and I was bedridden for about 3 days because it was too painful to move.  Bloodwork from my doctor revealed a very rare side effect from this drug.  I was terribly disappointed since I really felt this was working for me.  My doctor has given me samples of Effexor to try instead so hopefully this will work.

column3: Catpurrrson, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: This treatment has been mostly successful for me.  The only thing that I have had with it is the fact that since I have been on it I rarely show any emotion.  I hardly ever cry no matter what the situation is and that has even included the death of my husband of 27 years.

column3: jmhclh@peoplepc.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column3: andrew, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

I have more side effects then I did on lexapro.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column10: My doctor put me on Lexapro during a difficult period of my life.  It caused me to have a flat affect as noticed by a friend who didn't know I was taking anything.  Also, I had an incredible weight gain of 30 pounds in about 6 months. I experienced a lack of sex drive and also the inability to have an orgasm.  My husband was away for eight months and I wasn't interested in having sex at all.  Everything returned to normal after I stopped taking it. Lastly, coming off of this drug was shear hell.  I was so sick even though I was reducing extremely slowly.  I experienced what felt like electric shocks in my brain quite frequently.  All I wanted to do was sleep because when I slept, I didn't feel anything.  It was horrible.  I vowed never to take anything again, but recently I was convinced by another doctor to try Wellbutrin.  So far so good.

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)

column3: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
rarefind7, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column10: Beware! Doctors will tell you that you can come off of this med whenever you want, but they don't tell you about the hell of withdrawal effects that you'll have to suffer through in order to do so. I have been off of it for a month now and I'm going through exhausting "electrical shock-like" episodes almost nonstop. It's like being crually tortured! Along with the shocks, I have headaches, anxiety, and "brain farts". If you just want to go on something short term to get through whatever you're going through, I don't recommend this drug. It works very well and I had very few side effects, but plan on staying on it unless you want to see how tuff you really are! If you are a woman and think you might want to get pregnant within the next couple of years, think twice about going on this med or any other like it...doctors recommend coming off of them before conceiving. Look at all of your options, weigh out the good and the bad of each option before making a decision. Just do your research before going on any medication because the doctors won't tell you about how hard it is to come off of them. Good luck!

column3: ChubbyCherubp, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I feel it has helped me and I have been on it for over 2 years almost.  I had been on many other anti-depressants and this is the one that has helped my depression the most.  I am on 30 mg as of just a few days ago.  I was on 20 mg.  I have had no side effects with the medication.  And they are easy to take and do what they are supposed to do.  I was put on them originally by a Psychiatrist and also recommended by my own personl Physician (Internist) who I have 100% trust and faith in.  I can't say the same for the Psyhiatrist as he only saw me for 5 minute intervals and I was out the door.  My own personal Internist can do the same prescribing and spends a lot more time with me.  I will soon be seeing a new Psychiatrist as my Doctor feels I may need a mood stabilizer.  So I don't know with that being thrown into the mix (depending on what the Psychiatrist puts me on) how it will mix with the Lexapro.  My Doctor feels I may be Bi-polar and need a certain medication like Lithium.  But that is up to the Psychiatrist.  When I was on Cymbalta 30 mg I was fine but when the original Psychiatrist prescribed the 60 mg I broke out in hives and a rash all over my body.  My lower lip swelled up and my face some.  I was in agony with that rash off and on for months.  So anyone on Cymbalta beware as this is what happened to me.  I never had one bad side effect from Lexapro.  I know a lot of others on it and they haven't either.  Lexapro is my anti-depressant choice.  And believe me I have been on at least 10 different ones.  Thank you.  Diane L. Christopher diane22@roadrunner.com

I had the weidest sensation that I could not explain until I search the web & found other patient's describing withdrawalsas "BRAIN SHIVERS" - that is exactly how it felt & it went on for weeks after I weaned myself off. NEVER will take this one again!

column3: Deep, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I have found that I feel more centered, calm and peaceful as a result of taking Lexapro. I am very satisfied with the results. And, since I take the medication at night, I sleep more soundly and awaken refreshed and rested.

column3: Summermom3, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was taking Effexor, but had to stop because of extreme hypertension and pulse rate.  I take Wellbutrin with Lexapro, and it has totally changed my mood.  The combination of these medications make it possible to look forward to the future, instead of dreading it.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: I was on 10 mg/day for depression.  The drug helped with my depression but I felt that I could not always think straight.  I experienced weight gain, a decreased sex drive, and major hot flashes on this medication.  I decided to discontinue it and have been experiencing some withdrawal symptoms such as dizziness throughout the day, increased agitation, and others.  Overall, I am glad to be off of the drug.  I had mild depression and now with some lifestyle changes, I feel I can manage without the medication.  For me, the side effects were not worth it.

column3: Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
turnherbrain, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I suffer from moderate to severe OCD. Lexapro (and Celexa) has been the drug that has worked best for me. I've taken almost every SSRI and Lexapro has the fewest side effects and is most effective. It's not perfect... but, I have cognative-behavioral therapy to help there!

column3: Coffeelady, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: I was going through a divorce and was having anxiety issues and also severe depression.  Within 5 weeks I saw a difference in myself and have been exetremely pleased with results of this medication.  I have been on it for 9 months and can honestly say it has been the best thing to happen to me ever. I use to cry all the time even at commercials and now I have better demeanor and even have a better outlook on life. I would definitely recommend this drug for helping with anxiety and depression.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: The drug worked very well for my depression and anxiety but I gained a lot of weight(40 lbs in 8 weeks) and I had no sex drive

column3: MissM479, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Had depression for over 4 years before I began treatment on Lexapro 10Mg within a month I started seeing results. Go back to frequent check ups with my Dr to monitor the medication and side effects.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I have been taking Lexapro since I was 18. It has helped a lot with my depression and my anxiety. I can certainly tell if I forget to take it. I do not like being so dependent on the drug though. If I dont take it every day, I have horrible side effects. I get dizzy, extremely irritable, and nausiated. I haven't experienced any weight change since I've been taking the drug, I just have horrible hot flashes and dry mouth. Overall, the medication has helped my anxiety and although the side effects suck, I can't imagine not taking Lexapro

column3: 1happypill, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column10: the anxiety still comes and goes...but atleast its not as bad as it was. i've gained 10 pounds on it...thats depressing in itself.. maybe Lexapro is not for everyone atleast not for me.

column3: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column10: I would not take this medicine again. It worked pretty well for my anxiety and depression, but there were too many negative side effects. I lost interest in sex, gained weight, and got frequent headaches. I had to wean off of it when I found out I was pregnant and weaning caused me nausea, headaches, tiredness, dizziness, depression, and mood swings. Also, when I started the medicine I did not feel like myself for the first few weeks. I felt drugged up and out of it.

column3: fiero_lilly, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: My psychiatrist diagnosed me with severe depression when I was 16 and prescribed me with 10 mg. Instantly I was experiencing severe weight loss due to a decreased appetite. I dropped to 90 lbs. My doctor stated this was normal but that the dose needed to be increased. So I took 20 mg. I still had no appetite, My body felt weightless when I walked and I experienced severe dizziness. I told my doctor and she did nothing, so I stop seeing her and stopped the medication. To me, that was certainly NOT normal!

column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column10: This is the second SSRI that has stopped working spontaneously on me after four or five months.

column3: Dupree, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column10: Becoming acclimated to the "side-effects" occurring from use of this medication was easier with a long term mindset that it would do its job eventually.  It did.  Lexapro has been a terrific help for my feelings of depression and social anxiety.  I would have never believed it would give me the confidence to climb out of the black hole I often found myself.  The side effects are real - but they did subside for me.  The most frustrating side effect that I've had to accept is that it takes longer (sometimes frustratingly longer) to climax sexually.  Certainly I could see the beneficial aspects Lexapro would have on someone experiencing premature ejaculation issues.
